Reviews.Title: “Cool and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: jandj555
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a queen deluxe room on the first floor for four nights. Our room wasn't facing the street and didn't have a view, but we didn't have a lot of street noise either. It was just spacious enough, and I loved the style-- contemporary but could still feel the history. They made smart use of the small bathroom by having plenty of shelf space. Everything was very clean and comfortable. The staff was all very friendly. The lobby was understandably a little messy as they were remodeling it during our stay, but there were pictures showing what they were planning and it should look great once its finished. Very convenient location too. There is a subway stop a couple blocks down and we used it to go everywhere, which I actually really enjoyed. Then central park is just a few blocks over. The neighborhood had a community feel to it, and plenty of restaurants. I like to try different hotels for fun, but I'd be tempted to come back to this one again!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel on upper west side”
Reviews.Author: weddingSouthWales
Reviews.Content: great hotel for a few days stay to explore new york. fantastic location on the upper west side close to natural history museum and central park .

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Great Value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: kharrell545
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Belleclaire is situated in a fabulous location on the Upper West Side of NYC. It's conveniently located two blocks from the subway and is right down the street from a great grocery store, fantastic restaurants, a bakery, etc. Also, Central Park is only a five minute walk from the hotel. Who could ask for more in terms of location? Our room was newly-remodeled and included a mini-fridge. The lobby is undergoing some construction, which was a bit of a pain, but the hotel management was apologetic, so in the scheme of things, it was no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “hotel belleclaire new york city”
Reviews.Author: 57jazzman
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Belleclaire is one of the best kept secrets on the upper west side! It provides a first class experience at a very competitive price! I have taken 3 schools groups there and will make it a fourth our next visit to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Joan M
Reviews.Content: The hotel Belleclaire was a life saver on a last minute trip to New York. The rate was great for NYC. This hotel is in a beautiful, safe neighborhood close to upper west side shopping, theater and restaurants and it is easy to get anywhere in the city from this area. The hotel is clean with great decor and the staff could not have been nicer or more accomodating to us out of towners! We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Service was AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica F
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days in the summer, and it was the perfect location. It was a couple blocks from the park and easy access to the trains. The first night we stayed in a standard room. It was a little dated and too small for us. We paid a few dollars to upgrade to a deluxe king and it was big, especially for NYC. The elevators were painfully slow, but we were vacationing and didn't much care. Sometimes we took the stairs, sometimes the service elevator, and sometimes we just waited. For a business trip, that might make me a little anxious. The best part was the service. I travel for work and have stayed in a lot of hotels, but the service here was the best I have ever experienced. The valet gave us a spot right outside the door free of charge (minus a huge tip), the upgrade experience was quick and easy, and every interaction was positive. I will absolutely stay here again and have plans to this year. Side note - we ate at Copolla's - YUM!

Reviews.Title: “Much Improved”
Reviews.Author: TheOp001
Reviews.Content: Since last summer, this hotel has upgraded its service and decor. Desk staff is much more attentive to guest check in and check out for a quick, hassle-free experience. New carpet and a fresh coat of paint really brighten up the hotel. I feel much better now about staying here. The price is a great deal compared to what you could easily pay in Manhattan for the size of the room - decent size and not a shoebox. Plus the location is close to the 79th St. #1 subway stop so Lincoln Center and Times Square are minutes away. Big ups!

Reviews.Title: “Room too Hot - but would stay again”
Reviews.Author: seaislecity2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot of potential- but needs some detail work - First off I would stay again - Great location - quiet so you can sleep - nice bed - good room condition (small room but this is NYC) - - However, The room was at least at 90 degrees when we went in and we could not get it cooled down - thankfully there was a window in the room (nice feature) and we kept it open the whole time. Bathroom shower curtain was moldy but I did let them know and I have a feeling they would fix that. Lobby was under construction so no judge of anything other than room.

Reviews.Title: “great room, super location”
Reviews.Author: jon s
Reviews.Content: recently had the pleasure of staying here, room was huge by any NY standard. Location was awesome just a block away from tons of eateries and bars.short walk to central park and museums which was great for the kids. the staff was super friendly and helpful . all around great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Quartermaine
Reviews.Content: Even though the lobby is minimized right now, as they add a lobby bar, it was not at all inconvenient. The guestroom was sleek, clean, comfortable with all the amenities I needed...and the staff was fantastic! My room came with a refrigerator, and their is a true supermarket, I think it is called Westside Market, a couple doors down, so I could fill my fridge and save some money. The free WiFi worked great!! And the complimentary coffee was a nice touch, too. AND, the HD flat screen TV had two HBO channels. the hotel is surrounded by great restaurants (I ate at Copolla's one night), and the subway station a couple blocks away was perfect (the express is a one stop to time square) for my business appointments! I can't wait to come back in May and see the new lobby bar! This was the best value I have found in NYC! I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in New York!!”
Reviews.Author: Deena M
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Bellclaire hotel. It is at a great location- right on Broadway Ave., and near a subway stop. The staff were gracious and helpful. There is a cute little gym which I used a couple of times and a great guest lounge that has complimentary hot drinks and snacks. Great to grab a cup of tea and an oatmeal cookie when you come in from the NY cold! The rooms were comfortable and promptly cleaned and tidied. We definitely recommend the Bellclaire hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better with a little tlc”
Reviews.Author: Scifisiren
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day break in NY staying at the Belleclaire We used trip advisor when choosing where to stay, so hope this helps! We stayed in a broadway king which look very inviting on the hotel website photos. The rooms are clean and the bed is huge and comfortable. However, the bathroom is a huge let down, cramped and dated with a shower head over the bath and shower curtain. There were bits of broken tiles on the floor behind the sink and the grout was coming loose in many places. Main moan was that it was SO noisy. We were nine floors up and could hear conversations from the street! Broadway has constant traffic noise all night. To be fair the hotel can't legislate for this but the racket from the street was well matched by the noise from the internal plumbing. We had to sleep with ear plugs in. Our radiator leaked and left pools of water on the floor each day we were there. After reporting it 3 times we gave up and mopped it up ourselves , even though they sent someone to 'fix'it each time. Last whinge (honest), the two elevators that serve the whole hotel are like cupboards and not for the claustrophobic. The positives are that it's in a great location, the fitness room, tv and beds were all great . We wouldn't stay there again, but this is a decent mid priced hotel for those who can live with the points raised above.

Reviews.Title: “A class above the rest!”
Reviews.Author: Alicia M
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Parlor Suite Room and couldn't have been more pleased! My room was huge (especially for NYC standards) and it was super cute. I had a separate room that was not only great for relaxing and doing work, but I even was able to have some friends over for a little get together. The hotel is in a great location as well. I couldn't have been more surprised at the elite service I experienced there during my stay. I was warmly greeted every day and the fresh coffee available in the morning was an added plus. I will most definitely stay here again the next time I'm in New York. It's a boutique hotel that's a class above the rest!

Reviews.Title: “Belleclaire is missing the “belle””
Reviews.Author: MLF1955
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed at this hotel a few times now. I love the location and neighbourhood-feel. However, construction and renovations were going on, not just in the lobby, but on all other floors as well. And the pricing had not changed! Dry-wall dust and cardboard-covered the hallway carpets. Ladders left just enough room for rollerboard suitcases to get by. The guest lounge was strewn with newspapers, no hot water was available for tea and cereal bars were broken and crumbly. It was far from welcoming and felt rather down at the heels. While it was only the first week in March, the room was so hot and stuffy that I had to put the air conditioner on. It sounded like a jet plane taking off. (I remembered this from a summer stay and thought it was just an isolated room, but this one was the same.) When I couldn’t sleep because of the turbo-jet sound, I turned it off. Then an orchestra of rattling pipes and humming mini-fridge tuned up. I don’t know which was worse! The rooms are pleasant enough but don’t stay here until the renovations are done. The Belleclaire is missing the “belle” and is quite a mess in its current state.

Reviews.Title: “Under construction”
Reviews.Author: imcharlz
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3/8/12 after reading good reviews. We stay in NY hotels two or three times a year. The lobby is under renovation, They are using a side door and temporary front desk. The elevators are tiny, the halls narrow and the rooms are spartan. It's an old building in need of updating. Stay here during updating if you get a great rate. It was clean enough and the bed was okay. Noisy pipes and street noise were a sleep hindurance. I don't want to say don't stay there, but they should be offering deep discounts during transition.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, dusty rooms, crunching heating radiator”
Reviews.Author: AbossAka
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights in a double double, possibly at a worst time - while the hotel lobby was undergoing renovation. A disgusting cockroach was waiting in the middle of our room, as soon as we walked in. We were extremely tired, so tried to ignore this fact, and went to sleep. The heating radiator every once in a while makes a loud crunching sound (as if someone is hitting it with a hammer on a lower floor), so woke up a few times. My wife developed a terrible skin rash after the first night (bed bugs?) and I had to run to the nearby pharmacy to get some medications for that. Unbeatable location, but the rooms are quite small (even by NYC standards) for a double double, extremely dusty with somewhat superficial cleaning (try moving your bed slightly or moving the curtains). The staff were polite and professional, the bell-men are extremly nice, the cleaning people may need some more training. I was happy to move out of this hotel thought after the second night - and probably would not rush back to this hotel, next time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimhelzel
Reviews.Content: We had a double double room this past weekend. (2/24), We were very pleased. The room was clean, modern and quiet. Hotel is "New York small" but very adequate. Rooms were very clean. They offer a small lounge for guests including coffee and papers and TV. The 77th and Broadway location is excellent. Subway nearby as are many stores and restaurants. The Fairway Grocery store is several blocks down. The hotel is on a side street so no noise. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Price (on a winter special) was excellent...compared to nearby On the Ave. and Lucerne. Would definitely recommend for a stay. Clientele was multinational, tending towards European.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time in NYC - lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: NanJ55
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at HB!! The front desk staff was very welcoming and helpful. We were surprised to find our room ready for us upon our arrival at 11:00 am. We were just planning to store our luggage until later in the day. The room was very nicely done, clean, modern design, internet and refrigerator. Nice products in the bathroom. The room got a bit warm at night but the radiator heat was adjustable. The front lobby is under renovation right now but there was no visible construction mess or noise. It was simply blocked off. There is a guest courtesy lounge room with coffee, tea, water, snacks, TV and computer. There is a great market around the corner with just about everything. So, it is convenient to be able to buy some drinks or snacks. There is a concierge at the front desk. The location of W 77th and Broadway was perfect for us to explore Central Park and museums in the area. Very pleasant area - everything we were interested in was within walking distance. We would recommend it. Also, since we were celebrating our 20th anniversary, they surprised us with a bottle of champagne in the room. Nice! So, this hotel was an affordable gem in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Good Boutique Hotel With Terrible Cleaning Staff”
Reviews.Author: jaclynivy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated on a side street in one of Manhattan's best neighborhoods. It's got small but cleverly appointed rooms with modern furniture and new amenities. It's a good-looking place with very friendly people at the front desk. There's a small fitness-center and an area on the first floor where coffee is available. The beds are comfortable. When we arrived the bathroom hadn't been cleaned adequately since the prior guest's departure. I notified the hotel staff, but nothing was done, so I had to call again to get this taken care of. When we departed two days later we found the people cleaning the room had thrown away a few of our possessions, which clearly were not garbage. All told, this is a good place for those who want to enjoy the Upper West Side of Manhattan -- Central and Riverside Parks, Lincoln Center, The Museum of Natural History, the Columbia University Campus, an array of great restaurants -- or venture across or downtown. The prices are reasonable, but guests should beware: the people who clean are not competent.

Reviews.Title: “a deal and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sandra M
Reviews.Content: The Belleclaire was doing renovations to their lobby, so maybe that's why I got a room for $90 a night..unheard of in NY. My room was tiny, but had everything I needed, bed, desk, bath, wifi, TV, and even a fridge. Just enough room to walk around. It was overheated but I figured out how to turn off the radiator and opened a window and it was fine. My room was quiet and the bed was firm and comfortable. I loved the location because the subway was very close, as was the cross town bus which went right through central park near the Met and the Whitney. And there was a super amazing grocery store one block away, where I bought breakfast for my room and other great take-out food. Also near Zabri's, a famous kitchen store and deli. I could walk to the Lincoln Center. Staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Clean, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ctconnecticut
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from spending the night in New York at the Belleclaire Hotel and had a very nice stay. I have to admit upon reading other reviews I was a little nervous about a few things, some reviews stated that the elevators were extremley slow, we had absolutely NO problems with the elevators. Also, some of the reviews described the bathrooms as unsightly, we found our bathroom to be very clean, small, but up to date, (no ugly green tiles). The room WAS very hot, but since I had read about the warmness of the rooms I came prepared with a t-shirt and boxer shorts to lounge around in for the brief time we actually were in the room, we also kept the window cracked open the whole time and this made things very comfortable. Shower pressure and water temperature were just perfect. At night, of course being in the city, there is always traffic and some sort of noise and since we had to keep the window open a bit the noise comes in, but it was no big deal, if something like that would be bothersome, i suggest earplugs, they work really well, even keeping out the noise of a snoring spouse! =) The lobby was under construction but was still neatly kept. So the ONLY complaint we could come up with is that the hotel does not have a restaurant and/or bar, although there is PLENTY of places a few steps away from the hotel, even a 24/7 market just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Got what i paid for”
Reviews.Author: BPinRI
Reviews.Content: I was in town for work and needed to be on the upper west side. Location was great. Close to subway and nice block. The room was tiny (by NY standards), faucet was loose, radiator clanked but i booked online for $130. It was fine but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “returning in March 2012”
Reviews.Author: watsonkaren
Reviews.Content: In March 2012 we will return to the Hotel Belleclaire after 2 years (last time was March 2010). On our last visit, we loved the location and the staff were very good. With 2 teens, it made a difference to us that the area is safe and alive at night, but fairly quiet. As several people have mentioned, the great grocery store and Manhattan Diner nearby make it easy to eat well. We walked across Central Park each day. This time we plan to take advantage of the American History Museum only blocks away. Hoping for 2 connecting rooms (more privacy this time). Also hoping that the entrance construction doesn't affect our sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Second time we have stayed there”
Reviews.Author: HK46
Reviews.Content: We were happy to return to the Belleclaire. We had stayed there exactly one year ago, so it was our first choice for a place to stay when returning to NYC. The rooms have been upgraded during the past year and it is still in the affordable range. The location is perfect--right on Broadway, close to everything, including a subway express station. The rooms are kept too warm, however, so we like to be able to open a window, which we did. The first night the window was very tiny and there was no view, so we asked to change to a different room. They accommodated us willingly and moved our luggage, so the next night we had a room with a big window and overlooking Broadway. We were pleased with the visit and will stay there again. The lobby is being redone at this moment and we hope they don't raise their prices just because they have a nicer lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ambystoma1
Reviews.Content: All in all this was a nice hotel. I stayed two nights in early December while traveling for business. The hotel seems a bit pricey for the quality, but not when compared to other NYC hotels. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was clean, and the location was good - a short walk to subway stops, the American Museum of Natural History, and Central Park. The building is a bit odd, with small crooked hallways, but I found this charming - it seems to be an older building. The one problem that I had was with climate control. It was fairly cold outside, but my room was so hot that I had to run a window AC unit continuously to get the room down to a reasonable temperature (and I'm a person who hates the cold and likes a warm room - this was just way too much heat). This was the case even after I adjusted my radiator to the lowest setting. I'm not sure if this was just my room or if the problem happens elsewhere in the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for families”
Reviews.Author: rilestar
Reviews.Content: Having been to New York a number of times before, this time, with three young children in tow (aged 7, 5 and 3), we decided we wanted to stay in the Upper West Side due to its proximity to Central Park and, in particular, the American Museum of Natural History. We discovered the Hotel Belleclaire by searching for "family hotel" and "upper west side", and despite there being a few options, we were swayed by the fact that Mark Twain once stayed there! Probably not the best reason when spending a couple of grand (for five nights), but once we arrived and checked in we were very pleased with our decision. The family room we had booked was ENORMOUS (for New York) - basically two good sized bedrooms with a doorway (though not a door) between them. One 'room' had two Queen beds, and the other (the parent's room) had one Queen bed, and each had a TV. It also had a little fridge and microwave, which is good when you have kids. It was only a few blocks to watch the Thanksgiving Day Parade (and the balloon inflating thing the night before is on the same street - 77th), and there was a great pub with microbrewed beers on 76th and Amsterdam (the Amsterdam Ale House), which served a Thanksgiving dinner for us un-American tourists. We only discovered late that the grocery store around the corner on Broadway (Westside Market) was also enormous - much bigger than it appears from the front and with a huge selection of awesome food and beers. Finally, the staff were very friendly and accommodating. Two things they really helped us with was assisting with getting some boxes picked up by a freight company to send home to Australia, and also helping us with a minivan to take the five of us and our mega-luggage to the airport after we checked out. All much appreciated, and staying here helped alleviate some of the stress of travelling with young children.

Reviews.Title: “great upper west side hotel”
Reviews.Author: abhishekmehra
Reviews.Content: this hotel has some unique features- old style charm meets contemporary style. very friendly staff and great location, the rooms could be more spacious however it is something you can ignore with all the other perks. also well priced!! the power did go off in typical NYC fashion but it was 100F!!! CLOSE PROXIMITY TO A LOCAL MARKET FOR GROCERIES IS A BONUS!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: MCD20097576
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a mini-vacation in NYC and wanted a place to stay that fit a small budget. The Hotel BelleClaire reminds us of European hotels we have stayed in before-the rooms are small but efficient. The surrounding neighborhood had lots of interesting food and shopping, but was relatively quiet. We were warmly received by the staff at the front desk. Our room was clean and comfortable. Our only hope is that the rates don't increase! At checkout, we asked to see a family suite in case we decided to bring the kids next time. The desk clerk happily escorted us up to a room and let us look around. The location was a little more difficult to get from the airport via public transportation since the number 7 is undergoing service changes, but a transfer at Times Square was an easy fix.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a few quirks”
Reviews.Author: jr89
Reviews.Content: Our daughter is living in the Upper West Side and we wanted to visit her staying in a convenient, comfortable and reasonably priced hotel; the Belleclaire was a pretty good choice. The hotel location is excellent, just a few blocks from the subway, within walking distance of Central Park and Riverside Park and in an area of cafes and food shops. If Broadway is too busy then Amsterdam and Columbus are close at hand. Staff were very helpful at check in and again any time we had a request. When my wife found the hairdryer was missing one was delivered to the room in minutes. House keeping was good and every one we spoke to was friendly. Our room was a decent size a for New York hotel and very comfortable but here come the quirks. There was an old fashioned cast iron radiator which could take 10/15 minutes to warm up and then roasted us and likewise the shower sometimes needed to be run for 5 minutes before providing hot water. Let me be clear these did not cause real problems but did need a little adjustment. I was reminded of my stays in Scottish hotels rather than American ones. Our other problem was no coffee maker in our room - a first for us in America. Now there was excellent free coffee in the lobby but this was only available 7am-4pm. Arriving in to our room about 5pm after a hectic day in NY a reviving cup of tea or coffee would have been welcome. The lobby itself opened directly on to the street and in January was freezing and had limited seating but there were free newspapers. We would definitely go back to the Belleclaire and if they put a coffee maker in the room the score goes up to 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but room freezing cold!!!”
Reviews.Author: Diana K
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I were in NYC for one of our frequent long weekend trips to the big city. This hotel was a lovely, older style boutique hotel in a great location. Everything was well appointed and clean. That said, it was a cold, January weekend in NYC and our room and bathroom were freezing cold! The hotel had an old radiator, steam heating system, but the windows definitely need to be replaced as freezing cold air was literally blowing in from the windows in our room and bathroom, completely negating any heat offered by the room's radiator. After complaining the first night, the hotel staff sent up a space heater, which, unfortunately did little to combat the cold air drafting in through the windows. It was obvious that other guests were experiencing the same problem, based on conversations at the front desk, and the evidence of several space heaters left by maid service at the elevator areas after servicing checkout rooms. After a second complaint, the front desk sent a mainteance man up to our room. He shared that he was busy with many calls for cold rooms. He actually lowered our bedroom window and draped a blanket over it and shoved it closed and then stuffed extra towels along the base of the window. Unfortunately this did little to stop the draft whistling in from the sides of the bedroom window. We then confiscated another space heater from the hallway, and when 2 space heaters wouldn't warm our room sufficiently, we finally marched down to the lobby and registered a "face-to-face" complaint. The staff offered to move us to another, warmer room, and after trying several new rooms with them, we finally settled on a somewhat "warmer" room and moved all of our belongings (and one of our space heaters) to the new room. What a pain, although all the activity did help to warm us up! After spending the day out and about in NYC in the freezing cold temperatures, we returned to our new, warmer room to find the radiator completely cold and the room quite chilly! Fortunately, we still had the space heater, which we literally had to run constantly to remain confortable, even throughout our sleeping hours, which I wasn't real happy about. Our room radiator did actually spring to life and give off sufficient heat one time, when it awakend us with it's clangs and clunks at 6:08 a.m. Unfortunately that was the first and last time the thing gave off any heat during the remainder of our stay. Topping off all of this was the fact that I blew a circuit in our room when I turned on the hair dryer the next morning, and plunged our room into total darkness, because the space heater and hair dryer apparently caused an overload. After fumbling in the dark, I was able to locate the phone and call the front desk. They hustled a serviceman up and he reset the breaker and I was able to continue drying my hair, without the space heater running. While we were checking out, we voiced our dissatisfaction with the heating system, and were offered a meal voucher, which we turned down as we were heading out of town. During our checkout, another couple were voicing the same complaint to the other desk clerk. My advice regarding this hotel would be to book it only in mild weather months and to be sure to ask for a room with a working radiator!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jlullman
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for 5 nights of theater and sightseeing! Location is great; winter pricing made it a terrific deal. Room was clean and quiet (initially hot; but turning off the radiator and opening a window solved that) with a handy refrigerator (Zabars is 2 blocks away!). Staff was very friendly, helpful and quick to respond. Look forward to returning (we were there January, 2011, as well)!

Reviews.Title: “Hot, hot, hot - not in a good way”
Reviews.Author: SomewhatSelective
Reviews.Content: Booked a standard room for a decent price, and at first we were pleased enough with what we saw - clean, not too tiny, great location if you want the Upper West Side, which we did. Weather was quite cold outside, which led management to turn up the heat - way up! No thermostat in room, and although we turned the radiator entirely off, the room was sweltering thanks to hot pipes in the walls. Called down to the front desk, who sent up a man whose only advice was to open the window, which we did, as far as possible (had already opened the one in the bathroom), but due to some law of physics, the air masses inside and outside the room did not want to move (window opened onto back of the building, loud generator noise), and so the room remained so hot that we had to sleep - when we could - on top of the covers. Front desk said they couldn't move us until the next morning (when we were due to check out). Mentioned the situation the next morning when we checked out and we were offered vouchers for certain breakfast or lunch items at a diner two blocks down Broadway. Other things that had initially escaped our notice but became relevant were the absence of any place to put more than one suitcase - no furniture, and only one suitcase stand. No closet, no hooks in the room to hang coats - only hangers on the inside of the bathroom door. No shelf inside shower for shampoo, etc. If you go in the summer, expect a window air conditioning unit. Would we return? If we needed to be on the Upper West Side, and only during the spring or fall when heating and cooling aren't an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: cjc04
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Belleclaire. The location is great. It is located in a very safe and clean area of the city, and close to parks, which I like for running. Also, there is a grocery store right around the corner, which is great because the rooms have small refrigerators. It's also about 2 blocks from the Subway, which is really handy. I originally had a standard room with a King, but the room was very small. I upgraded to a suite for a reasonable price. The suite was huge. It had a living room, entry area, big bedroom and bathroom. I think it was likely larger than my first apartment. The rooms are very clean, but the sheets need to be replaced. They seemed a little tattered. The bed was pretty comfortable, and the room was a very quiet at night. My biggest complaint is that I could not really control the heat and my room was really hot for sleeping. Also, when I turned on the AC to cool the room, it made a horrible banging noise. Finally, there was construction going on around the building, which was very loud during the day. If the hotel can fix the heating/cooling issue, I would likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, Spacious (For NY standards), and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Filipe G
Reviews.Content: We just had one night getaway to celebrate our anniversary, we were in vegas, San fran, and finished the trip in NYC. Mind this: We do not like NYC, we only went there to meet friends, and check out a few spots. We have been there many times, but prefer to stay away. The hotel is in excellent shape. 3 elevators, coffee in the morning, hot cocoa in the afternoon, two blocks away from 79th st subway stop, and in a great location. Our room was small, but large for NYC, it was super clean, nice hardwood floor, AC/Heat, spacious and modern bathrooms, Flat screen panels attached to the wall, fridge, everything you would wish for. The hotel acknowledged our anniversary, and it truly made us feel special. I highly recommend this hotel. NYC can be adventurous not knowing where to stay, but we are happy we found this location.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed”
Reviews.Author: RevTC
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our stay here. They upgraded us to a nicer room, service was prompt and friendly, location is great, fast wifi and business center available for printing, winter special pricing, free hot chocolate/coffees all day, free newspapers. the room was clean, spacious, well decorated. only hiccup was a few problems with our heater but they were quick to bring a portable replacement. would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot for families on Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: DanManDC
Reviews.Content: Great location, right near the Natural History Museum, Central Park & 2 blocks from a nice little playground. We booked a family suite, which had 2 rooms & 3 beds -- pretty decent-sized room by my experience with NYC hotels. Rooms are very clean and a good value, too. My only complaint -- when we first arrived, with a car full of luggage, the bell team were nowhere to be found so I had to unload & bring all the stuff into the lobby myself. Once we found them, they were happy to help. This was really the only concern we had the whole weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good hotel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: ilovenyc
Reviews.Content: We decided to try this little hotel because of the great location on the upper west side of ny. We booked a double double online and the price was right for the week before christmas. The hotel is around the corner on 77th st and broadway and because i know the neighborhood it was easy to find but it looks like a regular apartment building to those who would not know it was there. It is truly a small hotel. The lobby is tiny but clean and check in was quick and easy. Our room was in the back of the hotel so no view at all (just an air shaft with rooms from another part of the hotel feet away) but we are not particularly fussy and for the money it was fine. Bathroom was presentable. Nyc apts tend to be very hot in the winter because you can not control the heat so the room got very hot and it wasnt until a few nights in to our stay did i realize i could turn on the air conditioner to fan only to get some outside air in to the sweltering room. The hotel has a small work out room but one doesnt need it if walking in ny and free newspapers are in lobby every day. This hotel has free wi fi and coffee in the lobby for free. All in all it was a great hotel on a budget and the neighborhood is wonderful and should not be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: aridley21
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for it's price and location and it didn't disappoint. The upper west side is perfect, close enough to walk to mid town and there was a subway 2 blocks away. When we checked in they upgraded us to a deluxe queen room which was fantastic. My only complaint was that the room was ridiculously hot and the radiator wouldn't turn off, we slept with the window open all night to get a comfortable temperature. I highly recommend Big Nicks on Broadway in the same building downstairs, their burgers are incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Schneide
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Thanksgiving break and the hotel was very accomodating. We were blocks way from the Macy's Thanksgiving day parade. The rooms were quite small, even by NYC standards,but the hotel was very quiet. We had a King bed and needed a rollaway for our daughter. The rollaway bed was wedged next to the King bed, we booked our room just weeks before so we had no choice. I would not recommend a rollaway even though it is OK? Lobby has free coffee until midday and it was excellent. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. The rooms did show some wear. Red Line subway stop is just a few blocks away so it is easy to get up and down the island. There are many shops and restaraunts in the area. We always stay Upper West Side and feel more like a local then a tourist!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: malbruMontreal
Reviews.Content: My second stay in this hotel and so much better. Rooms great. Checked in early without problem. Valet parking worked well. Had problem understanding safe in room and was responded to immediately. Concierge service great as well. Location is perfect steps from Central Park and NYC subway. Will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Wendyp14
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very small. Elavator holds 4 people cramped with luggage.. Rooms are small as well. When I pulled the chair away from the desk the back was touching the bed. No one could get around the chair to to bathroom. The shower head is very outdated, single head function. Therefore no massage feature after a long day in the city. Not to mention the water drain was slow so you had to stand in almost an inch of water as you showered. The room was very hot. Even shutting off the radiator it was still hot. New years eve and we turned the ac on. I booked the hotel with four quest. There were towels for two guest only. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: TeemHD
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Belleclaire and it exceeded our expectations. The service was great, the staff goes out of their way to tell you their favorite places to eat and one guy even mapped out the subway system for us. We would definitely stay here again, maybe the only downside was the view was of a building but when your in NYC you will never be in your room anyway so to us it wasn't a deal breaker. Its only 2 blocks from the subway so that was a plus. Great vacation, can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “COMING AGAIN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: foronceinmylife24
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! We were able to get a last minute room at the begining of December. The staff was so accommodating, and the rooms were gorgeous! We are coming to New York for a broadway show January 6-8th, and have already booked our reservations here again!!! This place is a STEAL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with the family!”
Reviews.Author: Josephine64
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Belleclaire, and it was great. It's tough to find comfortable, reasonably priced accomodations for a family of five, but the family suite at the Belleclaire was perfect. Very comfortable beds, good pillows, hardwood floors, a small microwave and fridge provided all we needed. The bathroom is small, but there's plenty of hot water and good water pressure (a "must have" for our teens!). The subway stop is about a block away, and there are several places for a quick bite to eat (pizza, breakfast, deli, bakery, coffee shop) within a block or two. It's just a short walk to Lincoln Center, Central Park, and the Museum of Natural History. We've already booked another stay for next month!

Reviews.Title: “My new New York Address!”
Reviews.Author: Em C
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed our stay at this amazing boutique hotel. I expected the room to be much smaller but I was pleasantly surprised that it was bigger than I thought. Take note, I have a friend who lives in the Upper West Side and our hotel room was so much bigger than her apartment. The room, including the bathroom, was so clean and tidy. The beds were so comfy. The amenities were wonderful. The only downside is the banging noise, perhaps from the radiator?, but it was no big deal because we used the A/C fan to mask it and slept through the night. My husband and I travelled with two teenagers and they were very much impressed. Parking was easy; we found a spot on 78th and saved money by not leaving the car in the garage overnight. The subway is conveniently located a couple of blocks away. There are a lot of restaurants nearby. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The best part was that we didn't break the bank to stay at this conveniently located hotel. New York is expensive enough as it is. I will definitely stay here the next time I am in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever!!”
Reviews.Author: subfam4
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel immensely. We had a wonderful room at an affordable price. The bed and linens were super comfortable. Internet was fast. Room was very updated. Bathroom was small but expected. We did not visit NYC to spend our time in the bathroom, anyway!! Awesome and very helpful staff. The bellhop, Jake even found us a convenient parking space so we could avoid the valet charge. We did not have to move our car once. Very close to the subway. You could get on Line 1 and just go!!! Great location. Everything is right by. Delicious European cafe (we ate breakfast every morning there and Big Nicks is full of good things to eat (every type of food you fancy). The room was a bit warm but it was the 8th floor and heat rises and we had 4 large windows that we opened nightly. Some posts were about noise. When we visit NYC we like to live like New Yorkers. It is the city that never sleeps EXPECT noise. It was not unbearable. I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC!! We have stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square often and this beats it and half the price. Ignore the bad reviews if you are looking for a hotel in a great area, awesome and helpful staff, affordable price, and close to everything you could possible need. Put your walking shoes on and just go. You would be surprised how close everything is. If you enjoy the subway experience, take it. It is very easy to use, affordable to use and safe. I will definitely be staying at the Hotel Belleclaire. Did I forget to mention the slippers, chocolates and wine opener that was left in the room for our use??? Wow!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value boutique hotel on Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: CoolAZMom
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Belleclaire is situated in a refurbished pre-War building on West 77th Street at the corner of Broadway. Although the rooms are typically small, as one should expect in NYC, the furnishings are artistic and the floors hardwood.The best part was the beds in our double room: firm and so comfortable that we slept for 10 hours and woke up incredibly refreshed.I liked the mini fridge in the room and there are complimentary coffee, tea and newspapers in the lobby. The hotel fitness room was surprisingly well equipped with elliptical trainers, treadmills, free weights, a cable weight machine, mats and a stability ball. We would definitely stay here again. Do note there is no restaurant on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for New York and group or family”
Reviews.Author: zippippilly
Reviews.Content: We [6 adults in family group] stayed 6 nights in the large room. We had a queen in one room and 2 doubles in second. These are not separate rooms but separated from each other. the 1 bathroom is in the main area. this is small and has only room for shower over bath and the wc. We had no trouble with this although it delayed our getting out in the mornings. The service was excellent,position is fabulous and we got a great price through expedia. For new york we feel we got a bargain as it worked out about $60 AUD per person including taxes etc per night. Room was clean and serviced well,concierge very helpful,there are computers and printers in entry,free wifi,Big Nicks just around corner that is open 24 hrs for any food you like. Walk to central Park and the Museum. About a block to subway. i would stay here again. Would have given 5 rating if bathroom bigger.

Reviews.Title: “GOT NO SLEEP ALL NIGHT”
Reviews.Author: jerseyguy27
Reviews.Content: So the hotel is a converted apartment building. nice lobby but the rooms....not good. They were clean and newer furniture (except the dirty grout in the shower) but there was a lot of comfort issues. The heat...stiffling no way to lower the temp (no thermostat) just an old cast iron heater that made a lot of banging noises all night. window didn't stay open so it was a bad night. the room is also tiny and only analog,unclear picture on the tv but that isn't even that important. bottom line was no sleep and woke in the morning totally unrefreshed. there are better choices in the city for the money

Reviews.Title: “It's nice.”
Reviews.Author: andy f
Reviews.Content: Well, let me just say pictures do miracles. BUT I must say, staff is very very nice, my room was very clean and the queen bed was comfy. I asked for a roll up bed for my daughter, it was horrible springs were out and poking everywhere, you might as well pay extra for a legitimate bed. It's in a safe location HOWEVER I was told it was very close to Times Sq. It is not. For a tourist not oriented with the city this can be a hassle, even though the subway stop is 2 blocks away, you have to take 4 stops to get to Times Square and on your way back, its like 10 stops ( very confusing) Take a cab it will cost like $12.00 to get from Times Square to the hotel. The overall experience was good, but I honestly think it should be a little less expensive for the quality. You can easily pay the same amount of money for a bigger,better, closer to tourist site, hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience but request bigger room.”
Reviews.Author: Sbates313
Reviews.Content: Our family chose hotel belleclaire because of the value and reviews. It was overall a great experience. We arrived very late and we given a very small room. For a family of four, we would not be able to walk. However, once I requested a bigger room, they accommodated us and moved us the next day while we were out. The location and cleanliness were top notch. Even though the cable was out for two days and the heating was funky, we had a great time. I also recommend visiting Big Nicks.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Jaiyd_Talent
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 4 nights in December. It was great value. The hotel itself was very well kept, our rooms were clean and tidy and it was in a good location. The subway that went to all the main stops was 2 streets away, which isn't far at all. You could easily walk to central park as we did a few times and the Museum of Natural History was at the other end of the street! I would recommend that if you are going to use the subway often, to purchase a metro card for $29 as you can use it as many times as you want over 7 days. We didn't do this and as a result we ended up paying more by paying for single journeys. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The only thing I would fault is that the room got very hot at night. Also the TV did not work on our first night, the staff said that it was out for the whole hotel. They got it working the next day, but this didn't really bother us as we only wanted it on while we were getting ready, and as they had an ipod dock we used this instead! We really enjoyed our stay and wouldn't hesitate to return!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Moongardners
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife have just returned from NY having spent 5 nights at this hotel. Like most of the other reviews on here, we agree that the best thing about the Belleclaire is the location. The hotel itself is a lovely old building with not so lovely plumbing keeping the rooms warm. The clanking and knocking coming from the radiator kept me awake on our first night but after walking miles around Manhattan on the subsequent days sleeping at night was not a problem! What we liked most was coming out of the mayhem of Midtown and walking up from Columbus Circle and up Broadway which got more and more sedate the closer we got to the hotel. We also got the Metro to and fro Midtown using the station at 72nd Street on Broadway. We felt safe walking around here late at night and there are some great restaurants nearby. We had breakfast in Big Nicks which was virtually next door - don't expect posh but do expect decent New York food served in a true New York style! Our room was very small and we had a view of a brick wall, however, we didn't spend much time in the room so this wasnt an issue for us. The bed was very comfy and the room was kept very clean. All in all this was a great place to stay for a short break in this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique luxury hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: CRL1105
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique hotel in the West Side of Mahattan. Great access to Central Park, subway stop 2 blocks away. We were able to go to MSG, Grand Central, Times Square, and Ground Zero Memorial with easy access. I have stayed in many of the big name chain hotels, none can compare to the level of service provided here. The staff is attentive to your every need and go out of their way to make sure you have a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good pick in the Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: prc73
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a week in Nov 2011. It's a 1903 hotel which was completely renovated in the inside, although preserving its historic achitecture, such as the magnificent stairwell and the exterior of the building. The rooms are modern and the bathroom is impecably clean. The hotel is also walking distance from Central Park, which is a great advantage. Would stay there again on my next trip to NYC. I usually avoid Midtown, which is very agitated. So my best options are Uptown or SoHo/Village.

Reviews.Title: “Return Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nancy O
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Belleclaire and again we were very pleased. The doorman, David, was etremely helpful in getting our car situated for the night. The people at the desk at sign-in, especially a second David, were very cordial, informative, and after giving us a chance to get settled in our room called to see if everything was satisfactory. For us, the hotel is ideally located near shops and excellent restaurants. We are so glad we stayed at the Belleclaire again.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to nyc. :)”
Reviews.Author: Kim F
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel, the price and service were good. The only problems were the construction going on across the street on Broadway. It was right outside our window and the sound was like there were no windows. Very LOUD, it was the Broadway King Rm. Also traffic noise was loud, but it's ny, what can u do. (ear plugs) Its nice that the rm was big. We were able to get a rm in the interior of the hotel so we had 2 nights of sleep. Also u can't control the heat, so it was warm in the rms, so u open the windows to help. Good food on Broadway, so breakfast is right out the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Counts for avg in NYC only - poor elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTerri
Reviews.Content: I am completing my stay here tonight and won't be staying again. The room was decent by NY standards - small but that was ok. What wasn't okay was the marginally clean room, terrible TV picture on 1st night and no TV channels at all on 2nd night. When i went to the desk to ask about TV, they were whispering that someone could come look at but also admitted that it was out for the whole hotel. They didn't want the people checking in next to me to hear that TV was non-working. The upgrade looks great in many areas, but they didn't replace the wood furniture in the room. My room had very damaged wood furniture. Bed was comfortable - too bad the TV couldn't help put me to sleep. There was a 1 inch gap between the window AC unit and the window so traffic noise was deplorable. Stuffed a towel in there which helped. If the room - especially the shower (no tubs) was cleaner, I would have not been as upset about the TV, but come on.....

Reviews.Title: “best UWS hotel - but avoid in summer”
Reviews.Author: NYC-newyear
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 nights at the Belleclaire and my overall experience was excellent. I have stayed in 3 other hotels in the same area but the Belleclaire gave us the best value, best staff, very clean but difficult to control the heating system. I travelled with my daughter and upgraded my original room choice. the front desk staff were more than helpful and although i had to pay $40pn extra, it was no problem and still a good price. We had no problem with the small lifts and given that we were on the 8th floor we never once experienced delays while waiting. When we checked out of the hotel due to severe traffic in Manhatten the front desk staff ordered a car for us. we paid the car driver directly rather than the hotel. although it cost us an extra $10 compared to a yellow cab it was more than worth it.we later learned that the heavy traffic was due to the lighting of the tree at the rockfella centre and the arrival of Obama...need i say any more. My only negative comment was the A.C. Due to unusual hot weather while on my visit i needed to use the air con. this gave little or no relief so i reckon summer time at the hotel would not be a good idea..I Might add that we did have the system checked out while we were there and all was working... but all in all location and friendleness was brilliant and thank you Belleclaire

Reviews.Title: “Great locale, Good value”
Reviews.Author: alpsters
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay in the city last minute that wouldn't break my wallet. The Belleclaire was perfect. The location is fantastic, I grew up in the city and like enjoy the buzz and neighborhood of this part of Broadway. In 2 blocks you can be at the #1 train station and another 5 minute walk you can access the #2&3. The neighborhood has a plethora of cafes, shops, restaurants, theatres and stores within easy walking distance. The rooms are small but in reality, if you're visiting New York, you're most likely not spending a lot of time in your hotel room! The rooms are clean, the service good and I appreciated unlimited internet access in my room as well as tea and coffee downstairs in the lobby. I will come again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a good location”
Reviews.Author: dianapreston
Reviews.Content: The Belleclaire is well located in the Upper West Side, close to the Natural History Museum, Central Park and several subway stations. The service is pleasant and the hotel offers good value in a city where accommodation can be very expensive. Rooms are smallish but well equipped, clean and quite stylish. We liked the fact that it was in a quiet residential area with plenty of delis and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Soonerdc
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned about what I would find after reading several reviews and I am pleased to report my experience was very positive. Upon checking in, I was told I had been upgraded and found the room to be spare but very clean. I wasn't looking for fancy, nor did I find it. The staff was quite friendly and very knowledgeable about the neighborhood. The floor I was on looked like it had been renovated recently and the hall carpet was very new. There were two highlights of my stay - the bed was incredibly comfortable and the hotel provides free WiFi. The only downside was the time it took for the window air conditioner to cool down the room. NYC was unseasonably warm for a November day and the room was pretty hot when I arrived. Some reviewers complained about the noise from the A/C units but I thought it was fine because it blocked out street and hall noises. While not cheap (NY hotels are outrageous), I found it was a good value compared to other properties I considered. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home when we come to NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Harriswk
Reviews.Content: This is our second extended stay at this hotel and we feel right at home. Hotels in this city tend to be ridiculously expensive and add insult to injury by charging ala carte for a miriad of additional services. Not here. The rooms are fresh, clean and ample in size, particularly for NYC. The wifi is free, the gym is free and I expect no extras on my bill. We will continue to visit this friendly small hotel as long as we come to the city!

Reviews.Title: “November 2011 Trip for 5 Days”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I stayed in this Hotel for 5 days in November - We both travelled from the UK, we arrived at the hotel around 9pm and were greeted by a very friendly staff on the front desk. We were provided with a room on the 6th Floor - which was below standard, the bathroom appeared not to have been cleaned that morning, nor a number morning previous. I immeditally contacted the front desk, and informed them of my unhappiness. I also questioned the rooms labelling, as I had booked a Delux Queen, and this appeared to be a standard. Brian from the front desk, was very professional and inspected the room and immeditally moved my partner and I to another room - where we spent the 5 nights. The hotel was in a perfect location, all staff are very friendly and after the room change the hotel was perfect. My only concern was that I had spoken to the hotel directly before my arrival and informed them of my intentions of New York i.e sighsee etc and I was informed that I would be given a view of the city. The first room looked over Broadway....if you were to lean out of the window and stain your neck - so communication seems to be lacking between senior management and staff booking. All in all,. I had a fantastic trip and would recommend the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny & cozy”
Reviews.Author: Mayago
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great location but the room was so tiny that we barely moved! Very close to the American Museum of Natural History and central park, close to subway station.

Reviews.Title: “It's New York!”
Reviews.Author: Oziwi
Reviews.Content: Arrived JFK late on a Saturday night. Plenty of transport available to choose from, ended up in a shuttle bus. This took about an hour, driver friendly & chatty with all passengers. Compared to trying to work out a train system & the cost of a taxi we were more than happy with this. Belleclair hotels check in service was efficient, friendly & quick. The rooms were small - boutique style but used the space well & were nicely furnished. The bathroom was a good size, plenty of towels & clean. It was noisy but nowhere as bad as other hotels in smaller cities. There is a fire department in the local area. It's New York, hotels are expensive. We chose this one because it was cheaper. There is so much to do & see in NY that it's really only a place to sleep. Both concierges were helpful. Try the Viand Cafe. Directions from concierge. Probably won't get in for breakfast unless you go early but try it for dinner, best blackened snapper accompanied by Marlborough Sav - Blanc. Damn fine! Location was very good. We walked to Central Park - 2 blocks. Walked all the way through the park. Looked around Times Square, City, Walked the Brookly Bridge, Union Square & then caught the subway back. Subway easy to use even for those of us who live in cities that don't have any. Any time we looked confused locals openly approached us with assistance. Do both the Empire State & Top of The Rock buildings. Walk the Brooklyn Bridge. Visit Times Square. People watch in Central Park - view a local softball game. Have a hotdog from a cart. Stroll 5th avenue.......the options are endless. We went to the 9/11 Memorial. Took a boat down the Hudson River, this gives a different perspective on the city & commentary is informative. The Memorial is eerie but quite beautiful. Looking for a show, try "The Million Dollar Quartet". Lots of music - Johnny Cash, Jerry Lee Lewis........Good fun. Overall Belleclaire Hotel was reasonably priced, clean, good location, helpful & we enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “VIP Service for Every Guest”
Reviews.Author: cedar_shake79
Reviews.Content: My first trip to NYC and this hotel did not disappoint...much like everything else in the city! Rooms where clean, spacious and I especially enjoyed the hardwood floors. In terms of service - I checked out at 12N and checked my bags, so I could enjoy the city since my flight departed much later. While returning back to the hotel, I was stuck in traffic and had a small window of time to pick up my bag and make it to the airport in time. While I was in the cab, I called the hotel and asked that they have my bags ready for me since my cab would be waiting for me. When I pulled up to the hotel, the bellman was standing outside with my bags and met me at the curb and placed them in the trunk for me - I didn't even have to get out. The time this saved me from running inside and the surprise that I didn't even have to pick up my bags made me really appreciate their service and attention to their guest's needs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: LustForTravel
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference in late October and stayed at this hotel. The location and neighborhood are excellent! Walking distance of subway, bars, Lincoln Center and other amazing NY attractions. The hotel is under some remodeling, at least at the floor I stayed in. The room looks modern and beds are fine. The bathroom was not functioning properly and the water tank of the toilet kept leaking and refilling water the entire night making a very annoying noise. My criticism goes to the service: room was not cleaned up after an entire day and when I call the reception, I was told that I had to place the "clean my room" sign outside the door if I wanted the room cleaned. I was very surprised because I was never told of this when I checked in and this is not common sense. The next day, they cleaned the room, but didn't replace wet and dirty towels. They just took them away and didn't replace them. I think the hotel could make a small effort to improve the quality of services and it would become a very special hotel in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from hotel belleclaire if u want quietness”
Reviews.Author: Fairbanklee
Reviews.Content: I was attracted by the photo in hotel.com. The deluxe room looks nice with reasonable price. I was so disappointed when I check in as the receptionist required us to pay 25US dollar for extra bed each night! I was mislead by the photo as it showed two separate bed!! The room is spacious and even we suited at the 9 floor, it's still noisy. U can request much in this old buidling but the window cannot close and the air conditioner is super noisy! We could only turn off the air con and open the window. But there is a fire station and a construction site near the contner which are so noisy and make u can sleep! The location is ideal but its just too noisy

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, not a bad location”
Reviews.Author: sarahanddave
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and were comfortable but crampt. There wasn't enough room to open our suitcases on the floor, but I guess space is limited in NYC! The room was BOILING hot (despite us turning up in a snow storm) but manageable with the windows wide open. The location wasn't bad. There are a couple of subway stops within 5 or 10 minutes walk, and Central Park is about 10 minutes walk away. The free tea and coffee in the morning was appreciated. We made us of the gym a couple of times which was pretty well equipped. Definitely recommend 'Big Nick's Diner' just around the corner to fill up on proper American calories!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Xpat2011
Reviews.Content: We -2 adults and a kid- stayed 10 days at the Belleclaire in October and, quite frankly, did not experience any of the troubles other reviewers mentioned. The elevators were working properly and there was tea/coffee when there was supposed to be. The staff was always friendly and helpful. The room -deluxe double- was big, nicely renovated with very comfortable beds and we did not find the bathroom was that small -in need of some little upgrading maybe. Noise can be a problem, even on 7th floor, but you can't expect quadruple glazing in a historical building. Watching the sun rise over Broadway was enough to make us want to stay in that room. The hotel is conveniently located close to the subway (79th & 72nd), a crosstown bus to the Upper East (79th) and Central Park. There are a lot a fantastic places to eat -from breakfast to dinner- in the surroundings. All in all, a very nice hotel in a very nice and friendly neighborhood. As with most hotels in big cities like Paris or London, it is still a tad overpriced, but I suppose it is unavoidable.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: terezamurray
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a very clean and well located place in NYC this is the place. It is not in the middle of the tourist places there but is near everything for if you can't reach by foot the subway is just a block away and then you can have all the city. The Upper West Side is a friendly residential neighborhood. The Central Park is just a few blocks away and also the Riverside Park is near. There are very good restaurants in the region. The rooms are comfortable and the service is good. Every time I travel to NYC This is the hotel I like to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a family stay”
Reviews.Author: Bustrav66
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Oct 2011 for 4 days as part of a family trip to the states. We have a family room which was a good size and was nicely renovated. I would go for as high a floor as possible as there was quite a lot of street noise if you are not used to that soprt of thing. There are no restaurants in the hotel, but they are happy for you to bring in all manner of external food - pizza etc, so if you have jet lagged kids that is not such a bad thing. Plenty of places nearby for breakfast - we went to Europan, a few doors up Broadway which was good. Staff were nice and the free coffee and water in the rooms was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms, Top-Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: Knowlesitall
Reviews.Content: I expected to find a room no bigger than a small walk-in closet. Boy, was I pleasantly surprised! First of all, I was greeted by several staff members, not just the bellman. The staff goes out of its way to make sure you're happy, and accommodated. The location is just off of Broadway, with access to restaurants, delis, great shopping and the subway. Pros: Clean rooms, Bright white high-end towels, Service with a smile, Affordable price, Free Wi-Fi, Bottled water Cons: HD TVs w/o HD channels, bed was a bit too soft & springy, Noisy box AC unit

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: atlmom047
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Belleclaire late October 2011. Our experience at the hotel was great. The location was excellent, just two blocks from the subway, with numerous shops and restaurants nearby. We had a standard room with a full size bed on the first floor. The room, which was in the back of the hotel was very quiet, the bed was comfortable, the furnishings well appointed and the room very clean. We found the staff to be courteous and helpful. We also liked that the hotel had charm and not a chain hotel, which often lack personality. We will definitely stay at the Hotel Belleclaire on our next visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of plusses, and a hitch and a glitch”
Reviews.Author: PigsFly
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in October 2011. On the plus side: friendly and attentive front desk and bell staff; clean, nicely appointed rooms; offered an upgrade to a King room; perfect Upper West Side location; quiet, elegantly rooms. The hitch: the window A/C unit was a bit noisy but this is the case with 80% of all New York City hotel rooms. The glitch: boiler problems one morning during my stay, which could have and maybe should have ruined my stay, but I didn't let it. They offered a breakfast voucher for compensation.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Missy999
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very nice and the staff are very friendly and helpful especially Marion from housekeeping, she was very helpful and treated us very well. She gave us everything we needed and made our stay very comfortable. Thank you very much Marion. We will definitely come back to this wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian C
Reviews.Content: I'm from Denver and read a lot of reviews about a lot of hotels. A friend told me about BH and I read some of the other reviews before I booked my hotel room, and I was very happy about how great my stay was. Like everyone else says the taxes in NY are crazy, but that is city wide, not per hotel- so I was prepared for that expense. My girlfriend and I loved the rooms, we are both into older architecture and this building doesn't disappoint. It was also in a great locations, 2 blocks from the subway, easy to move up and down the west side by cab, and close to the park and good restaurants and bars. Plus the staff was great, helpful with our bags, getting around the city and good food recommendations. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No frills & clean”
Reviews.Author: SouthFloridaPTAMom
Reviews.Content: The Belleclaire's location to UWS conveniences & Columbia University is its selling point. Free coffee in the morning in the lobby is another plus. There is also a Westside Market in front of the hotel which is great when needing to grab a quick snack. Rooms are small, but clean and the beds were comfy. Feather pillows would have been a huge plus - there were none available at this property. Elevators are small and slow, so I would suggest staying on a low floor to take advantage of the stairs. Our TV clicker's batteries needed to be replaced, which was done promptly by maintenance. I would recommend for short visits to the City.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, budget hotel ideal for shopping trips!”
Reviews.Author: SC223
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Belleclaire iwith girlfriends on two occasions for Xmas shopping trips in recent years. We knew that we wouldnt be using the hotel much so we didnt see the point in throwing money away on a flashy expensive hotel. Not when we could use that money for shopping! We opted for the Hotel Belleclaire because of the excellent transport links - it's in a lovely area - near to Central Park and great non-touristy restaurants. Upper West Village. We even shared a bathroom (although I must admit that I probably would want my own bathroom if I return).

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel, never again”
Reviews.Author: maky12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at this hotel having booked the most affordable price we could find of $269/night which with sales tax of 8.875%, city tax of 5.875%, occupancy tax of $2, Javits Center tax (wtf?!) of $1.50, all per night came out to $624.34 total for 2 nights. Now, I wouldn't mind paying this if this was a decent value but everything about this hotel was a let down (mildest of words here). First they let you connect into their UNSECURED network with terrible quality, too slow, usually only 1-2 bars out of 5 present. The window in the room didn't even close all the way due to air conditioner in the window so there were holes to the outside. We weathered 2 rains storms at night, waking up at night repeatedly thinking we were rained on! My husband and I were sleep deprived due to noise. We had to jump over the bed due to lack of space. Can't belive that to rent a cardboard box in NYC is over $600 for 2 days. Have no idea what this Javits Center tax is?! Could hear the neighbors thru the wall including their TV. Will never stay here again and would advise all ppl who want to visit NYC to stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere but here!”
Reviews.Author: Gronky
Reviews.Content: The room was so small you could hardly move. Staff so unhelpful and they seem to be on a commission for certain businesses. We wanted a taxi to the airport and the concierge told us that we had no chance of getting one but that he could recommend a drivers service! We passed on his offer and walked out to a waiting taxi at the required time. Messy areas, only 1 lift working. Very poor hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our home when we're in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Flatbushfaithful
Reviews.Content: My wife and I grew up in New York, and lived in the city for forty years. We make frequent trips back however, and now that we no longer prefer to sleep on friends' pullout couches, we always stay at the Belleclaire. The rooms are always clean, the wi-fi works well, and we like staying in the Upper West Side in a real neighborhood. (First time visitors to NYC might not, however. The only close by tourist attractions are the Museum of Natural History, the Planetarium, and Central Park, and Lincoln Center is a short walk. If you want to see things in Lower Manhattan, you'll have to take the subway, a bus, or a cab.). We also like the staff a great deal; they're both friendly and helpful. Although we've never needed their help to get around, we've seen them offer good advice to others. The fitness center is nothing special, but at least it exists: if you're a runner and the weather is not terrible, you can run in Central Park, which is much more fun. In short, unless this is your first NYC visit-and maybe if it is-stay here. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: oatti0252
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with 3 of my friends. This hotel is typical of a European hotel. The rooms are small and the bathroom is tiny! Very difficult to brush your teeth and wash your face! The room itself was spotless! Hard wood floors and nice comforters. You could eat off the floor! Extremely clean! Nice flat screen TVs...umbrella in closet....nicely decorated...staff very friendly...though slow....only one elevator working so was a little slow getting up and down. Only real complaint that it was very loud at might and hard to sleep with the outside noise. Garbage trucks come by at 4:30 am and hang around for about 20 minutes! Hard to fall back to sleep after all that commotion! Area great for shopping...really nice shops. Valet parking worked out very well....highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and pricy”
Reviews.Author: Pyttianna
Reviews.Content: Small room. A lot of noise from the street. Great location if you want to live near Central Park. Helpful and friendly staff. But I have later found better hotels then this for the same money. A bit pricy.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Stephen H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to visit New York for a while, so decided before we started a family we would take the plunge this year for our 2nd wedding anniversary (21/05/11-27/05/11). We booked through expedia, and got a good deal. When arriving at 3am to be told our room had been subject to a minor flood our hearts sank... The reception staff were friendly and ensured we had an alternative room available, but only for one night whilst they resolved our room. The room we were given was the smallest I had ever stayed in - I mean smaller than university accommodation!! Needless to say we were both tired, and at least the bed was comfortable. The next day we went for breakfast (over the road), which was nice and we met some fellow tourists who advised on their trips so far. After then, we decided to go for a walk at Central Park, which is only 5mins away from the hotel. Upon our return to the hotel our luggage was moved and we entered our new room... To our surprise and satisfaction, the room was lovely and really big, which made up for the night before - therefore upgrade your room, plus ask for a room facing broadway. This is when our holiday really started. Admittedly some maintenance was going on on the rooms around us, but the workmen didn't start drilling or making any noise until we were up - i.e. when they heard the TV or when I went to the gym or grabbed a coffee from the foyer. I workout every day, so chose the hotel as it had a gym. Although it was small, I only ever saw one other person in there apart from my wife and I, so it doesn't feel too crammed. There are 2 treadmills, x-trainers and bikes, some free-weights (max 50lbs dumbbells), so no heaving lifting possible. The multi-gym equipment is in need of some oiling, as it was very sticky, so injuries are possible if you don't exercise properly. I would recommend the hotel purchases a bar for guests to use either on a bench or elsewhere - it does't' have to be olympic standard!! The staff were friendly, especially the doormen (as we called them). We wanted to have a special meal for our wedding anniversary, so asked the hotel for recommendations and we were surprised that the Italian they recommended provide guests of the hotel with a 30% discount. The restaurant had very friendly staff and the food was the best we ate out there. Being on 77th, unless you have your walking shoe's on, it is a good 20mins walk to Times Square, and add another 20-30mins to catch the ferry to the statue of liberty. We used a taxi once and a bus once for the experience and to save our feet from throbbing too much... Do not pay for the "super shuttle" - taxi transfers between JFK and the hotel are the same price, so to save you waiting for the minibus, being crammed in and potentially being the last to be dropped off...I would sort out transfers upon arrival. There are loads of taxi's outside! At the rate paid, upgraded-room stayed in, I would be happy to stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here was the low point in our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: daninicm
Reviews.Content: Because of all the good reviews I thought that staying at the Belleclaire was a safe bet, I was very wrong. I will start with the few positive things that this hotel has going for it. First the location. This is the main reason why I picked the Belleclaire. The Upper West Side is a great place to stay in NYC if you are looking for a more neighborhood feel away from the hustle and bustle. Also the Belleclaire is clean. Now for the negative. Upon arrival we requested an early check in as we had an early flight and would love to have taken a nap. We expressed that we certainly understood if they could not accommodate this but would appreciate it if they could put in a request. The woman at the front desk told us she would definitely put in the request. After venturing out for a few hours we called the hotel to see if they were able to check us in early.
