We spoke to the same woman who checked us in. Not only did she not even remember speaking to us she never even put in the request. We booked a deluxe queen room and the size of the room was decent. I don't expect much when it comes to the size of the room in NYC. You pretty much have to expect it to be small. But the room was certainly functional and clean. Those were the only good things about this room. The hallways are so narrow and the walls are so thin that we could hear the people speaking and yelling ACROSS the hall not to mention the baby who was crying all day and night in the room next to us. The hotel did not inform us that there was construction going on in the hotel. We woke up to hammering and pounding everyday at 8am. Our bed was like a rock. Actually a rock is probably more comfortable. The pillows were even worse. They have really let this hotel become run down. All of our furniture was severely damaged and there were large holes in all the sheets, pillow cases and duvet cover. Luckily we only needed to use the air conditioner one night during our trip. After turning it on we soon found out there was no hope in sleeping with it on. It was the loudest air conditioner I have ever experienced. So we had no choice but to turn it off. We thought we would finally get some relief from the noise. We were wrong. It continued to rattle even when it was turned off and unplugged! How is it possible that an air conditioner can continue to be noisy when it is unplugged! This was officially the hotel from hell. The hotel advertises free wifi but it rarely if ever works. We had a total of 12 tv channels. No I did not come to NYC to watch television but if I am paying $2000+ for a room I should have that option. We truly felt as if we were staying in a low budget motel. The only thing that reminded us that it wasn't was how much it cost. If at any point during your trip you would like to sleep or feel comfortable I recommend not staying at the hotel Belleclaire.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Perez303
Reviews.Content: Our experience was wonderful at the Belleclaire. I stayed two nights with HS/ college friends who came from MD to visit. We arrived early and were able to get into our room before the regular check in time. The Hotel has been updated but still maintains a vintage NY vibe. We had a room with a beautiful view and found it to be very spacious. We loved the location since we were close to shopping, museums, and central park. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The Belleclaire was immaculate. I would highly recommend this hotel and plan on booking a room next time I have out of state guests or just want to spend a night in the city.

Reviews.Title: “One thing after another! Give this a miss!”
Reviews.Author: Andrelina2011
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 7 nights recently and after a very friendly start it was downhill from there. We originally booked a King Room and assumed it was the one shown on the website (the nice big round room) as there were no other pictures for King Rooms. Upon arriving at our room we realized it was not the room we thought so we asked if it was possible to change to this King Room shown in the pictures. We were happy to pay for the 'upgrade'. We were told that we would be able to move on Friday night, two nights later for an extra $20 per night. Fine. We pack our bags, hand in our keys before heading out sightseeing on Friday morning only to return in the afternoon and be told that the room was now not available. We were then promises that it would be Managements first priority in the morning to have this room available for us and that we would not be charged. Not happy about not being able to move as we had woken up earlier that morning specifically to pack. We again left our bags packed the following morning and upon handing our keys in again, we were told by another front desk person that it might not be possible to move rooms again today. By this stage we had enough!! We were told that it would be sorted by the time we returned that day. We were ot holding our breath.Miraculously it was available and our bags were in the room. Although close to the subway, restaurants etc we were not impressed with the service at this hotel - there are 2 tiny lifts, loud air cons, and upon check out the door man tried to get us to take a private car to JFK airport which was going to cost us $10 more than the yellow taxis that we could get off the street!! Much better places to stay in NYC, not this one, not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindaL123
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in NYC (Sept 29 to Oct 4). We chose Hotel Belleclaire after reading all the great reviews on TripAdvisor. Compared to other hotels in NYC, HB's rates were reasonable. Pros: - Great location (close to subway system, food, shopping, things to do, etc) - Large room (2 double beds) - Small refrigerator - Clean - Quiet (other than an occasional door slam, we didn't hear anyone in the adjacent rooms) - Friendly staff - Charming architecture, with lots of character Slight Cons: - Just needs a little updating. - No view from our room, but that's why it was so quiet outside. If I go to NYC again, I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little palce to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sean S
Reviews.Content: This review is a bit late but I only recently signed up. Me and my partner stayed at Hotel Belleclaire for 8 nights in July 2010. This place was fantastic! We arrived in New York at 12am but as with most places, this hotel is open 24 hours so check in was no problem. We were greeted with a smile and a New York hello by the doormen and given the keys to our room. Our room was pretty small, just a queen bed, a small fridge, a large tv, a desk and an aircon. We opted for the shared bathroom and we had no problem with this as it saved us money and we never once ran into the other group of people using our bathroom. The room was, although small, perfect for us because when you're in NY who spends their time in the hotel room? We used it for sleeping at that was it! We travelled to NY during the heat wave and boy did we need that aircon! It worked perfectly and actually got to 15 degree Celsius unlke many aircons in australia. The elevators were a bit slow but that can be expected from such an old building. The only fault I can give is that on one occasion my partner was seriously ill and she required doctor attention. After running down to ask the manager I was greeted with a response as though he didnt take us seriously or was thinking 'typical tourist', Nonetheless, he gave me some information about how expensive a doctor would be but he seemed like he wasnt concerned to help. The location of the hotel is perfect! It used to be right across the road from the Manhattan Diner, which we must say is the most amazing diner we ate at. Everythnig was tasty and the service was outstanding. The first few days we walked to time square from the Hotel and it takes about 20 minutes for us, taking in the sites along the way. However, the 1 train goes straight to time square and takes 5 minutes. This elaves from 79th street, 2 blocks north. If your looking to travel in a different direction, the interchange is at 72nd street and this provides various different options of trains. All in all, everything is perfectly located around the Hotel and i would DEFINITELY recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Maureen C
Reviews.Content: Hotel Belleclaire is the best place to stay on the Upper West Side, especially for families. We had a wonderful family suite which gave us more than enough room to sleep comfortable. The hotel is in a wonderful location where you can walk to several museums, shops and resturants. It is a quaint hotel that really makes you feel at home. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in hotel Belleclaire”
Reviews.Author: Anyes B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the hurricane Irene end of August 2011.The hotel waved any fees for cancellation for people who wanted to leave NY .They were ready with flashlights ,water and snacks .Our flight was cancel so we did to have to stay longer in NY .They did the same rate as the rate of my booking .I was impressed that they did not take advantage of the situation . It is a fine hotel with a lot of foreigners .The atmosphere is nice ,the staff is nice .The rooms were clean and I liked the wood floor . I will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “movin on up!”
Reviews.Author: lifesabeach1
Reviews.Content: ok so the song was about the east side, but the west side is the real secret and the Hotel Belleclaire is the perfect choice. Even wonder why so many people make the west side their residency from rich folks to celebrities. book a room at this hotel and spend one day and you will wish you lived there for your whole life. we loved how classicaly charming this hotel was and how amazing the location was. our room was unbelievable looking over broadway with huge ornate windowsils, obviously this is a historic classic building, they simply dont build them like this anymore, big strong, proud, and beautiful. the inside of our room was very updated with classic neatly arranged furniture and very comfortable beds. one of those beds that makes you hate your bed at home now. the staff was great and didnt miss a beat, whatever you need they are there to help. the hotel is small enough for them to give you the attention you need. it really felt like home, we didnt want to leave. so much that when we checked out we asked if they could hold our bags while we walk the neighborhood and continue to explore before we had to get back in our car and leave one of the nicest weekends behind us. thank you to all the staff. Scott the general manager is clearly a professional making sure everyones stay is a memorable one. who wants to stay in times square? not us, this is the real new york, and it is just a few subway stops from everything you need, yet when you come back you feel like you came back home, nice quiet tree lined streets. 2 blocks from central park and the museum of natural history. sooooo many nice restaurats around. we had the idea to head downtown but we realised we didnt neeed to go anywhere. catch a comedy show across the street, eat at the 24 hour restaurant on the nearest corner. we spent our day just wandering the neighborhood and admiring the architecture. we are from new york and we have never seen such beautiful buildings in any other part of town. there is a subway stop on the next street and you can take that anywhere you want. cant wait to go back, we are so happy we discovered this part of town. great job Hotel Belleclaire.

Reviews.Title: “Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: This is our first stay at the Belleclaire hotel in New York. We booked a room with 2 double beds , the location is fantastic, free coffee or tea in the morning in the lobby. The staff were friendly, it was clean and fairly priced. I will def be coming back

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, HARD beds”
Reviews.Author: MaryManya
Reviews.Content: We love visiting NYC & have been many times. This was our first stay at the Hotel Belleclaire. The staff was friendly & helpful, decor was nice. Wonderful location & felt very safe. Fairly priced too. The room we had was considered a suite, because it had two bedrooms and a tiny refrigerator. I liked everything about it except that the beds in the hotel were rock hard. I like a firm matress, but it felt as if we were sleeping on a cement bench! After a few nights, my back was hurting. We might stay there again as long as we got a better bed. All in all a good deal at the Hotel Belleclaire.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Optom32
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hotel Bellclaire at the beginning of June this year. Having just spent a night in a horrible hotel this one was a breath of fresh air! We arrived super early with a ton of luggage as we wanted to get the heck out of our previous hotel! The staff were so helpful and kindly let us drop off all our bags so we could go out and enjoy the rest of the day in NYC. They also let me leave my laptop safely behind the reception desk. We arrived later on that day to check in properly and were greeted warmly. There was no queue at all like others have said but maybe we just went at a quieter time of year. The room was small but clean, modern and nicely decorated. It had a huge TV with good channels, a nice bathroom, a little refrigerator and an ipod docking station - what else do you need?! You are in NYC! The whole point is to be out exploring and not spending time in your hotel room. The location was great, i guess maybe it would be a 30-45 minute walk into the city centre however we were lazy and used taxis and the underground (which is a 5-10 min walk away). There are plenty of great places for breakfast in the area also. The staff were great and answered all our typical touristy questions as well as allowing us to print off our tickets for our midnight trip to the Empire State Building (which was amazing might I add) I will definitely be recommending this hotel to my friends and if I am ever in NYC again I will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Belleclaire....”
Reviews.Author: JazzAndHiFi
Reviews.Content: Just recently stayed at the Hotel Belleclaire in Room 906 while in NYC to work and photograph Mercedes Benz Fashion week - had an absolutely delightful and spectacular stay!!! Originally checked into a room on the third floor facing Broadway with a queen sized bed and stayed a couple nights which was already a nice room - and then one night on a whim asked the front desk about the rooms on the corner of the building and what they were like where the architectural features are the round corner-towers or turrets. After an invitation to check out the room on the top floor corner, we soon decided to take that room - and wow, the room and the views were just amazing! Absolutely loved this pre-war building and hotel, the staff, the room(s) and the views from the room - and can't wait to stay again in February 2012 for the next MB Fashion Week! And hopefully again much much sooner for pleasure trips! To anyone thinking about staying at the Belleclaire - this is a designated historic landmark building built in the early 1900's and comes with a rich history! The hotel itself has been renovated and is up-to-date. It's on the Upper West Side close to other notable architectural buildings such as the Ansonia, the Dorilton, the Apthorp and many other buildings worth checking out. Walk over to Amsterdam or Columbus for a great selection of restaurants such as ‪Gina La Fornarina Restaurant‬ or cappuccinos and pastries at Bomboloni or walk up the street to Zabars. And down below on Broadway are 24 hour markets with a great selection of food and beverages. Lincoln Center is a nice walk away (I made this walk several times a day for a week) from the hotel, and there are 2 subway stops close by - one a couple blocks towards uptown but I much preferred the walk to the 72nd Street Subway station. The Belleclaire is a wonder bargain for the price and the location and it's a very warm and friendly place to stay -- I'd highly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: greybeardboston
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a night at the Belleclair. The location is great, but the place does not come close to what it should - based on the website and the price. The room was tiny and uninteresting, only one elevator tiny elevator was working, the bellman smelled of alcohol, the line at the front desk was always long - and when you go to the front, they were cold on the verge of rudeness. Once, when there was no line, we had to wait for either of the two desk attendants to get off the phone. When we asked for late checkout, they cancelled our key anyway, which made us have to stand in line again. Summary - overpriced, tiny stuffy room, unfriendly staff. Next time, we's find another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “a cosy place”
Reviews.Author: Val1975
Reviews.Content: a really nice and cosy place almost in the heart of the Manhattan

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean, tidy and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: kjz79
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent week stay at Hotel Belleclaire. Room (Deluxe Queen) was perfect size for the two of us. Recently renovated and very clean. Only comment is the one extremely small elevator! Made for some interesting conversations though! :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Positioned”
Reviews.Author: dzprice
Reviews.Content: In June, my husband and I took our two teenage kids to New York to visit colleges, and didn't want to spend too much money on the trip. We chose Belleclaire for the cost, and we felt that for what we received - location, cleanliness, very good customer service - this hotel was a great value for us. It is walking distance to the subway (the redline which hits all the must see tourist spots) and to Central Park. There are good and inexpensive restaurants within walking distance. And there is a laundromat two blocks away. The only negatives: This hotel is in a remodeled historic building and only has two elevators, so getting to the lobby can be a challenge at times. The biggest negative - parking your car costs you extra (appx. $40 a day). Overall, we like this hotel very much and will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “It was nice, until...”
Reviews.Author: Melimel1
Reviews.Content: Although the pictures were better then actual, the hotel was nice. I enjoyed the room we had, 3 windows, 2 with street views. Considering space is limited in NYC this room had it. All was going well until we returned to our room and found the furniture was replaced. What started out with a credenza w/drawers, was replaced with a desk/chair. Our clothes and personal belongings were removed from the drawers and left on the bed, chair and windowsill. I felt violated!! I voiced my concern via to the Mgr on duty who listened and seemed truly apologetic. Although I was not expecting anything, we were given vouchers for 2 free meals. Which turned out to be limited to nothing more than $10. All in all, the place was clean, quiet and the staff friendly. The gym was decent and served our purpose. I liked the location and the concierge was truly pleasant, helpful and had some pretty good suggestions! We called for more towels and got them in a matter of minutes, Had they waited til we checked out OR give us a choice by calling us before replacing the furniture perhaps we would return on our next visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: sarau30
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a shared washroom and it was a great experience. The location is supurb just walk out and there's all the action and you can walk to a lot of near-by attractions. Also, there's a super cute grocery store below where you can get gourmet yogurts, cheese, meats and other excellent snacks for breakfast or to take out for the day. Room was very clean. Overall, the best value hotel in New York I could find. Would be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and easy”
Reviews.Author: ajlcdl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night but also needed luggage checking and valet car service. Everything was great, beginning with the emails prior to arrival with the reservations manager. Bags were checked easily and quickly, car valet service was excellent. All the staff very professional. Room was great (Broadway King) with empty fridge - important for leftovers. Very comfortable bed. Bathroom very small but excellent water pressure in the shower. Free coffee service in the AM in the lobby doesn't start until 6:30 but there's an all night coffee shop/bakery just steps from the front door. Location of hotel perfect - just one minute walk from subway. Only minor quibble is that the room could have been better dusted, but would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: HerschelG
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights recently. For the price you won't find many hotels in New York. The location is very good to have as a base for touring New York, very close to the subway and the Park. We booked a standard room but the room was incredibly small that we immediatley upgraded for $20 a night to a much bigger room. Rooms were modern and the bathroom was very good. Complimentary coffee in the morning which is a bonus. We were there when one of the elevators was broken, meaning that you had to wait up to 5/10 minutes for the single lift to stop on your floor (hoping there was room). We were on the 6th floor and the walk down was not a hassle. Staff were friendly, concierge arranged transport to the airport for us (maybe paid $10/$15 more than a cab, but we left just before the storm, so took our chances) Overall, a very decent for what you pay. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly what we expected”
Reviews.Author: liljana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night in August. We booked the 'deluxe queen room'. I will try here to give a very unbiased review so, I will go over the positive and the negative of this experience: 1. There was nothing deluxe about the deluxe queen room. The room was extremely small and very dark (picture is taken in the middle of a sunny day). The room had a very bad smell to it so we went over everything to see where is it coming from. This allowed us to see that the mattress and linens were all clean and mattress was actually new. We located the smell to be coming from the air conditioner, turned it off and reported it to the front desk. Air conditioner was a window air conditioner supported in its place by some kind of foam. Front desk staff was really very responsive and sent an engineer to look at it immediately. We had to leave the room so we did not know that fixing it did not work until the evening. We were exhausted after a busy day in New York so, instead inquiring for another room we decided to just turn the air conditioner off and open the window. The window was extremely dirty with sticky tape all over it ?? (see photo). 2. Bathroom was clean except for the tiles that could use some cleaning (see photo). There was no shower curtain and instead only a liner was placed. Toiletries were excellent. 3. There is no coffee maker in the room. 4. There is a big screen TV 5. There is a mini refrigerator 6. Only one elevator (of the two existing) worked resulting in long waiting periods 7. There is a business center in the lobby with two computers and free coffee/tea. Prints to the front desk 8. Cold water in the lobby 9. Staff is extremely nice and helpful 10. Location is excellent within two blocks from metro, numerous restaurants and grocery stores around it I travel extensively and I never stayed in a room that was called deluxe and was so inadequate. That room and the state it was on was in sharp contrast to the rest of the hotel, the lobby, the staff etc. I don't think this is new or recent as I have seen other people review about the very dirty windows. It should not take much to correct these things and it really ruins the impression of the hotel completely. The price that we paid was inadequate for what we received (I never stayed in a smelly room with sticky tape over the windows even in a much lower rated hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kittykat0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last August it was our second time to New york on the same trip, stayed in the Sheraton the first time. Have to say even tho the Sheraton was right in times square we much preferred this hotel, it's a lovely boutique sort of hotel staff are friendly, rooms aren't huge (it is New york!) but decor was lovely, even tho we had to walk a good few blocks to get ot Times Square we would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in the Upper West Side.”
Reviews.Author: cin1266
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel in a lovely neighborhood. Friendly staff, helpful concierge service, and extremely convenient location. One block from the subway, and cab service within minutes. Central park, The Museum of Natural History, Zabar's Market, and the iconic Big Nicks Diner just around the corner. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and stay!”
Reviews.Author: SelectiveMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: I was in NYC a few days ago with my daughter, her friend, and her mom for a special trip before they start high school. We had a fabulous stay at the Hotel Belleclaire - the room (a Deluxe double double) was clean, bigger than expected, and tastefully decorated (no polyester bedspreads or ugly art). The staff were very helpful and pleasant, as was the concierge. Coffee in the morning and iced water throughout the day, in the lobby, was appreciated. The location couldn't have been better (and I've been to NYC many times before) - a couple of blocks away from Central Park, Museum of Natural History, the Subway (which we took everywhere), and many great restaurants (try Fatty Crab and Shake Shack) and boutique shopping. We walked, rode the subway and cabs were inexpensive from this location to midtown and Soho. I highly recommend this hotel and will certainly return here, even when I'm back for business.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Belleclaire and will be back! Friendly staff/Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: temilson
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed at the Belleclaire on our last 3 trips to NYC. I love this hotel! It has so much charm and the staff are very friendly and accomodating. This hotel is in an older building which adds to the charm for me but you do have to realize that means not every room is the same. Be sure to ask about the different types and sizes of rooms before you book. The value is excellent when you can find a deluxe king room in the heart of the city for under $200 per night. We love the laid back less crowded vibe of the Upper West Side neighborhood. There are lots of restaurants and bars within walking distance and of course you are right between two excellent parks with Riverside Park 2 blocks one direction and beautiful Central Park just 3 blocks away the other direction and the subway is only 2 blocks away. Yes, it is true that the elevators are cramped, not the fastest, and often at least one is under repair. However, I can live with that in exchange for the charm, location, service, and incredibly comfortable beds. I sleep so much better there than at home!! I personally love the noise and bustle of the city so I love the rooms with a view to Broadway where I can open my windows and drink in all the hustle and bustle of the city. We stayed in Room 206 this year which was AWESOME. It was a huge deluxe king room with 4 large windows facing the street. Had a nice sized closet and chest of drawers. The water pressure in the shower was fantastic. The maid service was reliable and they were very friendly. If you prefer more piece and quiet, choose a room not facing busy Broadway avenue. I can't wait to return to the Belleclaire on my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - pity we didn't get the room we paid for!”
Reviews.Author: Gabby79
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect - near the subway, still central but away from the hustle and bustle of midtown. There are many wonderful restaurants in the area too. The hotel itself is clean, the staff were all friendly and helpful and our first trip to NYC was wonderful; so much so that we'll be going back soon. I was a bit disappointed that, having booked the King deluxe room, we didn't get the round room as seen on the hotel website. Maybe I should have pointed it out to the reception, but to be honest we were too jet lagged on arrival to care. Pity though. Only other thing is that it is next to impossible to connect to the internet in the morning, but otherwise it works just fine and it's complimentary too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SpaceWaderer
Reviews.Content: It's an old hotel: one should expect common "shortcomings" of a very old big city mid-rise hotel building, which include slow elevators, a noisy window air-condition unit, rather shabby bathroom, etc. On the other hand, this hotel is reasonably-priced (especially with their summer discount), offers clean and well-kept rooms, equipped with complimentary Wi-Fi connection, served by friendly staff, and most of all, in a very safe and desirable area. Probably not suitable for business travel but perfect for a family or a few friends who don't mind sharing beds. We could walk to Central Park, Time Square, and many tourist spots. If you're not into walking, you can take a subway or bus to everywhere. I highly recommend the hotel for budget-conscious travellers who are concerned about safety and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: TheOp001
Reviews.Content: Clean and convenient but front desk is understaffed, only one elevator works, and if you wake before 6:30 and would like coffee, better go down and over a block to Starbucks because there is no coffeemaker in room and staff is slow about getting the coffee in the lobby out.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room for the money!”
Reviews.Author: carabaggott73
Reviews.Content: My only complaint is that the elevator was slow--otherwise loved the decor. Was pleased with the clean modern room and the front desk staff were courteous and gave us an upgrade for no apparent reason. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: Moonbaby728
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and nice view of the neighborhood. No in room coffee is a drag and poor water pressure in the shower. Upon check in they failed to let me know that the carpet was being replaced on the entire floor I was on. I had to dodge the floor layers, glue and debris which would not affected my stay had they just notified me prior or given me the option to stay on another floor.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay at this hotel again!!”
Reviews.Author: chunk1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in February 2010 for 6 nights. It was our first visit to New York City and we had a totally fab time. Could not fault the hotel in anyway. Everything ran smoothly checking-in etc. Room was very modern, clean and the bathroom was gorgeous. Room was cleaned everyday. As you are in New York and don't spend alot of time in your hotel anyway I would definitely recommend this hotel. It's in a great location. Walking distance to Central Park and the Natural History Museum.....even to catch the Subway. It was in a rather quiet location which was nice when you want to get your head down after a very long and eventful day of sightseeing. Would definitely stay at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it and will return”
Reviews.Author: eliza787
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in February 2007.The Hotel Belleclaire was a very central place to stay while in New York.The room was large and well kept and we enjoyed the ambience of the hotel and its surrounds. Would certainly return in the future

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: betsy g
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful surprise to see what a beautiful accommodation I received. Everything about the hotel was friendly....and new....and clean. I would recommend it in a heartbeat! And hope I'll have the chance to go back to this affordable little gem on the upper west side.

Reviews.Title: “An all around wonderful experience and will definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Nancy O
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out the service was professional, polite, and informative. The front desk people were cheerful and efficient. The concierge, Chris, was very knowledgeable and helpful (complete with maps and landmarks to guide us) when we asked directions to Yankee Stadium and American Girl Place. He also suggested a nearby restaurant that could serve a family of seven an early Sunday morning breakfast. Since rain was not predicted we weren't prepared for the downpour we were faced with but the front desk had wonderful umbrellas we could buy. The lobby had fresh lemonade available in the afternoon when we arrived and early morning coffee and tea to start our day. The housekeeping staff was visible and attentive to their jobs. They were friendly and smiling whenever we encountered them. Our room was just right for two people(wonderfully clean) with a wonderfully comfortable king bed, large TV, and a refrigerator, a desk and comfortable chair. We loved the bathroom with the walk-in shower and plenty of fluffy towels and the usual ammenities of soaps, shampoos, hair dryer, etc. Our son and his family had a "family room" which accomodated all five of them comfortably (in two spaces) with a really big bathroom. A friend recommended this hotel to us and we would definitely stay there again. A great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, friendly staff, and awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: cara l
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Belleclaire was a block from Central Park and close to all we wanted to see. When we arrived the staff was very friendly and helpful and always checked in with us to see if we needed anything. The rooms were clean with very comfortable beds, small but adequate, and decor was "interesting" if a little gaudy. Ice cold water greeted us on one of the hottest days of the summer and the concierge was very down to earth and gave us great tips. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, AFFORDABLE rooms in NYC”
Reviews.Author: ericntracy
Reviews.Content: I visited NYC for the first time in July with my daughter and a friend. We reserved a deluxe room with two double beds. When we arrived, the room we reserved was not available. We were given two seperate rooms with queen beds for the same price. Although the rooms were very small, they were clean and comfortable and a perfect place to rest and sleep after sight-seeing. The staff at the hotel were warm and friendly and very helpful. My initial decision to stay here was affordability. The rooms are about half the cost of most hotels in NYC. Now, even if I could afford a more expensive room, I would choose to stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Neighborhood Value”
Reviews.Author: wmpe
Reviews.Content: GOOD: Rate under $200 for deluxe queen when booked well in advance Stylish room, hardwood floors, shades- no curtains Great UWS neighborhood Convenient to transportation, food and drugstore at corner Prompt response to repair service requests Quiet on side street Very strong water pressure in shower BAD Windows very dirty (#217 on Aug 5 201) Desk lamp needed new bulb tv remote had to be replaced No mirror or medicine cabinet over sink Poor lighting in bathroom and room (for makeup) Tiny sink Noisy AC

Reviews.Title: “great location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: baggy31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Belleclaire during the heatwave in July when nighttime temperatures barely dropped below 80. The air conditioner in the room was seriously loud but did a good job, and we got more adjusted to the noise each night. we couldnt hear any traffic noise at all from our room at the rear of the 6th floor (but maybe it was because the air conditioner was so loud!!) I've recently been told that this older style air conditioner is common in hotels. Our room was a decent size. We've never been to Manhattan and were expecting a shoebox but were pleasantly surprised. We had two windows facing different directions. The bed was very comfy and the bathroom clean and well finished. The lifts were a gripe. Only one of them was working and was very slow. I have noticed that the lift complaint has been mentioned in many reviews. The hotel keeps saying it has been resolved, but I can't see that it has, unless they choose on only running one! However, for us, the lift situation was nothing more than a slight pain, and would have been less so if it had been cooler making using the stairs more bearable! overall, the belleclaire was exactly what we needed. the location was great (only one stop on the express subway from 72nd to times square). we chose to use the 72nd st subway as it was on the express and was a nice walk past shops to get there. there are great restaurants nearby. I highly recommend Recipe (small but beautifully decorated and fantastic food), and going to the westside market just round the corner from the hotel - why dont we have these in england! also, GROM do the best gelato we've ever had. dont miss it!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: madgarlic
Reviews.Content: Pros: Hotel staff was very nice Rooms clean and comfortable, maybe a little too small The location is awesome, just near two subway stops and a few blocks from Central Park. Cons: Air conditioning in the room was absolutely noisy! One elevator was broken all the 9 days The other one was broken for at least three days and in a 9 floor building this could be annoying. It must be said that a third (service?) elevator was available anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: brainono
Reviews.Content: Good locatet - 2 blocks to the subway. Friendly Staff. The small rooms and floors could be cleaner! Our AC was very loud.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it seems”
Reviews.Author: Chazs12
Reviews.Content: We booked this room through a thrid party source which I believe miss-represented the hotel. In fairness to them, other services also rated this hotel 3.5 stars. It is not. Only 1 elevator at a time worked, and if you read other reviews of the property this has been going on for a number of years. We booked our room with the expectation of at least a queen sized bed. We received a standard. This was alright as I love my wife, but I know of no other 3.5 star hotel chains that even offer standard sized beds for 2 people. Why this sized bed, because nothing else would fit. Cleanliness was not up to what we expect. While there was no mold, there were curly hairs left in the bathroom. I cleaned them up before my wife used the facility. Ironing board, but no iron. Staffing, they seem to very slim on staff, only one bellhop. So my overall impression like many others: Great location, but I feel like I got taken. This level of service and accomodation would have been acceptable back in the 1970's, but with choice and technology now available to the experienced traveler it is not. We will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “New Year, great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Cazzan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in december 2010 for New Year. Myself and a friend had a double room with 2 double beds - the room was enormous! My only grumble was that the heating wasn't switched on when we arrived (it was -8!), the old pipes made quite a lot of noise, and the bathroom had no heating so was freezing! Apart from that, staff were helpful, rooms clean). There was only 1 lift working too and we were on the 11th floor - lifts are tiny and only hold about 4 people so sometimes you had to wait ages! The location is out of the main area's of new york but there is a subway just opposite, central park is walkable, and we did walk around a lot. Taxi's also easy & cheap as right on Broadway. There is a diner opposite too which does amazing breakfasts! Would definitely stay here again as it was away enough from the noise and busyness of new york, yet close enough to enjoy everything easily.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Srodd
Reviews.Content: Clean, well priced, friendly and helpful staff. The whole family enjoyed our stay. We would recommend to friends and definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, will go back!”
Reviews.Author: vik j
Reviews.Content: As expected out of most NYC hotels, the room was quite small in size, but was very clean and everything was in working order (Phone, TV, A/C, Hairdryer, Iron w/ ironing board). The front desk staff, concierge were courteous and willing to help and answer questions. I liked how they had ice cold water with lemon and hot coffee in the hotel lobby in the mornings. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: oakcreektv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Belleclaire during the fist week in August. I can't say enough about how much we were pleased with this choice of hotel. We had a parlour suite on the 9th floor which overlooked the Hudson. Very spacious with hardwood floors. The bedroom had a very comfortable king. The sitting room had a fold-out sofa which was also comfortable. We squeezed in a rollaway in the bedroom. There were two 32 inch flatscreens and two window air conditioners which worked great. The mini fridge was a nice addition. We filled it with stuff from the Westside Market which is right beneath the hotel on Broadway. The bathroom was larger than we expected and had floor to ceiling tile. In short, this room exceeded our expectations on all levels. The staff was extremely prompt and courteous. The front desk had extra blankets and pillows sent up within 10 minutes of our requests. The bellmen were very helpful in procuring transportation and offering advice on ATMs, food, shopping, etc... Everyone there knew the neighborhood well. We had no trouble with slow elevators even though one of the 3 was out of order for four of the days we were there. The neighborhood the hotel in located in is very vibrant. Lots of shops and restaurants. We liked the Levain Bakery on 74th and Gina La Fornarina Restaurant which was on 73rd and Amsterdam. Ask to be seated downstairs if you don't like crowds. If you walk 3 blocks east you are at Central Park. My one regret is that I didn't ask the front desk where I could get a copy of the 1912 era photographic print of the Belleclaire and Broadway Ave. that was hanging in the bedroom. Would love to hang a copy in my study. Very interesting photo. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good place”
Reviews.Author: canarysop
Reviews.Content: Very good location, nice room, wifi. I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: car22
Reviews.Content: Our room was ready when we arrived early at 1 p.m. Room was very pleasant, just as pictured on the website. Unfortunately, it proved to be noisy with three windows which let in street noise much of the night. We were promptly moved to a higher floor the next morning with a larger bathroom and no noise for our remaining three nights. Staff were always very friendly and helpful. The location couldn't have been better, midway between Central Park and the Hudson River where we viewed 4th of July fireworks. The ice water in the lobby was so welcome when we came back to the hotel on humid afternoons.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, very small room with limited conveniences”
Reviews.Author: LizWhibyOntario
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the hotel Belleclaire and loved the location with its proximity to Central Park, the Museum of Natural History and the subway system. The area had a great vibe and it was nice to be away from the crowds in this great neighbourhood. I would stay in this Upper West Side area again. The hotel room was very small, which was expected, however lacked the simplest of conveniences such as a closet/wardrobe or even garment rack to hang clothes (there was not even single drawer in which to unpack/store anything!) A mere hook on the back of the bathroom door was the only areas available for purposes of hanging clothes, which made it very inconvenient and crowded. However, the bathroom itself was nicely renovated. The small window in the tiny room faced a very nearby brick wall. The staff were very friendly and helpful and Hector the Bellman was very helpful with self- parking information.

Reviews.Title: “Location great - service questionable”
Reviews.Author: Nicedawg
Reviews.Content: Ok, overall hotel is decent because of location (close to subway, museum of natural history, safe neighborhood) BUT....... I had 3 major issues with hotel: 1) Concierge tried to rip me off on setting up ride to JFK - he insisted i pay $75 (cause its dependable, and so forth) - nope Im from city so im not going to be gaffled easily....I ended up taking cab (no toll) for $50.....Beware of getting hustled by this guy. 2) only one elevator worked and its been like that from reviews for months - seems hotel too cheap to fix it. This is A big problem -don't overlook this - cause hotel is crowded and you end up waiting in lines for an elevator!!!! 3) Front desk people seemed to be too busy to answer question or annoyed if you asked them ... Bad management to let this type of impoliteness to exist....people who stay at this hotel are not from NYC - how hard is this to figure out for staff !!! I asked a good restaurant and they couldn't tell me , I asked subway ticket question and I got "it depends" qualifying answer (meaning I could care less go figure it out yourself attitude).... I will not stay here again and unless they retrain their staff and fix the elevator I do not recommend anyone staying here--here is my summary: First time ever in NYC and the location of this hotel is best thing going for it.  As most negative reviews said - bummer only one small elevator works here - pretty ridiculous ...fits only bout 4 people at a time.  Rooms are nice and comfortable - no shared bathrooms - not sure why that rumor started - air-condition nice even from small window unit - it was 100 degrees outside yet cool inside room all the time.   Subway is 2 blocks away - nicks diner right downstairs and great breakfast and lunch food - slice of pizza is the best - new York pizza is awesome! Museum of natural history is 4 blocks away and a good thing to do in day (air condition throughout).   Subway is pretty tough to navigate with many many different lines/colors, plus there's construction so some lines not working???? Went to see ground zero, wall street, empire state bldg, all via subway - you should get $10 unlimited pass.   Times Square by far the most impressive thing to experience in New York - like a gigantic party 24 hours a day - incredible energy and pandemonium in the air there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Depends on the room”
Reviews.Author: gottakeepgoing
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice now. First time had an awesome, updated room. Second time it was an old, cramped, dated room. Changed room for the last night. When booking, be sure to request a newer room. All that being said, it's a perfect location for getting around and it has that European charm thing going on. The inconsistent and often broken elevators are a nuisance but you can always use the stairs and enjoybthe beautiful wrought iron railings.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Allthatfall
Reviews.Content: We had a Family suite for four of us, two adults in one section with a king size and two kids sharing a large sofa bed. Great room. Air con noisy but it was 36c outside. The staff very helpful. Coffee in the foyer. Plenty of places to get breakfast. Easy walk to Central Park. 5 mins stroll to Metro. We loved this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our family...great location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kmw098
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently with our 2 kids (ages 6 & 9). It was a great location! Close to Central Park & Natural History Museum. There is also a little market downstairs which we found very convenient. The room was very spacious for a family of 4 staying in NYC. The front desk staff & concierge were friendly & helpful. A member of the hotel staff came up & set-up the pull-out couch for our kids. He was very polite and went out of his way to make sure we were comfortable. Overall a wonderful experience and we would absolutely stay here the next time we visit!

Reviews.Title: “Locked out @ 2:30 AM.”
Reviews.Author: traveler0157
Reviews.Content: I have stayed @ this hotel many times. My key card did not work to let me in upon my arrival back into hotel at 2:30 ish am. Rang buzzer, no luck. Had to call front desk to get in. Get to my room, obviously, key card does not work. Back to front desk. No apologies were offered!!!Assumed front desk would have notified a Manager. Did not happen!! Not a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & friendly staff!!”
Reviews.Author: AznHyperGirl
Reviews.Content: I would totally come back here. The staff are friendly and the room was cozy but spacious at the same time. The beds didn't take up the entire room, which is so hard to find in NYC. Awesomeee!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: shanghaimandi
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel after searching and searching for a reasonable rate in NYC. The hotel is old and please don't arrive expecting anything too special. However, it looks like a lot of renovation has been going on and our room was tastefully decorated and had a new feel to it. The rooms are small (which I hear is typical of Manhattan) but functional and clean. No sign of Bedbugs either which was a relief! Coffee was provided every morning in the lobby. The staff was helpful and the location was perfect! A two minute walk to the subway...within 10 minutes you can be in Times Square or walk to Central Park. During our stay here, there was only one working elevator which was very small. At times, there was a queue to get to the upper floors but it was never much of a problem. The a/c unit in our room was just a window unit and a bit loud but provided some 'white noise' at night to drown out the city noise. There is also a market right around the corner and rooms all have a mini fridge so we just picked up some breakfast supplies and ate in the room each morning. This helped keep our daily spending down too! Overall, this hotel has some European charm to it. The location was perfect for us and the rate was the best to be found in the city. I would recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget looking for a nice place to stay in Manhattan!

Reviews.Title: “very bad service including the reservation manager”
Reviews.Author: misha12360713
Reviews.Content: All of the hotel staffs including the reservation manager are not willing to listen to their customers complaint about their hotel including the way they do business with their own vendors. Stay out of this hotel. You will be regretted!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, and correct hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pevredail
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel I know in New York. The rooms where OK, location close to the subway, walking distance from Central Park. I had booked a room for 4 but when checking in there were no more left but the staff after asking if it was ok gave me 2 rooms for the same price. Overall good experience, but I might try to find something more budget friendly in New York next time (if possible at all).

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: ediggs
Reviews.Content: Great location, convenient to subway, great neighborhood markets, tons of nearby restaurants, short stroll to Central Park. Daughter & I spent 3 nights. No problem checking in . . . comfy room, nice amenities, even though small . . . spacious bathroom. Would definitely stay here again. Very nice feature was coffee in lobby till noon, followed by fresh ice chilled water with lemon wheels . . . just thing to quench your thirst going in or going out. Some remolding still going on, but did not bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, GREAT Location”
Reviews.Author: McTrvel
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, super friendly and helpful. The location is superb. Close to the metro, close to parks, museums, restaurants, supermarket... Just great location. The hotel is ooold, so rooms show it, even with the new renovation, our bathroom was especially old looking and a bit dingy, but nothing major.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in NYC!!!”
Reviews.Author: ellen3057
Reviews.Content: We love to stay at Belleclaire every time we come to NYC! Their service is super prompt and front desk folks (especially Maria) are exceptional! We love the charm and character of its age. I've read that Mark Twain once lived there! Location is the best! Wonderful Upper West Side neighborhood that's safe and close to subway! Service, cleanliness, friendliness, location, and price.......what more can I say? We're coming back for another week next summer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location close to Central Park”
Reviews.Author: Adelle58
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at Hotel Belleclaire. This was our second visit and we decided to upgrade to a deluxe king room. It was not as indicated in the photo, quite a bit smaller with no outdoor light coming from the window at anytime of day as it was on the first floor. The room itself was clean and the bathroom was a good size. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. There are several grocery stores and 24 hour restaurants nearby that serve a wide variety of food. Although we enjoy the proximity to Central Park we will look for something different next time. The extra price did not equate to a better room.

Reviews.Title: “I love Hotel Belleclaire!”
Reviews.Author: CMK2
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were there from June 8th til June 14th. Something about the "oldness" of the hotel made me feel like I was living a part of years gone by. The staff were all phenomenal, from the front desk, the doormen...everyone! They are very friendly and all of my minor complaints were immediately met with changes to assure our satisfaction and comfort. Our room was very clean and more than roomy enough for two people. We've stayed in other hotels in the city where we could barely move passed each other. The in-room fridge and safe were a pleasant surprise. Though the wifi signal was at times low, I had no problem with the connection. The ac was noisy, but the weather was so nice (we're from Texas) that we were able to stay comfortable with the windows open. The only real inconvenience, as others have stated, were the elevators. I am pleased to read that they are now all fully functional. I'm looking forward to staying at the Hotel Belleclaire again next year when I return to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Newyorkredsox
Reviews.Content: The staff was very good and the location was in a good neighborhood close to subway stations and some decent restaurants. We'd stay there again, but it wasn't perfect. They advertise free wi-fi but we were never able to get a consistently strong signal in our room. We either took the computer to the lobby or to the Starbucks down the street. We'd planned to use the wi-fi connection to help plan our trip, make reservations, check emails, etc but couldn't really do that conveniently. Also,the elevators we slow, small, and creaky. We took the stairs a lot. The rooms were small but nice enough with flat screen tv, refrigerator, and safe. Overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Service was a 10. It's an older hotel. If you know that going in then you will love the place. Those who are older think of the”
Reviews.Author: TheLucyFan
Reviews.Content: When I arrived 3 things were not working in my room. I talked to the front desk and the head of repairs and within 2 hours EVERYTHING was fixed or new. The service was OUTSTANDING!!! if you want Times Square area it's a fast 4 minute subway ride. Walking to Lincoln Center. One minute walking to the Beacon theatre. I would stay at the Belleclaire again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Abena
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was wonderful. From the front desk staff (especially Ashley) to the soap in the bathroom, it was top notch. Perfect location, easy to get to bus, subway, taxi. The room was a bit small but had everything we needed, beautifully appointed. I was especially blown away by the beverage station in the entrance that served ice cold lemon water from a lovely glass dispenser. The perfect thirst-quencher for a hot New York day, and SO elegant! Little touches like this made the Belleclaire distinctive. in fairness, those not familiar with the (constant) sounds of New York might find the noise level a problem (my son did, I didn't). The elevators, as others has noted, were temperamental, not a big problem for me. Hands down, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LynnTTT
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night and got a good deal since it was a Sunday. Nice location on the West Side near museums, restaurants, subway lines, etc. Much quieter than the mid-town hotels. Staff very polite and helpful. Coffee and tea in lobby in the AM and lemonade in afternoon. Doorman at door. Room was very clean, bathroom was huge. Flat screen TV very nice. All in all, an excellent bargain. Booked thru expedia

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: Appius
Reviews.Content: When i first checked in, I was assigned a room on the 6th floor. I noted that it was close to a box room and there seemed to be some renovations in the corridor. In the room, there was some unfinished carpentry work in window area and there were no curtains on the window. I returned to reception and was offered an upgrade for what I understood was to be a higher price. This I declined explaining again that the room was not ready for occupancy. I was reassigned by the pleasant reception staff to a 1st floor room which was smaller but meant I didn't have to wait 5 minutes each time for the elevator. The good: Free wireless internet, good choice of TV channels, large bathroom with good shower, small fridge. The unsatisfactory: Airconditioning - when powered on, it sounds like a train rushing through the room. No safe, Flies in room - a different one every night I admit but a bit unsettling, indifferent housekeeping - I eventually left the 'do not disturb' permanently on door. Overall not bad but a bit expensive for what it offers

Reviews.Title: “Cool, clean, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KohkomJ
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Belleclaire in Upper Manhattan. The room was stylish, comfortable, and very clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. It's also located in a great neighborhood in walking distance of all kinds of attractions and close to a subway stop. I liked the hardwood floors in the room -- I wonder about those carpets. I also liked having a little fridge since there were two great markets just around the corner, so I could have breakfast in my room. I rated the sleep quality less than stellar not because of the hotel but because New York can be noisy, especially when garbage trucks make their rounds at 3 a.m. There was only one elevator working while I was there, and it was a trifle idiosyncratic. (I stayed on the 7th floor, but the elevator displayed 6th, and sometime the door would open and close at will.) That was a minor thing, however.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel Can't wait to visit again.”
Reviews.Author: smitherines6
Reviews.Content: Right on Broadway, the King Suite was great. If you are on the street, yes there is noise, but worth it! The elevators are small and slow. Prepare for it and it's not too bad. The staff was accomodating and the place was clean and safe. Close to everything! The cafes that are close are great. Explore the neighborhood! Can't wiat to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MURS40
Reviews.Content: Hands down the friendliest hotel staff I've ever encountered. The room was modern and spotless. The bed was very comfortable. I would most definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, accommodations, service, and value-Recommend Highly”
Reviews.Author: badflamingo
Reviews.Content: Great upper west side location for Thanksgiving stay. Just a few blocks away from balloon inflation and Thanksgiving parade route. Great restaurants, shopping, movies, and subway accessible. Room was impeccable, bed amazingly comfortable, wood floors, only con was small bathroom-but worked out fine.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: joemccarthy
Reviews.Content: Decent room for the price-$240/nt. Still under construction but not an impact. Elevators suck and try to get lower floors as you may be taking the stairs. No bedbugs an double checked with bedbuggirl check it on Google. Clean. Small rooms wit no view; AC units are really old and noisy. Ashley, at the front is a doll and very helpful although the nightstaff girl will hardly talk to you. David, Jose at the door canfind you anything. Location is Ok for uptown. Big Nicks a nd Westside market are next door and can provide anything comestible. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull ,nice and hopefully we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: jacob025
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a nice neighborhoo,the stuff help us in any question, the subway near .

Reviews.Title: “New York 2011”
Reviews.Author: MrsPais
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and nice staff hotel. Although a little bit far away from Times Square, is next to a subway station. Very good option in New York. I tottaly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a Vacation”
Reviews.Author: SBoydstun
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a conference. Room was basic, clean, quiet, and service staff friendly. Business travelers, the hotel is a bit of a stretch - no desk and one morning too many people were using internet. Also, location is pretty high up west side, so cab rides to mid-town were about nine bucks one way. That said, for a vacationer who can walk, hotel is well situated to the museums (Natural Museum is very close, Met is just across the park) and upper west side is laid back and cool. I would stay here again when in town to visit friends or vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, UWS, Close to Central Park”
Reviews.Author: travelmiss25
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bellclaire was an overall good experience. We lucked out and got street parking, free for 4 days, we had to alternate the car to the otherside of the street once during the trip but the doorman was helpful and gave us his spot. Our room was located in a wing with no one else staying in it. Our room had a double bed, sink, mirror, closet, chair, and large window. The bathroom (toliet & shower) were located in the hall. This was my first time using a shared bathroom at a hotel, other then a hostel. It was not as bad as I imagined it to be. The only weird part was you had to wash your hands once back in your room..so you had to touch all the door handles to get back to your room. Germ central. The room was very modern and nicely decorated though. Great food in the area...one of my favorite burger joints..Big Nicks is located just downstairs on broadway. They have the most signs you will ever see in a restaurant in your life. Its almost funny. If you can, sit on the patio, the inside is full of history but very crowded. They have super big portions and AMAZING AMAZING FOOD. The washroom in big nicks is scary. Be prepared. Its back where the dishwasher is. No matter, I frequent here when I am in the city. For around $12...and you can customize anything. From diet to meatless meat to glueten free they have it all.. Another two great things in the area..Zabars. Go here for Cheese, Fish, Bread...just walk around and take it all in. This is a city staple and everything in here is wonderful. H&H Bagels is also here...one of the oldest bagel shops in nyc. You can buy a bagel to eat, but the cream cheese is sold seperate and is not homeade..and they don't toast anything. The hotel is located on the Upper West Side. There are many great boutiques in the area, starbucks.. central park is a 10 minute walk..if you walk across to amsterdam there are lots of greats bars..shake shack is nearby..and its an overall great area...right on the subway line. While here, we went out in SoHo. If you are planning on going downtown..beware..its about a 30 minute subway ride...we took a cab back and it was around $20. There was probably alot of places we could have gone to around Belleclaire that would have been good..it was a happening area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lots of character, central park so close”
Reviews.Author: Bilbo200
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were always very friendly, staff member Crysta put us in room 805, it had a great view of broadway. Close to the subway, either 79th or 72nd street. We loved walking through central park to get to all of the museums and art galleries on the upper eastside. Westside market was in the base of the hotel, very convenient. Only problem were the elevators, one was not working and the one the was, was small and slow. Other than that, great staff, great location and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: PolyglotTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights. They're renovating out front but not a problem entering building. Prompt check-in service. Room is small but normal for NYC. Neighborhood is nice. Rooms are clean. Has fridge and own bathroom, flatscreen TV, iron/ironing board, hairdryer. Shower stall not a bathtub. Full length mirror and some closet space. There was only 1 elevator functioning at the time we were there but we were on the second floor and the wait was longer than taking the stairs. The microwave is at the bottom of the staircase. Internet is free but at times couldn't get on b/c too many hotel guests were online. No public computer for use and if you want boarding passes printed you have to email the info to the concierge (they'll give you the email address) who then prints it. I thought that was a hassle plus I don't need them to have my info so I didn't use that service. Location is about 4 subway stops (10 - 15) from Time Square. Very convenient. Just watch the rates per night as they fluctuate frequently.

Reviews.Title: “sad view from the window for that price!”
Reviews.Author: whites81
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel to relax after a long week of conference. I just wanted to chill out and enjoy a nice weekend of shopping and meeting friends before back home. From the photos, I was expecting a bright spacious room, or at least some view of Boroadway... nope. And I paid LOTS for it. My room was a small double, indeed clean and with a very comfy bed, and the plus side of no nasty carpet, but so so tiny. Not even a small desk, a part from the bedside table. I had to place everything on the small fridge, located on the floor. I didn't think the fridge location was really hygienic, however I must say the inside was clean and shiny. No storage space at all: the so call wardorbe was too tiny to fit my luggage into, and the few hangers were not enough for my clothes. the upper shelf was filled with covers so I could not place anything on it, therefore I had to leave all my clothes on the open luggage on the floor, totally feeling like a temporary passenger, not feeling at home or even close to it. The bathroom was very clean even if basic, and fresh towels were provided for me even if I went out quite late in the morning. The worst thing ever was the view from the window: a brick wall. Next to it, another brick wall. If I really really stretched my neck, I could see a 10x10 cm of sky, very high above the building. It felt like a prison. Plus I didn't want to leave the window open, since it was very dusty and dirty with pigeons feathers on the outside. On the good side, the staff was really friendly and the location is unbeatable, and there are lots of nice places to eat around. however, since I wanted to chill out after a buzzing day in the city, this did not work at all. I just felt kind of claustrophobic in that room (I think it was room 629, but not sure) and for what I paid, I'm not sure I'd like to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of positives”
Reviews.Author: onedude
Reviews.Content: Booked through hotwire.com for May 21, $182 plus fees and taxes. I was a little unsure when I entered the lobby, but turns out the Hotel Belleclaire are undergoing a significant renovation effort. The room I checked into (#830) was freshly painted with a new bathroom and new linens. Flat screen TV, double/full size bed, and desk in room. Free wifi throughout. I only had some small negatives to report; the air-con is the old type where there is a unit mounted in the window, it didn't do much to cool the room. The elevators take a LONG time to move through the 9 floors of the hotel. Outside of that, I was completely satisfied with my stay. Broadway and 77th is a long way uptown, but for the price (on what was a very busy Saturday night in Manhattan) I was pleasantly surprised with my stay. Would recommend for a single or a couple traveling together, rooms are too small to accommodate more than 2 people comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location, nice rooms, comfortable beds, a great value!”
Reviews.Author: cmichelon
Reviews.Content: We were'nt sure we would like the hotel as we usually stay at a bit posher place across the street, but we were very pleasently surprised and will definately come back to stay again. The staff was amazing, very helpful and friendly, even greeting us by name as we came into the lobby. The doorman went out of his way to find a big enough cab for multiple bags (moving kids home from college) and 4 people en route to the airport. Our rooms were quiet, clean and very comfortable. I would highly recommend the Belleclair.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JimboLav
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel in a fabulous location. Rooms are small (but its NYC), spotlessly clean and very comfortable. Staff are friendly and helpful. They do need to address the elevator issue- only one was working while we stayed which was a bit frustrating at times. They provide tea and coffee in the lobby in the morning which was great but tea/coffee making facilities in the room would be better. The location on the upper west side is fabulous for central park and close enough to Times Square, 5th Ave, 42nd street, Lincoln centre etc to walk to or you can get the subway 2 blocks away if you are lazy. It's a fairly residential neighbourhood so no tacky tacky touristy places but loads of great restaurants, fast food and pubs to try most frequented by locals and all busy. One last thing check out Big Nicks diner just round the corner on Broadway - a true "dive" but with the best food around particularly if you like to stuff yourself for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ericstev
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem, the rooms are nice and clean, The staff was courteous, and I had the feeling that they really cared that I enjoyed my stay. There is no restaurant on site but come on, there are dozens of good places to eat just a few minutes walk away. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant "little" hotel, great location, helpful and courteous staff!”
Reviews.Author: danhorr
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Very on broadway so easy to find a two minute walk from 79th street metro. 10 minute walk to Natural History museum and central park and a load of great fruit shops/delis around the neighbourhood. ROOM: VERY CLEAN, great toiletries in the bathroom, good visitors guide in the room and plenty of channels on the TV for the morning news etc. STAFF: Great welcome with complimentary maps and guides and clear instructions on the room etc. Helpful for directions and advice on transport to the airport and the like. Would definitely recommend the Belleclaire and stay again. My single complaint is the lift... SO SLOW, but if that is the worse thing that you get in an NYC then I'm happy!

Reviews.Title: “Is the beautiful room worth the risky elevator ride? Maybe not...”
Reviews.Author: pastorlaura9
Reviews.Content: Our first experience of this hotel was one of being stuck in an elevator. Standing in an elevator with five other people, along with our luggage, the elevator (the only one out of the two which was working) got stuck between the 6th and 7th floors. When we got off of the elevator, the staff was unhelpful. They gently informed us that this was the risk we ran by getting onto such an old elevator, and that this is not an unusual occurrence. From there on out, we rode the staff elevator which is in the midst of renovation (along with the rest of the hotel). Our understanding is that the hotel has been under renovation for a long time, and it doesn't seem to be ending soon. On a positive note, our room was beautiful. Although completely lacking in storage space, we appreciated the modern style and fixtures. We would definitely return to this hotel on the basis of the room, as well as on the basis of location. Besides for the unprofessional response to, and potentially dangerous condition of the elevator, the service on a whole was sub-par. The bellhop was unable to direct us on where to park, and was uninformed as to the parking regulations of the street on which the hotel is situated. The front desk directed us to a parking garage across the street which offers discounts to those staying in the hotel. Unfortunately, there were three garages across the street. When we contacted the front desk to inquire as to which parking garage was the correct one, we were strongly encouraged to use the valet parking instead. The front desk ignored our repeated requests regarding the parking garage. What it comes down to is that we loved the room. It was beautiful, comfortable and the location was ideal. However, I don't know that we'd stay at the Hotel Belleclaire again. We'd need the renovations to finally be completed, the staff to be informed, and for the elevator to be fully functional.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best deals in town!”
Reviews.Author: wilfcb3
Reviews.Content: I found this through TripAdvisor and it is as good as reviewed. Rooms are clean, bathroom fittings topnotch and bed firm with nice Frette linen. All you can ask for with friendly front desk personnel. Free coffee/tea in the morning which you can pick up at the lobby on your way out. For the price they were offering, it can't be beat. Nice touch with front desk calling to check up if everything is ok with the room after check in. It is very near a subway stop on the red line (on 78th) and is close to Duane Reade and Trader Joe's for some snacks and stuff you want to bring back to the hotel. Nice quiet neighborhood with a weekend market . Great hotel and plan to stay there again when in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: LarsRo
Reviews.Content: 4 years ago our family decided to have vacation in the Big Apple. More or less by chance, I found this hotel and booked a room. When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised. A very nice hotel with spacious rooms, comfortable beds, a small fridge (no minibar), flat screen TV, clean and if one gets the rooms facing Hudson River, very quiet to be on Manhattan. Last week we decided to make another trip to the Big Apple and chose the same hotel. During these 4 years that have passed since our previous visit, it has improved very much. Service is even better than before. Every morning they serve complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby. Even by European standards, the coffee is quite tasty and with a good strength. There is free complimentary wifi. However, this is one of the few things that are not perfect. The capacity of the network provided by Wanderport is very limited. In particular in the mornings it is more or less impossible to log on to the network due to too many subscribers on the network. Otherwise, it works fine. The hotel also has a business center where one can borrow a computer and printer for 5 dollars for 20 minute session and e g checkin on flights on the internet and print out boarding passes. There is no restaurant or breakfast served in the hotel, but across the street there is a quite good diner. For those who prefer to make their own breakfast in their rooms (since they are equipped with fridges) there is a food market just around the corner from the hotel. When we visited the hotel last week, one of the elevators were broken (out of total three elevators) so there was sometimes some waiting to get access to the elvators, but that is just minor temporary problems. All in all we can highly recommend this hotel. It has a great location, very close to the American Museum of Natural History, Central Park and the Metropolitan Museum and just a few subway stops from Times Square. There is a subway stop just two blocks away from the hotel. The hotel is located in a residential area, so it is less noisy than in the neighborhood closer to Times Square and the theater district.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lahamn
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel since it was close to a relative on the upper West Side. Checked in on Saturday early afternoon and checked out Tuesday morning. Two of the elevators were out for the weekend and we had to stuff into the freight elevator with construction debris and trash. The wait for the elevator was too long - easier to walk down than up to the 6th floor. Very stuffy in the room - the air con didn't cool off very well. Expected the maid to make up the room on the weekend but it never happened - came back to the room after an entire day out and was very disappointed to see that we were not taken care of. Called down for clean towels and it took a while for them to be delivered (probably due to only having one working elevator). There was coffee on Monday morning in the lobby - what happened to Saturday and Sunday?? Overall, a very disappointing hotel and stay. Felt like a Motel 6. (No offense to Motel 6 but this was not the same rates or expectations). The room was so small that a dresser couldn't even fit and wasn't in the room. it certainly wasn't large enough for a king bed (we knew we were getting a queen bed, but didn't realize the diminutive size of the room).

Reviews.Title: “very friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: geezaglen
Reviews.Content: you will be aware of what new york has to offer, so i will talk about the hotel. great location, away from the main hussle, next to a subway so that was handy, opposite a great diner which if you strolled over on a morning would deliver your order for free.the room was very clean and tidy, the bed very comfortable....it was a typical old fashioned new york hotel but full of ambianse......the staff were pleasant and friendly and sent us a gift which was so nice.i would recommend this place to anyone coming to new york, i loved it and will come again.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, tiny room, but a bargain, especially with the parking package”
Reviews.Author: Rhapsodyinblue
Reviews.Content: We usually stay with the hotel chains, but being we needed to be on the Upper West Side, and not being happy about paying $300+ for a midtown hotel, we tried it. It was easy to find, and we purchased a package that included valet parking, which made a bargain even more so. The hotel is very old, and boutique (defined as small, not fancy!). No central air, a tiny room by chain hotel standards. An in window air conditioning unit which fortunately we did not need to use. It was clean, convenient, and luckily we did not need to spend a lot of time in the room! I can't recommend it only because I want something larger, but if this is OK with you, go for it. Nothing WRONG with it!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: samundo
Reviews.Content: Hotel was going under construction. Stuff from builders everywhere around. Rooms had the most terrible loud aircon ever.
