(I'm a pretty relax person but that was LOUD) We were with a 1 year old baby, they changed our room without letting us know - moving all our stuff to the another room while we weren't there! . After long chats, we had a refund from one night. Still, all aircons where loud and the most terrible views you can imagine from the window - like a brick wall only 50cm away. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great stay here, again!”
Reviews.Author: haze73
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd year we have stayed at this hotel. We stayed in the Parlor Suite and the layout is different this year. Brand new bathrooms and very nice. Instead of the bed in the main room it is now a pull out sofa, large enough to fit 3 under 10 without complaints. Having two seperate rooms both with tv is fantastic for us parents. There is now free tea and coffee in the lobby in the morning, the staff are friendly and helpful and the location of this hotel is just fantastic. There is a same day drycleaner around the corner. A pharmacy 1 block away, A food market downstairs and the best breakfast in town opposite at Manhatten diner. 5 min walk to H&H bagels and Zabars. Truly spoilt for choice and the subway is only 2 blocks away. Only gripe was that we did not get bottled water everyday but would not hesitate to stay again and recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect - but loved it anyway!”
Reviews.Author: Moci
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Belleclaire for 5 nights, with a friend and 2 teenagers in a double Deluxe, and although the hotel is far from perfect, we had a great time here! First the negative: the A/C in the room was quite loud, the radiator clonks loudly at times, but since the windows are so poorly made/insulated, the street noise is generally the loudest. But every time a fire engine siren woke me up at night, I thought "I´m in New York!!!", smiled, and then fell asleep again, so personally I wouldn´t want to change for a quiet room with a boring view. Also, the elevators were slow, the bathroom was tiny, the front desk area small and non-impressive, but still - we could not help but love the Belleclaire! And there are quite a few reasons to: as mentioned in previous reviews the location is terrific, with Central Park, Museum of Nat. History and Subway real close, and 24-hour markets and diners in the immediate area. The room rate was greet for our budget, and we love free wi-fi and coffee (served in the lobby in the morning), beds and linens were comfy and clean, the room service quick and friendly, front desk staff were smiling and helpful and the doormen always courteous and informative. Of all the staff I have to mention Doorman David in particular: he quickly felt like an old friend, he answered all our strange questions with a smile, and his dining suggestions were spot on. Summary: if you want a good deal, a great location, great staff, and a new-yorkish feeling instead of the old, boring luxury, don´t hesitate to make your reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable and relaxing break in nyc”
Reviews.Author: hibbert270
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay here was excellant, the staff are all welcoming and are always on hand to assist you with any issues you have, be it a corkscrew for a bottle of wine in the evening or help with the safe when you cannot remember the code! On our arrival we were informed we would be on the 9th floor which was still under construction, however, the receptionist insisted we return in the morning and they would have another room ready. So we did as they said the next morning and proceded to spend our day in nyc, only to return and find we had a lovely deluxe king room on the 2nd floor which was very spacious and overlooked Broadway. Plus they had moved our luggage for us. This started the great holiday for my boyfriend's 30th birthday. Each day from 6:30am you can get tea/coffee in the lobby and daily newspapers are delivered to your room. The cleaners do a fantastic job and cleaned our room every day. The hotel is only 2 blocks to the subway which took us all over nyc, and it is only 2 streets from the American Museum for Natural History and Central Park. The diner across the road does nice breakfasts and they deliver to the hotel if required. We would definately consider stopping here again on our future trips to nyc and are entirely grateful for their customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for small pockets!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got a double deluxe room which is large, modern , clean and equipped with fridge( you need it in the heat of August), flat screen TVand air conditioning. The first room we got was very large and nice but on Broadway and that was just too noisy at night for us. The hotel staff moved us the next day to the back of the hotel which has great views on lovely roof tops and the Hudson river. The staff is helpful and polite, the Manhattan dinner across the road delivers good value tasty food night and day. The location of the hotel is great: only two blocks from the natural history museum and Central park. I think this hotel offers great value for money. Will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in a nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: sudipn
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Hotel Bellclaire last week. I have stayed in many NYC hotels and this was one of my favorites. The room was large with two double beds that had nice down comforters. We had a flat screen TV that has every channel and the hotel offers free WIFI with great coverage. The staff was extremely helpful and allowed us to check in early. The location is great and easy to get to via public transportation or taxi. We love the Upper West Side because it feels like a real neighborhood. There are lots of nice restaurants and great shopping right out the door of the hotel. The subway is just two blocks away. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC. It is a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: smadarcat
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel i stayed at many years ago and was happy to return to because of the wonderful staff and really great location in the upper west.When we arrived we received a really noisy room (LOUD street noise),we requested a quiet room and the next day we recieved one with effiency and good service. The room was spacious,clean and overall great. We love love this location, subway very close,supermarket next door and many lovely restaurants all around this area. Overall great stay, great value for money and lovely staff. By the way,many rennovations going on in the hotel but we weren't in the room during the day so it didn't bother us.Also it would be great if both elevators were working but it really wasn't that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Take me to the Hotel Belleclaire”
Reviews.Author: engprof43
Reviews.Content: At 77th and Broadway, this hotel is perfectly located for museum visits, Broadway plays, movies, and shopping. On arrival after midnight, I received an unexpected upgrade and found a clean, comfortable room with no bedbugs!!! I especially appreciated the good lighting since I am a late-night reader. The staff was warm, attentive, and the fresh flowers in the lobby cheered me on the cold, rainy days of my stay. With a great market around the corner, bakery down the street, and subway and bus stops on the block, this "penny pincher" had I all I needed. I'd rather pay a bit more for a hotel like the HB and economize on meals (though there are plenty of good restaurants in the neighborhood.). I will continue to stay at the HB for every visit to NYC. English professor from Norman, Ok.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: CbeSwiss
Reviews.Content: Really well located, nice staff, clean rooms. Close to everything (subway, shopping, Central Park, ...). We really enjoyed our stay (8 nights). One negative point: the works on our floor, right next to our room... they started really early in the morning, so we couldn't sleep anymore. Too bad when your are jet-laged and tired from visiting the city! Except that, our stay was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Could'nt wait to get back to the hotel and the lovely location.”
Reviews.Author: Joburgtraveller10
Reviews.Content: "Three South African Ladies in New York" - We arrived from 3 different locations around the globe to the Hotel Belleclaire. I found the hotel based on the trip advisor reviews. For 5 days arriving back at the hotel was like coming home. A HUGE thanks to the staff who were on duty from the 11th March to the 16th March, from the front desk to the doormen to the people that delivered requests made for items, to the room. Always polite and always professional. The room on the 7th floor was clean and the bathroom perfectly fine. The location is fantastic, away from the frenetic central manhattan district and yet a few Metro stops away from 42nd street. The elevator is tricky, but you can beat it. I was so charmed by the general location as well. Miss my trip already.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Comfortable Hotel in the Upper West Side!”
Reviews.Author: fashionable_cupcake
Reviews.Content: Aside for the decent price for a deluxe double room, the location and the historical background of this hotel, encouraged my decision to stay at Hotel Belleclaire for my NYC trip. The location of this hotel was in the Upper West Side. There were many diners, supermarkets, pharmacies, retail stores and banks nearby. Some nearby supermarkets and food establishments were also open 24 hours. The hotel was a close walk to Central Park (Strawberry Fields) and the American Museum of Natural History. The nearest subway was two blocks away and taxis were available non-stop at every hour. As well, there were multiple well-known car rental depots right across the street, if you needed to rent a car. As for the hotel, I do have positive and negative comments to make. I stayed in room 605 (deluxe double) with a view of Broadway. First of all, I definitely recommend reserving a room with a view. The window was huge and you were able to open the window to enjoy fresh air and the nice view. On the other hand, the curtains were nonfunctional. Yes, it blocked the room from the sun in the morning, but it was hard to open and close the curtains. The room had an AC, but I never used it. The room also had a radiator, but I didn’t need to change the setting or anything. However, another downside of the room was sporadically throughout the night, I heard either the radiator or pipe or ventilation noises. The noise came on and off, but for short periods of time. Room 605 also had: two double beds, a mini fridge, an in room safe (pay per use), a small closet, a flat screen TV, a floor length mirror, an iPod speaker/alarm clock, a small round table with two chairs, and a small washroom. The beds and pillows were very comfy and cozy. The mini fridge was great because I had a place to store leftovers or fresh snacks from the market close by. The channels on the TV provided plenty of options. The closet was small, but it stored two pieces of luggage, while a third one was placed outside of the closet. The iPod speaker/alarm clock was also great, but it wasn’t a charging dock. The WIFI Internet was also good, but at times slow. In general, the room was clean and relaxing. As for the washroom, it was very small, with limited counter space, but it got the job done. It was clean and the shower’s water pressure wasn’t that bad. They also offered toiletries, which my travel companion said was acceptable. Lastly, the walls were thick enough for you to not hear your neighbors. As for their services, they had luggage storage if you checked in early, but check-in began at 3pm. I arrived at 8 am on March 3 and was told to come back around 1pm or they would call me when my room was ready. However, once I came back at 1, my room wasn’t ready. So, I stayed in the lobby to rest. I checked in around 3pm, which was okay, but exhausting after traveling to NYC in an early morning flight. Regardless, the guy at reception was friendly and he did as best as he can to check when my room was ready. As well, one particular bellhop was really friendly and worked as best as he can to get tips. Too bad I didn’t get his name, but he worked there in the early mornings or throughout the day. A last downside was the one small and slow elevator they had for guests. No more than four people were in there at a time. There was another elevator, but it was still being repaired. Overall, my interaction with the various employees at this hotel was delightful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in a more relax area than a typical touristy area in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Belleclaire works for us.”
Reviews.Author: MiaRoller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 night stay. Hotel Belleclaire is a great location (Upper West side), close to the Metro line, and is very reasonably priced on the web. Our room was ready on arrival, asked for quiet room and received a 'wall view'. OK with me as I spend little time in my room when visiting NYC. But later found I had to move as the room was freezing from the boiler being off. Located to room on 4th floor facing street. It was a deluxe queen room, very clean, but had noise problems in the early morning. Trucks deliver at 4am, 5am, and 6am, as well as the trash pick-up truck. Windows are semi-open from the window air conditioning units that are sitting in the windows. Duct tape surrounds the window frame for insulation. Construction was not a problem. The workers are there, but everything is kept clean and away from guests. I feel very safe at this hotel, the location is great, prices are reasonable, and staff are trained and professional. Showers are hot, plenty of products given, floors are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: ngscls
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this hotel - I had stayed once before with a group of girlfriends a couple of years ago. Originally I was drawn to it because it offered affordable rooms and had a two bedroom option. I came back because I loved it the first time. They've remodeled, and it remains a great value with beautiful rooms and a lovely staff. It's only two blocks from the subway and in a great neighborhood. Not touristy at all - it was the perfect place for us.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance on a budget”
Reviews.Author: pcooperwhite
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Room was immaculate, with simple, modern decor, and slightly larger than other chic-cheap hotels I've visited in NYC. Comfortable bed. Front desk and doorman were very friendly and helpful - doorman went out of his way to try to hail a cab following one of NYC's famous blizzards January '11. This is also one of my favorite neighborhoods in NY - very safe, a great mix of residential and commercial, and very convenient to Lincoln Center, Central Park, etc. Subway an easy walk. There are residential apartments in the hotel as well, and I was charmed to hear a musician practicing the piano faintly through the walls (he or she was very good so it was nice, not a nuisance - and at reasonable hours!) We also heard none of the previously reported renovation construction noise.

Reviews.Title: “Better with room upgrade”
Reviews.Author: aucuba
Reviews.Content: Charming and cozy old-style hotel. Big mistake to get a room with a shared bathroom--my neighbors kept shuttling between their room and the bathroom, slamming the doors, until 2 a.m. The room with a private bathroom was $25 more/night, but completely worth it. Even though I was by the stairs it was much quieter. You also get a safe in which to stow your laptop and a much better desk. One elevator was not working, so the trip to the room make the exercise room unnecessary. Good restaurants on Stuyveysant St. are a short walk from the hotel, and it's convenient to reach Columbia University on the 1 train.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location & pleasant staff but don't go there for a good nights sleep.”
Reviews.Author: packman59
Reviews.Content: Two comments: 1) There was a very irritating motor running outside our window that cycled on and off every 20-30 seconds around the clock - 24/7. We had to have background "white" noise or music on when sleeping to drown out the motor. When brought to the attention of the staff, they were sympathetic but we were informed they knew about this annoyance but it was a neighboring property and they could not do anything about it. Other than that, good experience. 2) The "fitness" center needs to be better equipped.

Reviews.Title: “New Favorite New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lexmeissner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Belleclaire for the first time this March, and loved the hotel immediately. The staff is wonderful, the room was a little small but very clean, very comfortable, and well appointed. The hotel is easily reached from the subway, and is super convenient to Central Park, Museum of Natural History and good eats. We enjoyed walking the streets, which are more residential than midtown - though it was also easy to get to midtown and the theater district for our shows. We had a great time and will use this hotel again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “solidly two stars”
Reviews.Author: dash1_98
Reviews.Content: Clanging pipes all night, mold all over the bathroom, paint smells, ammonia smells, broken elevator, slow bell hops, and when I checked in and asked them to match the most recent price listed on their own website the desk person said no. For $192 per night, you can do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on the Upper West Side!”
Reviews.Author: Califrog_82
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to NYC and I have to say this hotel would definitely be my choice on return. The room was very comfortable and clean. It was more spacious than I imagined a NY hotel room would be. The location is perfect. Only a few blocks to Central Park and the Museum of Natural History. Good walking shoes is a must! I would recommend trying Big Nicks for dinner; the pizza is to die for! And picking up snacks at the Westside market. Both are on broadway, around the corner from the hotel lobby. I really wished the room had a microwave so we could have heated up our leftovers, but everything was still good cold. My only complaint would be that the heater worked a little too well. Even at its lowest setting, we still ended up opening the window (while it was snowing no less!!) because it was so hot. And this is coming from two southern california girls! Also the hotel needs to update their in-room hotel guides and expedia profile. There is no gift shop and the pricing for the diner which acts as room service is not accurate. Something for light sleepers to note: there is a fire station right down the street. My friend and I sleep like the dead so it really didn't bother us but when I had to get up for the bathroom, the noise was quite obvious.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lavatube
Reviews.Content: This was a rather nice spot to stay in. The room was a decent size. I liked the upper west side as a location, near the museums. Its not all that fancy, but the rooms are well appointed. The were working to repaint the lobby and such. The elevator is, of course, tiny. The creative naming of the shampoo, conditioner, and lotion kept me guessing which was what. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Torn”
Reviews.Author: erntas
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about the hotel itself: we enjoyed the room and the price was more than reasonable, but I can't give it the rave review I'd intended on because they completely blew off my traveling companion's wake-up call and his missed his flight, adding 12 hours to his trip home that day. On the one hand, this is unlikely to ever happen to a TripAdvisor guest in the future, but on the other hand, the hotel wake-up call is something we've come to rely on as travelers and this failure really had an impact on the trip. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 60946Barbara
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable, clean hotel located in a great neighborhood. Our room was basic (although the shower was beautiful & we want to copy it for our home!), and shiny clean. But the real magic of the Belleclaire is the wonderful staff. Phone calls pre-visit were answered by warm, friendly and understanding voices (we needed to change reservations twice). The doorman went out of his way to point out a free overnight parking space for our car - a great savings for us. Everyone was so nice I felt I was in some small cozy town in the midwest somewhere - except it was in a wonderful part of NYC. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive hotel with character on upper west side”
Reviews.Author: Carmela_P
Reviews.Content: The Belleclaire is in an interesting old building on the corner of B'way (entrance on W. 77th). This has become one of my preferred hotels because: !. The location is ideal for transportation (subway stops nearby on Broadway), shopping, dining, strolling, going to Central Park, and more; 2. The rooms vary in size from very very small to enormous, but they are comfortable, nicely furnished, clean, and quiet; 3. Staff are unobtrusive but friendly and helpful--a broken plug was fixed and I had a forgotten item mailed back to me (I thought I would never see it again); 4. You get good value for the price. I will definitely stay here again when I am in NY.

Reviews.Title: “upper west side character”
Reviews.Author: shopsaround
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at The Belleclaire, and I enjoyed our visit very much. I had lived on the Upper West Side some twenty plus years ago, so it felt like staying in a real New York neighborhood apartment, rather than a predictable tourist crash pad. The new decor is sort of hip urban-chic which transposes onto the vintage charm quite well. We had a king room on the corner, which was very spacious due to the round shape of the room. Unfortunately, that meant that the bathroom was quite small. This is an old Beaux Artes era building that has been updated quite effectively, but the architecture can be quaint or limiting, depending on your point of view. I found it charming. The ceilings are high and the windows large and overlooking Broadway. Again, the windows are a little drafty: charming or annoying? I didn't mind. In fact I liked not feeling hermetically sealed into a new building. The heat is very efficient from a cast iron radiator, which once you know how to control it, is great. It was off when we got into the room, but It warmed up quickly, once I turned it on. It can get hot, so no need to leave it on while we were out all day. The street noise can be LOUD all hours of the day and night. But I knew what to expect and my trusty earplugs insured me a great night's sleep in the very comfortable bed. I am a big fan of in-room coffee makers, so I was a little nervous about the absence of one in the room. But the 24 hr diner across the street delivers for free(tips, of course) and had piping hot, good coffee to the room in minutes after direct dialing it in. The afore mentioned Manhattan Diner is a very good value and the food is great. The location of The Belleclaire on Broadway and 77th made it a convenient spot to sightsee from. The proximity to the subway and crosstown bus on 79th was perfect, and safe even late at night. You can walk in any direction from the hotel and find any type of restaurant you could want. Great shopping and a real neighborhood vibe. The service at the hotel was OK, not that we needed anything beyond basic check in/out. Everyone was very nice. I really liked The Belleclaire. I would stay there again and would recommend it highly. My only caveat is to take earplugs and slippers and enjoy the vintage charm and character of an elegant NYC landmark.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sgurns
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the Upper West Side. Very convenient to the Subway (79th Street station is only a block away and on the 1 line) - so very easy to get to attractions like Times Square, Statute of Liberty etc. Staff were very helpful and happy to deal with our enquiries and had discount tickets for attractions such as the American Museum of Natural History (which is only a couple of blocks away). Room was exactly as described and a good option for family of 2 adults and 2 children. Little things like free wifi also were great. Plenty of eating options close by. There were some renovations happening, but it didn't disturb us as they occured during the day when we were out. Would definitely recommend for those wanting a quieter and cheaper option than Midtown. Will definitely consider again next time in NYC Note: The Hotel booked us a car to JFK through Arrows Car Service. The driver was rude and not helpful with luggage. No reflection on the great service of the Belleclaire, but I would ask them not to use Arrows again.

Reviews.Title: “a fine choice”
Reviews.Author: stevenmarcweiss
Reviews.Content: i spent three nights in the lovely belleclaire. the recently redecorated rooms have been very tastefully appointed and the accommodations were decidedly a "cut above" most other places i've stayed in new york. my deluxe king was spacious and comfortable in every way. i very much appreciated the relatively noiseless, radiated steam heat, which kept the room comfortable and the temperature fairly constant! and whenever i asked for anything, i was treated very well by the staff a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: a1custom
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in January while on a vacation in NY. Was a very nice hotel - great location (2 blocks from 79th Street Subway) and great staff at the front desk. Couple complaints were noise in our room (windows not sealed), and slow elevator. Other than that was a great stay and would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “first time in new york”
Reviews.Author: KellyL26
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel and a pretty good price (for New York!). The staff were very helpful and the rooms were kept clean. It's freshly renovated so looked quite nice inside.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kaylers
Reviews.Content: Belleclaire Hotel is in a great upper west side neighborhood with tons of shopping and good close by. You're in the perfect location, in between Riverside park and Central Park. The hotel had clean, comfortable rooms, with really friendly staff,. Even though there was a mix up with a family suite we reserved (I was travelling with my boyfriend, his brother and mother),we were moved in the next day with no problems at all. The staff were great with recommending some great food, and we also stumbled upon some great places ourselves! Check out Cafe Frida at Columbus and West 77th St. Amazing Mexican food!!! We had a wonderful time and would stay there again in a heartbeat. :)

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem for Those who Like the Simple, Elegant Life”
Reviews.Author: Tucsonman
Reviews.Content: Love this place. Like a European hotel, well appointed, clean, very reasonably priced. Only one suggestion, a coffee maker in the room would be a great touch. Sure there are places to get coffee downstairs, at any time of day or night (in fact, every food known to man is available within a ten minute walk), but I'm not a morning person. I wake up, I want coffee in the room. Small thing, though, everything else about this place is great!

Reviews.Title: “Good value--great location”
Reviews.Author: SIDSKID
Reviews.Content: The Belleclaire staff is superb--front desk, doormen, housekeeping--everyone does his/her job with gracious, efficient and generous spirit. There is a tear in the upolstery on one banquet in the lobby that has been repaired with clear tape, a little tacky for someplace with great floral arrangements (minimal but colorful). There are two small elevators which operate very well and can each accomodate 4 people and a couple pieces of luggage. The hallways have been renovated on the floors we were on. And we were on several. The first was a nicely renovated room the size of a matchbox with a teeny, tiny closet, only one small drawer for storage and no reading chair. The linens and towels were very white and clean and the room was tidy. The mattress and pillows were comfy. We also weren't happy with the lack of storage and the interior view. So they moved us to a room that had all those things + 3 drawers for storage but no rack over the toilet for our toiletries. So they moved us again to another room which had every things we needed, was a bit larger but had poor lighting and the bathroom had not been renovated beyond its fixtures. All the furniture in the room was a bit dinged and dented but not shabby.There was a blackout shade in all rooms but no curtains in the last which meant we had to keep the room darkened becaue there was nothing to provide privacy when the shade was up. I believe they would have changed our room again but I was exhausted and just wanted to go to sleep. It was also not clear to me what, beyond the size of the bed, made one room standard and another deluxe. The clientele appears to be international and well-mannered. All the rooms we were in were very quiet. Some floors still had revovations going on and we didn't stay there but there was no noise from that work in other parts of the hotel. The wi-fi wasn't working on our floor and the hotel made other arrangements so that I could do my email. I have always stayed on the eastside or in midtown on the west. This was the first opportunity to stay on the upper westside and I think we'll always go back. It's so lively with families walking on the streets, great markets, lots of shops and plenty to do.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location for the price”
Reviews.Author: Amari55
Reviews.Content: Haven't been in NYC in over 30 yrs and just wanted a quick, easy place for a weekend. The hotel was very friendly and helpful. The room was adequate since I wasn't spending anytime there exxcept to sleep. The bed was very comfortable. But the location was superb. Upper West side where families live and plenty of shopping and good restaurants. I plan to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and clean; very nice recently renovated rooms. Near subway.”
Reviews.Author: cjkrautk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 weeknights at $95 a night via hotels.com. Originally placed on top floor where hallways were strewn with plaster and glass and extremely loud knocking and sawing--clearly doing repairs/renovations. A visit back to the front desk and they moved us three floors down without incident; they would have upgraded our room but the only better rooms available were on that floor. We ended up with a corner room with views out to 77th and Broadway. Heat was a little difficult to adjust because it was an in-room radiator (although it did have a brand new register). Small but clean bathroom. Hardwood floors. Closet. A little noisy at night, but that's New York. Very comfortable, modern looking bed. Duvet cover and sheets were fresh and soft. Would definitely return at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Real NYC Experience”
Reviews.Author: JillP9267
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit NYC every winter and not been disappointed with Belleclaire. We are not really interested in touristy stuff so its residential feel is perfect. We love the neighborhood - very family oriented and convenient to subway. Great alternative to Times Square. Staff is very friendly and prices are affordable. A Plus!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Gift!!!”
Reviews.Author: Deni0401
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with tickets to the Met Opera for Christmas, booked a room at Hotel Belleclaire. Great location!! We spent the snowy afternoon in Central Park and Metropolitan Museum of Art, both within walking distance. Got back to hotel to find that they upgraded us to two-bedroom suite -- the gifts keep coming.... Had a nice hot bath before the opera. The front desk staff, doorman, all terrific. The area around hotel has great restaurants -- Check out Sevens Turkish Restaurant on 72nd -- a great find. All in all, a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, value and location”
Reviews.Author: NAEB
Reviews.Content: Great service, room service from Manhattan Diner across the street, excellent location on 77th West at Broadway. Very reasonable price for holiday vacationing. Regular double room is quite small but doable. Room for four (2 large beds) very appealing.

Reviews.Title: “We ahd a great experience here. Service and staff are unparalleled.”
Reviews.Author: BeardsleyZoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our 4 and 2 year old. We were upgraded to a 2-bed suite for free. The room was very comfortable and very clean. We all loved it, especially the kids. The staff are wonderful. One of the door men went out of his way to get us a cab in the blizzard. We loved this place and have recommended this to everyone we know and we will be back here every time we come to New York.

Reviews.Title: “The Belleclaire is a pleasant respite from the cold city”
Reviews.Author: Caroljune
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly greeted and the entire visit was pleasant. The front desk people, the bellhops....EVERYBODY was wonderful. The rooms are large and very Clean. The hotel has character. Location is very nice...local diners all around. We enjoyed our NYC visit very much because of a nice, warm comfy bed to relax in at night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but bare-bones”
Reviews.Author: RubyRed2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights at the Hotel Belleclaire for work in December. Staff was great - very helpful and always cheerful, even during stressful times (e.g., a lobby full of guests whose flights had been cancelled). However, you should be prepared for tiny rooms - not uncommon for NYC - and no frills. No coffee maker, no vending machines, no room service, etc. We bought snacks at the cafe next door and had no problems. The only truly bad part of our stay was the radiator - despite a couple of requests, the temperature in our room was consistently fifteen or twenty degrees higher than in the hallway -- in December!! We kept the bathroom window open whenever we were in the room, which helped it feel a little less like a swamp.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - make your reservation with confidence!”
Reviews.Author: cybergoob
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had to book a last-minute trip and Belleclaire was one of the few hotels in our price range with rooms available. We were extremely leery because we had to share a bathroom with 2 other rooms, but we booked anyway. The charm and cleanliness of the hotel, far outweighed the weirdness factor of a common bathroom. The staff was friendly and competent and the location was perfect. We would not hesitate to make another reservation or to recommend our friends do the same.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel with Great Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JKDelCollo
Reviews.Content: I chose the Belleclaire for my stay because of its close vicinity to Lincoln Center and the Metropolitan Opera House. I loved my stay. The hotel is clean and the staff are very, very friendly and professional. The bed was very comfortable and I heard nothing from the other rooms. I will definitely stay at the Belleclaire again on my next New York visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in NYC”
Reviews.Author: pwheel
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife celebrated our 5th wedding anniversary in Manhatten with a show and a night in the Belleclaire Hotel. As a NYC firefighter I have inspected or stayed in over a 100 hotels in Manhatten. This place, by far, is one of the best I have ever seen. The staff in this hotel were some of the nicest I have ever encountered. The rooms were clean and hotel more than exceeded my expectations. Upon our arrival the general manager (I think his name was scott) actually came out and wished us a happy anniversary. I highly recommend this place to ANYONE who is going to spend a night in NYC. 5 stars!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Belleclaire is the best kept secret in New York City”
Reviews.Author: Suzy96
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler to New York City I recently stayed at The Hotel Belleclaire on 77th and Broadway. The staff was well versed and proffesional on every level, from the front desk to the house keepers, everyone I encountered was informative, polite and respectful. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. Centrel Park and The Museum of Modern History are just 3 blocks away so its location was fantastic for me when I had some down time. I can not wait for my next business trip to NYC to stay at The Hotel Belleclaire, truely the best kept secret on the upper west side.

Reviews.Title: “Tried to rip me off on the bill”
Reviews.Author: docandroo
Reviews.Content: I was in NY for a meeting and had reservations elsewhere for the 2 days of the meeting, but i had wanted to get there early and explore the west end so booked the first night at the Belleclaire. Initially I had gone to hotels.com and found an open rate for 129.00 for the night which I also found on the Hotel website. When I arrived Erika told me that I could get that rate at the front desk as I offered to book online if needed. Much to my surprise, the document that I had initialed for 129.00 for the night was whited out and 149.00 written in stead. I had to speak to 3 different front desk personnel in order to pay the appropriate agreed upon and signed amount. This is called fraud, and while the hotel , location etc were fine I do not recommend doing business with unethical proprietors

Reviews.Title: “Reccomended”
Reviews.Author: SpikeSpiegal
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Belleclaire for a few days before moving into my apartment in New York City. I had reserved one of the rooms with a shared bathroom. The room was clean, fairly spacious, and most importantly, the room was free of bed bugs. Also, sharing a bathroom with other guests is not as bad as it sounds to those who are contemplating getting such rooms. I never saw the other guests in the three days I was there, and the bathrooms were kept clean. The staff is incredibly nice and helpful. They went out of their way to accommodate my needs. The hotel is two blocks away from the nearest subway station. I would recommend this hotel to other people and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience, the employees put service 1st.”
Reviews.Author: carsonsl2
Reviews.Content: The staff really made the difference for our stay. They all seemed glad to be of service and were quite friendly and helpful. We were always greeted with a cheerful smile and they were eager to help when we needed directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff for a great NYC experience”
Reviews.Author: citapepita
Reviews.Content: Just don't expect a big lobby...staff treats visitors like Royalty.b Friendly and went out the way to help. Beautiful old building....in the beautiful upper west side....

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: lenoxdog
Reviews.Content: Finding a hotel room on the eve of the NYC marathon, no small feat. Especially one I could afford! Thanks to hotwire I got a good price at this hotel. I have stayed at other hotels in this neighborhood but have never stayed here. I have lived in Europe and this hotel reminded me of a European hotel - small, not glitzy. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I hope management notices this! The hotel is undergoing renovation so an elevator wasn't working - so get off your duff and take the stairs! Our room was small but comfy. I was glad there was no carpet on the floor - decreases the chance of bedbugs. Our room was on a inner wall and there was only a view of another wall, but so what. AT least it wasn't noisy. The room and bathroom had been renovated , it was very clean. My only complaint is that the heat from the bedroom did not get into the bathroom and it was extremely cold in the morning. I would stay there again as long as the price doesn't go up. The neighborhood is great, lots of good places to eat and we are spared the Louis Vuitton crowd.

Reviews.Title: “77th and Broadway -- hard to beat that.”
Reviews.Author: igirton
Reviews.Content: The Belleclaire is 2 blocks from the 79th St. station on the 1 line, right around the corner from Broadway -- great shopping, good food, great access to everything in the city. It's not hopelessly noisy, and the rooms and bathrooms (I stayed in two) were a good size and quite clean. Pleasant staff, although one charged me incorrectly for a Supershuttle ride to the airport -- the problem was corrected promptly when I returned home from my trip. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy, really noisy”
Reviews.Author: ebbwboy
Reviews.Content: My major gripe about the Belleclaire was the noise level. Our first room was on Broadway and we may as well have been trying to sleep on the street. The room had an air conditioning unit wedged in under the sash window with thin perspex used on either side to fill the gaps. Thin perspex has zero sound insulation properties. The management promptly moved us to a quieter room. It was certainly quieter than the first room, because it was at the rear of the hotel. Unfortunately, all the other rooms' a/c units were banging away all night so it was pretty damned loud. Add to all this the fact that major refurbishment, involving drilling, hammering and allied loud bangage, was going on and you get the picture. Having said all that, I must compliment the staff. Everyone was courteous, friendly and helpful. The location is also good, between the subways at 72nd and 79th, and just across the road from the fantastic Manhattan Diner, a 24-hour establishment that does room service! The rooms were clean and spacious, the bathrooms included a shower and bath. In short, take ear plugs and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: henri_s
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner and brother in Oct 2010. We had a deluxe double room with an extra bed. It is a good hotel and I recommend it to friends too. The exterior looks very nice. Bellboy was friendly and helpful. I requested a high floor room and a street view but we got a room on the 4th floor with no view at all (instead saw a brick wall from the window). Receptionists were very friendly and attentive. They gave us tips on where to go eat etc. The room itself was a standard size, with a pretty wooden floor and a private bathroom. One of the lamps was not functioning, I called the reception and they would immediately send a guy to fix it. Very nice! There is an ice machine downstairs but could not find an ice bucket in the room (used a plastic bag). The A/C unit was loud and we could constantly hear noise/buzz from the downstairs supermarket (A/C unit I guess). The supermarket has a wonderful selection of organic foods and good sandwiches. The bed was wonderful, no bedbugs here! The room had an iron, an ironing board, and a safe. The flatscreen TV was by LG - a good one. Wireless internet connection was fantastic and we could use it at all times without interruption. There was no breakfast so we went to eateries nearby. We used the gym once, the treadmills were ok, but some machines were out of order. We were the only people I could see in the gym during our stay. During at stay the hotel was construction the floor we stayed in - a good sign - but there was some noise at daytime. One of the elevators was not functioning at all during our stay - didn't bother us though as we're sporty and went jogging to the nearby Central Park daily. The location of the hotel is excellent on Broadway and two blocks from subway. I would like to stay here again as it is a good middle class hotel with great service and a good room - but some downsides too.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the photos”
Reviews.Author: mlg67s
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The front desk personnel helpful but. . . The exterior and lobby gave me pause as the leaves were drifting in and the front door and lobby looked liked it could use a major overhaul or at least a good sweep and some paint. . . those first impressions do make a difference. I took the very narrow stairs to my second floor room and opened the door to a strong odor of cleaning products. As I looked around I noticed there was just a shelf in the closet to place folded garments, I could not get the safe to work, saw paint chips, holes in the wall, an exposed radiator, an air conditioner that looked liked it might fall out the window, and furniture that should be on sale in a second hand store. I was able to find accommendations elsewhere and was lucky enough to get a full refund from the hotel. My first night and the rest of my stay was spent at a hotel in the same neighborhood which was equally priced and was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good for NY but pity about the lifts”
Reviews.Author: jmarian
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpfuland the room was quite nice but the shared bathroom was across a small landing, which was not, as I'd imagined between two rooms. We shared with two other rooms so you'll need your dressing gown to access the loo at night!! Only one lift was operational when we arrived(and it was a bit scary) although the other was working the next day. The proximity to so many ameneties was excellent and the prices not bad either. we asked for a kettle and received one promptly. Would stay here again. We needed to phone another couple in another hotel and staff helped us do this.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest location and friendly”
Reviews.Author: 31418Travelinisfun
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this hotel. I could not have been happier with the location or the staff. This old but renovated hotel is within walking distance to Central Park and the Hudson River. Also within a block you have banks, markets, the best European bakery/deli and restaurants. The subway is within 2 blocks. If you are looking for a fancy lobby, restaurants and bars this is not the place for you, but if you are looking for a hotel that is easy to get in and out, with the most helpful staff to get you where you want to go, this is the perfect place and I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “very noisy and no food”
Reviews.Author: anglocanada
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to NY, and we wanted a place to stay out of the hustle and bustle. Upper West Side seemed ideal... but: when we arrived, both elevators were out of use for repairs (why both at once?) so we had to use the service elevator, which was just dreadful, lined in hardboard. Great first impression! The room we were given, first floor, #114, smelt overpoweringly of solvent - apparently rubbing alcohol, used to clean the room. We couldn't open the lower part of the window, as it abutted the roof of the ground floor, and therefore was sealed for security reasons. We couldn't reach the upper part of the window, too high, the roller blind was jammed half shut, and the inner, venetian blind, was also jammed. The roof outside had on it a huge aircon unit, which was incredibly noisy, kept turning on and off all night, and there was litter all over the roof. The aircon unit in the window in our room had one knob missing, and a vent fell off onto the floor as soon as we turned it on to try to clear the smell. All the windows are single-glazed with aircon units in the lower halves, so rooms are dark and noisy. The staff were very helpful and apologetic, however, and the next day we were offered a change of room and a 20% rebate on our sleepless night. A full rebate would have been nicer... The room we got instead overlooked Broadway, on the 9th floor. We were offered a choice of a quieter alternative, but it faced a brick wall and the double bed was against the side wall, so only one side table and only oneside to get out of the bed - not great if you both need to get up in the night. So we opted for the Broadway view. Or, it would have been a view if the window hadn't been incredibly dirty. I tried to clean it with a tissue, just to be able to see out. No food at all in the hotel, but there was a GREAT diner across the street, Manhattan Diner, on corner of 77th and Broadway, open 24 hours a day. We ate there a lot. They do deliver to your room without charge, but there was no table or chairs to eat at, so a little difficult. There was a fridge in the room, but no kettle or coffee maker. A food supermarket was just round the corner, so we bought in stuff for breakfasts, including our own plastic cutlery and bowls. If this had been a cheap hotel, I wouldn't be complaining so much, but we paid about $860 (minus our $70 rebate) for 3 nights, which seemed extortionate for the quality provided. I certainly wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Yolanda50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Belleclaire for one week while on a friends vacation to see the sights and do some shopping. It was a wonderful hotel in upper Manhatten. It was within walking distance to Central Park and many other attractions. Lots of restaurants and shops in the area. My only complaint was the elevator, it was slow and small and one was closed for repairs, but would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loud and a bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: mightyshepherd
Reviews.Content: I guess we just picked the wrong day as the guide book made it sound fantastic. The elevator was lined entirely with cardboard and the journey to the 11th floor took an age. On the way a lot of the floors looked like they were being rebuilt. Some kids were having a party in the next room and I had to get the concierge to intervene - which they did. I dialed for room service and got a cleaner which was odd. As it happens they just get an outside delivery service to come and bring whatever you need. Our room had no view but then again we only booked it a couple of days earlier. The hotel is nice and close to the park in a nice area but really nothing special, especially considering what you'd get for the same money in London. We spent the next night at the Vincci Avalon which was cheaper, bigger, more luxurious and altogether better. Really wish we knew about this place before.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Chasman74
Reviews.Content: I took my 11 year old nephew to NYC in June. We looked at a lot of different hotels and short-term apartment rentals and finally settled in on the Belleclaire. I more or less talked him into it, but once we got here, he loved it! Since it was his first big trip away from home, I requested a room overlooking Broadway so we wouldn't be stuck looking on an alley. They gave us a huge, corner room on the 7th floor looking down onto Broadway. The view was awesome! Great location - right in the heart of the UWS. Subway and Crosstown bus were two blocks away. There's a food market on the ground floor of the hotel that we would stop at and take something back to the room. Very friendly and helpful staff. Highly recommend the Belleclaire!

Reviews.Title: “would go back”
Reviews.Author: mplkcity
Reviews.Content: first impression was disappointing. hallways under remodeling construction, room on 4th floor with no view. Asked to change room - was changed after one night, as hotel was booked - and moved to 7th floor. No reconstruction going on, room very nice, nice street view. Elevator was down some while there, used service elevator. Location was great for Central park, and great food on same block as hotel. Good value, staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Just so so.....”
Reviews.Author: chiefkat
Reviews.Content: The bed was comfy - besides that it was just so so... I love the Upper West Side, but this was disappointing compared to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing end to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: theflatliner
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Staff were very friendly and professional. Rooms were very modern and clean. It is in a great area too with many food places and supermarkets. It is also a stones throw away from Central Park and the Natural Museum of History. If you want a nice hotel away from the madness of Times Square then I would highly recommend this one

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: richins1807
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights. Loved the neighborhood, sweet and quiet. Location was great being only 2 blocks from the subway, and out of the downtown chaos. Hotel staff was great, and room was clean. Inspected matress immediately after arriving, and was so glad to find it spotlessly white! No bed bugs here! Would definately stay here again, clean, quiet, great location, and one of the best prices around!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: seattlewoman59
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very charming and accessible upper west side neighborhood. Loved the area. The staff was extremely professional and welcoming. Our room was quiet, which surprised me- I was expecting a lot of street noise. The shared bathroom was no big deal. We stayed there for 5 nights and we'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Not for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: califcajin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights midweek. Desk area had two outlets only, one for ipod dock/clock, one for lamp. To plug in laptop, had to unplug clock or work in the dark. Small fridge, but no coffee maker in room. Water did not drain in tub, by end of shower standing in 1+ inch of water. Thin foam pillows gave me a head and neck ache, requested different/feather pillows, told there was nothing else available. No paper in the am. Window air conditioner blows directly at desk. This hotel is probably fine for casual leisure travelers, but not what I am accustomed to as a weekly business traveler. Free wireless internet was down to 5kb speed at one point, my vpn would not work, I would not consider this as high speed. Had to use my aircard.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: RobertBullwinkel
Reviews.Content: Wifi not available Elevator broken Unsafe stairs Rude and unresponsive staff No value for a $250/night hotel

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Simple”
Reviews.Author: R0nmar
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, friendly staff , clean & comfortable room. We stayed in a superior queen room. The weather was extremely hot when my husband & I were there so the fridge in the room was an added bonus. It is in a more residential area with lovely restaurants nearby. The subway is only 2 blocks away taking you to whatever area you need to go to and if you dont mind walking 20 mins would get you to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HolidayQueen00
Reviews.Content: Intially upon arriving I was disappointed with this hotel as our room was significantly less appealing than those displayed on the website. However, on balance, given that we had paid 55 dollars a night for a twin room with expedia, there were really no grounds for complaint. The hotel staff were helpful and it was apparent that the hotel is currently undergoing rennovations and improvements. We were provided with plenty of lovely clean white towels each day. The hotel is superbly located, away from the madness of the city centre, but very close to the subway and within its own community of excellent eateries and places to drink very nearby. The Manhattan Diner across the road provides a great start to the day with quick service and a cheap breakfast - I recommend the cinnamon toast! The menu at Big Nicks adjacent to the hotel is also worth checking out - you'll need 20 minutes to read it but the food is cheap and excellent. If you are looking for a reasonably priced place to sleep each night but don't expect high levels of luxury Belleclaire fits the bill. It I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I recently stayed at Chelsea Savoy Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Caroljune
Reviews.Content: The hotel Chelsea Savoy is located right by the subway stop on 23rd and 7th Ave.....come out of the door and walk into the subway! The rooms are large and the beds are fine. Everything about this hotel pleased us. We had three rooms with 3 ladies in each room. The breakfast consists of Coffee, coacoa or hot tea and bagels and rolls. Coffee is ready at 7:30 and rolls at 8. They replenish them if they are running low. We would highly recommend the hotel. Our ac was not working so they quickly moved us to another room. The desk staff is cordial and they are diligent with security. The desk people are monitoring the hallways all the time by computer cameras. The neighborhood is clean and you can find eating places all around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a Try”
Reviews.Author: LVJ1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at Hotelle Belleclaire. This is my first time staying at a NY hotel (I've stayed in hostels in the past because of the expense of NY hotels). This place didn't disappoint! I got the cheapest accomodation (single with a shared bathroom). There was a wait for the roomso I gave up my queen for a double bed (I hate waiting for hours to check in). The way the shared bathroom works is there is a cluster of 3 rooms that share a bathroom. It wasn't bad (i was worried it would be more like a floor sharing a bathroom!). The bathroom and the rooms are all behind a locked door so no one else could access our cluster. The hotel is comfortable. It has the usual amenities plus FREE Wifi (a MUST these days), flat screen tv, fridge. The neighborhood is amazing as well. The hotel reminds me of a European style boutique hotel although it's quite large. I would *definitely* return here. I'd probably upgrade to a room with a private bath just because I'd prefer it that way. But I can definitely see myself coming back here.

Reviews.Title: “Cost-effective and brilliant hotel with some little minuses”
Reviews.Author: Brunoiivana
Reviews.Content: We had a Superior Queen room and it was in our opinion roomy and cosy. The condition of room was very good and we liked room's modern decoration. I'm always a little bid mad of cleaning. That's why I have to say once again the room was pretty clean but anyhow especially the floor could have shined more. We saw one cockroach in our room during the week we spent there but it wasn't a big deal. Bahtroom was also roomy and nice. The only minus comes from AC, it was pretty loud. Some one could also think it is a minus that only 2 of 3 elevators has been working past couple of years even there is a label on wallet that one elevator is out of order just temporarely. Anyway two elevators is enough for this hotel. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpfull. We have just positive memories of them. The location at upper West Side is perfect. The nearest subway is almost at next door. There are lot of good restaurants and breakfast places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Belleclaire and the Upper West Side!”
Reviews.Author: temilson
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Belleclaire and we enjoyed it as much as the last time. We will definitely stay here again. The service is fantastic. You are always greeted warmly by the staff. The rooms are spacious and the hotel has tons of character. I requested a room similiar to last year's with multiple windows facing Broadway Ave. on a higher floor and was not disappointed. We have now stayed in rooms 805 and 703 and enjoyed both very much. As I understand it, all rooms are not the same in this unique, boutique hotel so be sure to be specific if you want a particular view or particular room. I thought the value for the money was fantastic. We booked a special package that included welcome chocolates, bottled water each day of our stay, and breakfast vouchers for the wonderful diner right across the street. There is a fitness facility on site which is very convenient and there is free wifi in the rooms. Last fall we had a bit of trouble getting connected but the wifi service seemed much improved now and we had no connection problems whatsoever. Two subway stops are close to the hotel making it convenient to go wherever you wish in the city. Central Park is only 3 blocks to the east and Riverside Park and the Hudson River are only 2 blocks to the west. Of course, the famous Zabar's and H&H Bagels are also very close to this location. We also highly recommend Five Napkin Burger (best cheeseburger we have ever had) and Patsy's Pizza which are also only a few blocks away from the Belleclaire. The Upper West side is a fantastic neighborhood to explore and you're not run over by the crowds that frequent midtown. We can't wait to return to the Belleclaire and New York City!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: mimi346
Reviews.Content: Checked in around 8pm and was met by wonderful staff at the reception who were very very helpful with directions. Room was clean and well maintained and yes the elevators were slow but I was on the second floor so taking the stairs was not a problem. Friendly porters and they also have a business center where you could use the compterd for about 5$ for 20 minutes. Would be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Handsome historic hotel; helpful staff; upper westside value"”
Reviews.Author: cucinista24
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a one night stay at the Belleclaire, which is ideally situated for the upper west side on 77th and Broadway, close to everything, and reasonably priced. The hotel has a beautiful beaux arts facade and we stayed in a spacious circular room in one of its bowed turrets. The helpful desk clerk upgraded our room as a courtesy, and called a taxi to take us to the airport. Our bags were held before and after check-in at no extra charge. No complimentary breakfast, but plenty of places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Safe & Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: librarylady976
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the twin (2 of them) bed room with shared bathroom at the Hotel Belleclaire with a friend. I had to contact the hotel directly to book this because the rooms weren't listed on their website but still were available. There were three rooms behind a locked door that shared one bathroom. It was quite convenient & everything was clean and comfortable. I enjoyed using their free wireless. We even had a beautiful view across and down the street from our windows. There was a sink in the room as well as a refrigerator & wall unit airconditioner. The area felt very safe & we found a delightful bakery just up the street for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, extremely helpful staff. Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: This was a very good hotel, just off Broadway. Super bedrooms, very clean. Hotel staff were exceptional, notably Mari on the front desk and Sari the bellman. Many different restaurants within walking distance and very close to subway at 79th Street to get to the centre within minutes.

Reviews.Title: “I learned it would be good to make sure there's no construction before booking a hotel in NYC (not the reason u think)”
Reviews.Author: marlene1212
Reviews.Content: First I have to say that I'm a native New Yorker. I have stayed at a number of hotels in the area and have actually stayed here 3 times. I have two things that could have been better but one is non-negotiable when you stay in a hotel: Roaches. I checked in late and was tired. Unpacked all my things and washed up. I saw what appeared to be a dead baby roach on the ceiling (I swear it was playing dead) which I left there but right before bed, I used the bathroom and in addition to the one on the ceiling, I killed a baby roach on the sink. A larger roach was killed in the middle of the night. All in the bathroom. I told the front desk and they were happy of course to change my room but I didn't have time to move my things and didn't want them spraying while I was still in the room. This was my fault but I think it's safe to say if one room has roaches.... I promise you it's not the only one. The morning I left, I killed 2 full grown adults. One of them was hiding under my bag on the floor. I had closed everything up but I still left my suitcase in my garage for several days before having the strength to open it. 2nd (minor compared to the first,) their elevators don't all work. It was the same a year ago. This hotel has decent pricing and while worth walking up stairs (to lower floors) is ok, roaches are not. Ask if a hotel has any construction before booking in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Camere mediocri, servizio inesistente”
Reviews.Author: Luca-SML
Reviews.Content: We picked it because it was well located (close to the metro, museum, central park) , and because the rooms seemed good from the website. The hotel is well positioned, but for that price you can find better hotels in lower manhattan. The room was nice and well size The service of the hotel was non existing: no concierge, no assistance: it was like a residence instead of a Hotel. The air conditioner in the room was so noisy that we could hardly sleep at night. one of the two lifts stayed broken for the entire 5 days, forcing long waiting to go up in the room

Reviews.Title: “The Belleclaire is the Best”
Reviews.Author: Robin029
Reviews.Content: The Belleclaire is a great hotel. It is in a quiet residential neighborhood area on the Upper West side. The hotel is a good value. I stayed in a Delux Queen room with a private bath. A room with a shared bath is less money. My room was contemporary and clean. The lobby is nice and they have complimentry copies of the New York Post available daily. Yes, the elevetor is small and slow, no big deal. The staff is polite. There are nice places to eat and shop right around the corner on Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: nyfox12
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the "hardwood" floors, so much better than carpet. The second room is as the picture shows- no door to separate, but still had private feeling. I would not recommend the breakfast vouchers, instead just eat at Big Nick's around the corner-if you need a place close by. H&H bagel company is supposed to be great too.

Reviews.Title: “Would come again”
Reviews.Author: aapeen
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Belleclaire for a week in june-july. Read some negative reviews and was a bit apprehensive, but overall, the hotel was a positive suprise. The area is nice - it's relatively quiet, not too touristy, 79th street underground station close by (as well as the 72th street, if you want a faster ride), nice 24h delis for breakfast/lunch, laundries - if you have a longer stay etc My room was on the 5th floor, windows direcly to the roof of the next building, so no view really. The room itself (a king) was spatious and clean, the bathroom a litte rundown. I was there during the heatwave, and was happy that the airconditioning could keep the room comfortable. The services are good - free wifi (there is also a internet terminal in the lobby, $5 for 20 mins), small fridge, ironing equipment in the room, an ipod dock, the safe big enough for a mini laptop. The only minus was that one of the lifts was not in use. Sometimes that meant a long wait for it.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit - if that means anything!”
Reviews.Author: KTOZ
Reviews.Content: Hotel Belleclaire is a good choice for families - the rooms are large, well appointed and clean, but without the added facilities that make hotels with more stars, more expensive. There's no restaurant - but the Manhattan diner across the road is fantastic - and does room service! There's no kettle - but there are plenty of places within a 2 minute walk to get coffee - there's a Starbucks 5 minutes away. The subway is 2 blocks north and the area is safe and relatively quiet. The reception staff are lovely, the porters friendly and helpful. There's free high speed internet, banks, cafes, restaurants,chemists and a great same day laundry a block away. We like New York for the things New York has to offer - we like the Belleclaire because it's a comfortable place to stay, without the trimmings that make hotels so expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: sukay
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Belleclaire for its location and the room arrangement. We were in New York City for 4 days over the 4th of July. My husband and I were traveling with our daughter and her oldest child, our grandaughter, 7 years. The Hotel had a great room that worked for us;it had one bathroom, but adjoining bedrooms. One room had one queen bed, the other 2 queen beds. The furnishings were very nice and the beds comfortable and the room very clean. The staff was helpfull and the dorrman friendly. There is only a very small lobby and not a lot "extras", but we loved the fact we were close to the subway station, an easy walk to Central Park as well as the Hudson River and Riverside Park and lots of great places to eat and shop. There was even a great children's park a few blocks away. We knew we would not be spending much time in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jenna013
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Belleclaire for four days over Independence Day weekend. The hotel is in a great location at 77th and Broadway on the Upper West Side, a residential area that is primarily occupied by families and professionals. The Upper West Side is my favorite neighborhood in Manhattan as it's relatively quiet and away from the touristy spots. The area has great restaurants and pubs and the hotel is only a few blocks west of Central Park and close to transportation. The staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. We arrived prior to check in time and they offered to keep our bags at no cost. The room was spacious, well equipped, and very clean. There is free Wi-fi service in the rooms along with a docking station and flat screen HD television. The hotel does charge for internet use in the lobby at $5.00 for twenty-five minutes. They also charge $1.00 for local calls. There is no restaurant in the building however, the Manhattan Diner is across the street on Broadway and they are open twenty-four hours and don't charge for delivery to the room. Essentially a neat kind of room service from a reasonably priced diner without the inflated room service charges common to many hotels. My only complaint would be the single overhead lighting in the bathroom which makes make up application a little challenging. Clearly not a problem for men because when I mentioned this to my partner he seemed to have no idea what I was talking about. Also, the window air conditioning unit was very noisy when it started up, waking us up a couple of times throughout the night. This problem was easily solved with ear plugs. Despite these few issues, this is really a great hotel for the price and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, restful and convenient, and Free Wi-Fi!”
Reviews.Author: Desertraveler
Reviews.Content: Our first time trip to New York, we were a bit apprehensive. The staff was very courteous. We even got an upgrade to a suite (small but very welcomed)! Very quiet, we were able to sleep in on the days we were exhausted. Conveniently located with great restaurants near by and very easy access to the subway. It is a quick walk to Central Park. I would definitely recommend this hidden gem, reasonably priced for NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: guanointoronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great!! It's hard to find such a good hotel for this price in NYC and I definitely had my doubts before our stay. However, on arrival I couldn't be happier with our decision! The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. The location was perfect (77th and Broadway - 2 min walk to the 79th street subway); it was still central but out of the craziness. We had a nice room with two double beds and a private bathroom. Rooms were clean, bathrooms were a little dated but also clean, and beds were comfy. Close walk to Central Park and the Museum of Natural History. During our stay we discovered a burger joint that has recently become a New York favourite called The Burger Shack (77th and Columbus) - which is a short walk from the Hotel Belleclaire and worth the wait in line. Without a doubt, I would recommend this hotel and will consider staying here next time I’m in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comparitively inexpensive stay”
Reviews.Author: VeggieGirl83
Reviews.Content: Ok, not by any means was this place inexpensive, but compared to other New York hotels it was a bargain. My husband and I stayed here over the Christmas holiday and had a great stay. This place was clean and comfortable,. Room: The room we had was a corner room and was very spacious, especially considering that I have heard that other rooms are small. I have only two complaints about the rooms here: 1) the bathroom was tiny 2) the room was blazin' hot. The bathroom was about the size of a closet and could only accomodate one person at a time, but it was enough room to shower and brush my teeth. The room also stayed uncomfortably hot the entire time...and this was at the end of December. Maybe this was my fault since, for the life of me, I could not figure out how to turn the heat down or off. I tried several times at turning the dial, but it never went off. So, to fix this I'd just opened the windows to let a little cold air in. Hotel: The hotel was nice and it was especially nice for the price we booked. My only complaint about the place in general is that they have two, archaic elevators that are incredibly slow. A lot of times we would just take the stairs, but that wasn't so fun in layers of clothes. Staff: The staff was friendly and helped us out with places to visit. Area: I'm glad we chose to stay in this hotel. It was only two streets down from the subway and we never felt unsafe walking at night. It also seemed to be in a less touristy area, so the crowds weren't bad at all. There were several places to eat in the area that had a good New York feel. Sleeping at night could be a problem for some since there is a fire station nearby. I'm a pretty heavy sleeper and I was awaken a few times at night by loud firetrucks...but maybe that's because I never hear that in suburban Alabama.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back...”
Reviews.Author: rogerab
Reviews.Content: I've been to several mid priced hotels in New York, moving about frequently. I'll come back to this one. The Belleclaire is the perfect combination of several elements: excellent value, clean and spacious room, comfortable bed, updated amenities, neighborhood. I won't say one can't find a hotel this good for $200 or so a night, but you'd have to look quite hard to find one. Our room was freshly appointed, with flat screen TV, free internet, polished wood floors, nice comfy queen bed, very quiet. The window was a bit small, the view so so good. Well, so what. Yes, the elevator is small and slow, there's no restaurant/coffee shop or newstand (but free NY Post in the lobby). I didn't miss them. I loved the upper West Side neighborhood. Walking distance to Central Park, Lincoln Center, Riverside Park, Columbus Circle. Subway at 79th(local) and 72nd(express). Non touristy, plenty of restaurants, from neighborhood bars to the very excellent Ouest 3 blocks away. Movie theaters a few blocks in either direction, wonderful residential architecture on the side streets, a feeling of living with the locals. The staff was fine...not overly friendly but quite acceptable, many foreigners among the guests. It would have been even better if breakfast was included, but not to be. Room service is available and provided by the Manhatten Diner across the street. One might want to try it out before relying on it, as it looks like a typical New York coffee shop restaurant. I read in Zagat's that Nick's on B'way just around the corner from the lobby entrance is highly thought off and open 24 hours; also just down the street is Zabar's, specialty groceries and coffee shop. One could complain, I suppose, that it's a bit out of the way from Museums, shopping, art galleries, B'way theaters. Didn't bother me. Nice stroll thru Central Park to the Met and Madison Ave. Cab or subway anywhere else. Yessir. ...I'll be back .

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: BWWblaxx
Reviews.Content: I've read a few reviews of the hotel, and I was a bit weary of the negative comments, but the price was just too good, so I thought we'd take the risk. Here's an honest review, based on what I've read from past comments. First of all, the location, at least to me, was perfect. Two blocks from Central Park and two blocks from the subway. The best part was the neighborhood - quiet and clean. I've stayed at nice Times Square hotels before, but this is a gem regarding peaceful nights and the area is just a nice contrast from the dirty and sometimes sketchy New York streets. Yes, the fact that the entrance is hard to find is true - but once you are in, the lobby is very nice. Small, but it is a boutique hotel, not a major chain. The staff was professional. Perhaps not overly friendly, but nice enough, and we weren't really expecting hugs - they were well informed and service was fast. The elevator indeed is tiny, but I don't understand the complains - it just takes you up and down, you don't sleep in the elevator. The hallways were very clean, I noticed there always were staff members around. We stayed in the queen bed room with a private bathroom. The rooms are more spacious than I thought - they had nice hardwood floors and they were very clean. I personally liked the decoration, the whole set up reminded me of European hotels in terms of size and layout - it really had character and the bed was very comfortable. No complains regarding the washroom, and I never saw a single bug. The A/C is indeed a bit noisy, but not to the point where it was unbearable, and I understand that it must be the only way to keep prices affordable in this older building, so it really didn't bother me at all. If you expect The Waldorf at Comfort Inn prices, maybe this isn't for you. New York hotels can be extremely pricey, and I've found the affordable ones to be "iffy" at best and avoidable at worst, so I thought I really paid the right price at this hotel and would definitely recommend it and would be back.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: Aneetah
Reviews.Content: I've been to quite a few hotels in NYC and this is the only one I'll stay at more than once for sure. It's small and the elevator is SLOW, but it was exactly what I needed after spending some pretty expensive nights in midtown, away from all the people and the hustle, but still in a cute area with restaurants and some stores. If you don't have a problem using the subway, I'd say it's perfect, and money well spent. But if you mostly get around by taxi, you might as well spend those extra dollars and stay further down on manhattan. The A/C was so noisy, we had to turn it off to be able to sleep at all. But other than that, I really liked our room, and the bathroom was nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Manhattan...Will Return!!”
Reviews.Author: Rx1987
Reviews.Content: Second trip to Manhattan. This time with 20 yr old son. Reviewing room 629 at the Hotel Belleclaire that is has 2 twins and a shared bath down the hallway.
