I asked for a very private and quiet part of the hotel since the previous trip to NYC was quite noisy and I didn't sleep well. Let me tell you it was dead silent!! The bathroom was only shared with 2 other rooms and we never had to wait on anyone and it was spotless. Our room was nice sized, had a refrigerator, flat screen tv, ac... extremely quiet!! There is a market right around the corner so you can pick up groceries for your refrigerator. Also right next to the market is a nice neighborhood restaurant called Big Nick's. Sometimes we ate there and sometimes we'd pull up their menu on our laptop and order a meal and my 20 year old son would go pick it up and bring it back to our room. They also have delivery if you don't want to pick it up. There are also several nice neighborhood restaurant there. What I also like about the Belleclaire is that it's in a more traditional Manhattan neighborhood, so you see people that live there or possible students from Columbia University on bikes, etc. vs. the last time we stayed on Times Squares and all that noise! Also, you are 2 very, very short blocks away from the 1 subway train which takes you north or south. (It's the Red colored train on the map) there are exchanges at 50th and there are tons of exchanges at 42nd St (this one is Times Square). Believe me...my son was a little overwhelmed the first day with the subway system but then the second day on he was completely fine getting around. That's why I chose Belleclaire as a test to see if he could handle the transfers of the subway system all on his own if he chooses to go to Columbia University or work on Wall St. and he figured it all out without me saying a word in 1 day...it's that simple. From Belleclaire which is on 77th St. you walk North to 79th st on the West side of the Road. You want to go to Times Square? Then you want to go South. You'll always go below the side of the street in the direction the car would be going if you would be driving. Next transfer your debit card in the machine and transfer to the subway card, again very simple....get on the 1 train...get off at 42nd street (like 4 exits down) walk up the steps and you're in time square. This is like 10 minutes. Going back from Times Square to Hotel Belleclaire be on the East side of the road (going North) just like you would be in a car take the steps down. You can use the Hotel's computer /printer to print out your boarding passes for 5 bucks the day before you leave which was nice, too. And the taxi ride back to LGA was around $35.00 which I thought was a decent price. Oh, and the Hotel is very close to Central Park like a 10 minute walk to the central part of central park but I don't advise entering the park without a map if you don't have a map with you since you may get lost with all the trails. Good Luck and Enjoy...can't wait to return and I'll be staying at Hotel Belleclaire and asking for room 629 again!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Pencilbouquets
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location for exploring the Upper West side and other parts of Manhattan. There are two subway stops that are very close. Great eating places and grocery stores nearby. The room was comfortable and clean. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for us great location close to Restaurants Shops Food Market.”
Reviews.Author: visionYarrawonga
Reviews.Content: I surfed the net to find this Hotel and i was very pleased with our choice. We stayed on the 5th floor with two double beds one for us and the other bed for our 2 children. We had a Tv and fride in our room and a very clean small bathroom and a walk in wardrobe with a room safe. We had a iron and ironing board bed side tables and draws. We were very comfortable. We had to walk to a laundry which was only a couple of blocks away also the subway was the next block north to catch and it only took around 4-5 stops to Time Square on the train. The Belleclaire Hotel was in a great part of town no worries there. Central Park was only a few blocks away. The shops were really nice in the local area as well. We ate for breakfast every morning at the Europe Cafe which was on the same side of the street on Broadway north. Dinner we ate once at the Diner accross from the Belleclaire, Nicks underneath Belleclaire twice and a Greek Restaurant on the same blcok as the Belleclaire. I would definately stay at the Belleclaire again for the clean rooms,location and safe area. The only thing i would do different is book with them direct alot cheaper than what we were quoted through travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: kelebek7
Reviews.Content: Would have given 5 stars if there had been 2 working elevators instead of one. Waited quite a bit. Stayed in a deluxe king with husband and 19 month old. Huge room by NY standards for sure. Small bathroom but was clean and modern. Great decor. Contemporary. Fridge for personal use which is great. Iron, hair dryer, big flat screen... perfect. Nice gym available. Staff are very helpful and courteous. Hotel doesn't look like much from the outside but it is a nice surprise inside. Head up a few blocks to Zabars for breakfast! Fantastic location. (Room service available from diner across the street, great prices, but not great food). Only let down in room was no coffee maker. Will surely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “I´ll return”
Reviews.Author: Argencan
Reviews.Content: Pros: Rooms completely restored. Ipod docks. Kindly Staff. Good location (Broadway and 77th.). Internet wifi free in rooms. Cons: Too small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: HotPinkBikini12
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip to New York a couple weeks ahead of time on Expedia and this place was an incredibly lucky and awesome find! We arrived earlier than check-in and the bellboy gladly took our luggage to the holding area while we went for lunch. (They also held our luggage on check-out day when our flight wasn't until the evening.) We decided to skip the Manhattan Diner that everyone suggests and instead went to the West Branch Restaurant across the street... highly recommended! Delicious brunch! We returned to check in a couple of hours later and discovered we had one of the incredible corner-of-the-building round rooms! It was spotless when we arrived. We especially loved the hard flooring... who knows what disgusting germs hotel carpeting carries!? We had our own bathroom, which was too small for both of us to be in at the same time, but was entirely functional and most importantly, CLEAN! The bed was really comfy, with lots of pillows and PLENTY of room for 2 people to not even notice each other during the night! The free WiFi worked really well... so useful for doing some last-minute planning! The TV was big and had lots of channels (not that we had time to watch it much)! The safe was quite big and easy to use. (Although it was NOT big enough for my 15" laptop... I had brought along my laptop lock and was glad I did. I was able to lock it to the desk in the room.) The staff were really great! So quick to help out and get whatever you needed. Our safe was locked when we first got there and the houseman was there within 5 minutes. Our card keys stopped working; they were fixed no questions asked within a minute. I heard another woman ask about heating on a cool night and she was immediately offered a space heater or an extra blanket. We emailed our boarding passes to the front desk, they printed them and delivered them to our room! Although not near most main attractions, it's still a quick walk to Central Park and really close to the subway... we had no trouble getting around! This place was really great! I recommend it and I will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Upper West Side hotel- oh, and affordable for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Tmomof4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to NYC last week to celebrate our anniversary. I read many reviews on trip advisor for which hotel we could stay in that would be affordable, charming and clean. The Belleclaire Hotel met all of these requirements. We were so happy we chose to stay on the upper-west side since we wanted to be near the park. The hotel is one block from a metro stop and there are many resteraunts and little grocery stores around the area. We were glad to have a mini fridge in our room since we bought a bit of food to have while we were there. The bed was comfortable and the room was kept clean. This hotel doesn't have a lot of frills but it was perfect for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: r-dimont
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Belleclaire with a good friend for a long weekend and were not at all disappointed to share a bathroom with two other rooms, it was cheaper and the bathroom was clean. The room was of an ok size, not too many frills, comfy, but there was very little light. The best thing about the hotel was the location. While for New York everyone wants to stay in a different neighbourhood, for us it was nice as it was close to Central Park, shopping, and the Museum of Natural History. Also it was really close to the subway and a few stops for all the major tourist attractions. While I know that there are nicer hotels, the Belleclaire had friendly staff and overall it was about the same you would have gotten anywhere else in NY for the same price

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice hotel but beware the smokers”
Reviews.Author: maghua
Reviews.Content: For a Manhattan hotel a this pricepoint, the Belleclaire was impressive; the room was a decent size and stylish, the staff friendly, and the hotel itself in very nice condition. The elevator was pokey (and one was out of service), but that seems like a very minor thing for a neighbourhood, boutiquey hotel. Our one complaint is that a lot of the guests were smoking in their rooms (mostly El Al employees, as far as we could tell). The room across the hall was having some sort of party, and although we couldn't hear the noise when the door was shut, the smoke was in our room. A call to the lobby resulted in a timid maintenance man spraying air freshener in the hall and clearly indicating to me that he didn't want to ask the other guests to stop smoking (when I finally convinced him to, the guest slammed the door in his face and the party continued). The hotel might consider a policy that others have implemented, charging smoking guests a fee/fine if they do so in their rooms. Until they begin enforcing NYC's smoking ban, given the number of rooms we passed with smoke emanating from them, we won't risk it again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: zaphod357
Reviews.Content: In the 'pros' category, this hotel has great location. I guess the reason(s) I was disappointed were that (a) the room I got had very little to do with the ones depicted in photos on the web, in particular mine was not getting much light, and (b) almost inexisting sound insulation; my room was right in front of the elevator and I felt like I was in the corridor and in the street at the same time. There might be much better rooms of course. I liked the free Internet access too. The other things were OK, not that I use much service anyway.

Reviews.Title: “HIDIOUS.”
Reviews.Author: mlekme
Reviews.Content: Smells like Cigarette smoke and bug spray. This is a flea bag motel. If you are looking for a quaint and comfortable hotel... LOOK ELSEWHERE. The health department should close this place down.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but pretty lousy hotel. We...”
Reviews.Author: themuffins
Reviews.Content: Great location but pretty lousy hotel. We had a great view of scaffolding and could hear people talking from the street. We opted for the bathroom in the room and it was ok; a little moldy but we've seen wayyyyy worse

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the Money$$$”
Reviews.Author: LaylaPHX
Reviews.Content: For $109/$119 we opted for the shared bath which was fine because I didnt need to shower. My parter showered and said it was fine. I only used the shared toilet as we had a nice sink in our room. Overall, it was new/re-done, comfy and clean and for the $ I would stay there again. Next time we might do our own bath though, its up to you...

Reviews.Title: “Ick”
Reviews.Author: ILoveLouey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is inexpensive, but they should bring down the prices even more. When I go to NYC, I mostly stay at cheaper hotels, but comparing them all, this one was the worst. I don't expect anything fantastic at that price, but come on! We had an economy room which required us to share a bathroom with two others rooms. I'd never done that before and never will again. If you've never done it before, imagine delaying the start of your day - up to an hour or two - because you have to wait for people to shower before you. Imagine having to simply use the toilet quick but not being able to because someone is showering. That was bad enough, but the bathroom was down right gross. It reminded me of a camp ground bathroom. It was old, dingy & really dark (how difficult is it to replace the one dull light fixture??). There was no fan to help with the humidity after a shower, which I'm guessing is why there was black mold everywhere on the tile's grout. The drain didn't drain fast enough, so you ended up wading in a bath of water (gross when there could be hair in it from the previous person)! We couldn't seem to shut off the radiator/heater in our room, so even when leaving the window wide open (no screen) didn't help enough, we had to leave our window unit a/c on. It was less than 50 degrees out at the time. The window unit a/c caused problems itself, because the exposure to the outdoors (gaps around it that weren't sealed) made it sound like you were sleeping in a tent! The unit looked like something heavy had dropped on it from the outside, because it had a huge dent in it. We were just so suprised at the low standards & what they considered acceptable - something you'd expect from a college dorm room & not a hotel! The photos are misleading. You would assume the hotel occupies the entire building, and you walk into the front of it into a proper sized lobby. Nope - you enter on the side of the building (an entrance that you could easily miss), and the lobby is small & narrow. The two side by side elevators should be made into one normal size one. I'm not kidding when I say you cannot fit more than three people in it, and even that is cramped. I've never seen such a small elevator! The hallways where the rooms are are so narrow that in some parts we couldn't wheel a piece of luggage down it. We had to turn it on its side and pick it up. The place feels like a doll house. On a positive note... The staff was kind, and service (like housekeeping calls) was fast. The bed & linens were great, and the sink in the room was helpful. The location was the best part. The Upper West Side is a nice place to stay. It's a good middle ground between the madness of Midtown & the dullness of areas like the West Village (especially after dark when you're looking for open businesses to wander into).

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location and fantastic hotel, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: khaz73
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at the Hotel Belleclaire with our 3 children in a 2 bedroom suite. While it is not a 5 star hotel, it is clean, neat and charming. The children had a t.v in there room and we had one in ours. The 2 bedroom suite gives you enough breathing space without being on top of each other especially if staying for a week. The location of this hotel is fantastic. Our luggage was lost by the airline so we appreciated the drycleaner around the corner that had our washing cleaned and back to us in half a day. The Manhatten Diner across the road is the best breakfast you can get and Big Nicks Pizza Joint downstairs does a great pizza. There is a 24 hour market downstairs which has great fresh fruits, meats and breads and beers really cheap. a newsagent next door and a pharmacy one block away. The subway is only 2 blocks away and with 3 kids we used this constantly for the week, didn't catch one cab. You are also only minutes from central park and the museum. Loved this hotel and highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “all i needed”
Reviews.Author: nd2trvmore
Reviews.Content: a comfortable bed with crisp sheets and plenty of hot water in the shower. room was certainly small but for a single traveler or a couple not planning on much time there anyway it's just fine. front desk was superb - especially michele. skip the manhattan diner across the street and opt for the lox bagel breakfast special up the street at zabars - be sure to visit there deli counters too. if you like indian food, ask michele for directions to tamarind - you won't be disappointed. easy access to subways and museums, the belleclaire is a winner in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, superb location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: Loco2Go
Reviews.Content: The Belleclaire is very much for those who prefer good value in an outstanding location over the frills or glamor that cost a lot in this town. Situated in one of the best parts of the Upper West Side, the hotel is ideal for runners, bikers or nature lovers, since both Central and Riverside Parks are a short walking distance away (note: fantastic bike rental shop on 77th between Broadway and Amsterdam). My very sunny room was on the 7th floor and I had a nice view of the Hudson River and the steeple of the beautiful West End Collegiate Church. The deluxe room was stylish and very comfortable, certainly roomy enough for two, with a small fridge, a nice desk and free wifi. I worked for two days from a desk here and was very comfortable doing so. My bathroom even had a window. I found the staff very friendly, and the front desk was always sufficiently manned. But it is not for those looking for glamor, especially in the reception area. The lobby is clean and functional but it also small, and not a place for gathering. But i didn't come to NY to spend time in the lobby, so i could have cared less about this. The "room service" is from a diner on the block, and i'd say best to get up and eat elsewhere. But I definitely will be coming back to this hotel for its location, beautiful room and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your money”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelingflorida
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel based on the price and pictures Expedia posted. When I arrived at the Hotel after a 15 hour flight and waiting a couple of hours for check in time, the lobby was not very impressive, the concierge -who happens to run the desolated gift shop- had no internet access to help us with tickets. The room I got was the economy room, which to my surprise had a shared bathroom with two other rooms and looked nothing like the picture featured in the expedia page. I almost had a nervous breakdown!!! After many phone calls and pleading the front desk I was able to get a decent room for $50 dollars +tax more. It was easter weekend and I was trapped. Expedia offered to give me a $100 voucher for future travels but I declined since I will never be using them again after this fiasco. The first night I had to sleep in the "economy room" our of exhaustion. The shared bathroom had a tub with a faucet that was about to come out of the wall. The room had blinds that did not work and did not have a shade to make the room dark. At 5am the screeching noises started and I think it was the pipes as people were turning the water on. I thought I had slept in the street from the traffic noise. The second room was much better, it did look like the picture posted. The front desk attendants were nice and helpful. The location was not bad at all but I would never go back. Funny, I wrote the same review and expedia has not posted it!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: travelingNYfamily
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy. Good value. We stayed here to be in town early for the Thanksgiving day parade.

Reviews.Title: “Be Aware”
Reviews.Author: ljcu
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is not bad; however, the elevators in the lobby are quite small. I had the unfortunate instance of booking a room with a "shared bath". I thought I would be sharing a bathroom with my daughter, instead, you're sharing a bathroom with two additional rooms :-( Now that I can tolerate, but the hotel staff is very rude. I inquired about a few things and was met with a poor attitutude from the staff--excluding the bellmen who were very friendly and most helpful. It's a shame that the staff is not friendly and very curt.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Wolves33
Reviews.Content: I went here for a quiet romantic weekend getaway and must say I was NOT disappointed at all. It was quiet, clean room with a spacious and comfortable bed and an equally pristine bathroom. I am definitely recommending this place to others and will be back myself!!!

Reviews.Title: “I Want to Keep it a Secret!”
Reviews.Author: Table-for-4-NOVA
Reviews.Content: A boutique hotel on the Upper West Side - two blocks from the Museum of Natural History and Central Park - Hotel Belleclaire is an absolute STEAL! We got the double rooms for my husband, me, and our two kids (aged 8 and 6), and the rooms are *bigger* than they appear in the pictures. What to look forward to: location location location; BEST hotel shower you'll ever get; a flat-screen TV in each room. What needs work (why I can't give it a "5"): radiators were hot even when turned completely off (burned my son); creaky floorboards; hotel claims to have wireless internet service but it was spotty at best. I turned off my computer and actually had some leisure time! We were delighted with Hotel Belleclaire and plan to return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: ladysusan26
Reviews.Content: The enterance to the hotel is off the main road. There is a big HB on a sign to let you know where it is. The location was great for us, as we like to walk thru central park. There are great resturants in the area. The lobby is small, but clean and modern. The elevators only hold up to 5 people, but there are two of them. The rooms are larger than expected. We had a delux King room with a view of the building next door. We were in room 320. It was really hot at night, as the hot water pipes run thru the wall next to the bathroom. The easy solution to that was to open the window. The black out curtains were wonderful. The room was clean and had a nice size TV. I plan on staying here again when I have a day layover to Ireland at the end of March. Would reccommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hold my room i'm coming back - great price, location, hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: Hoppster
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York and price defintely was a deciding factor in choosing to stay here. We were nervous because of some negative reviews, but when we arrived we were impressed. We had a lovely room facing Broadway on the 7th floor, it was extremely comfortable and clean with 2 double beds , coffee table & 2 chairs with bay window & separate bathroom. Room was bigger than we expected, very comfortable with simple & stylish decor & great amenities. All the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful, and made you feel welcome. Yes the lift is slow and the sound from the fire station can be loud (regardless we slept soundly every night), but this is New York and these are some of the the things we now remember fondly and laugh about We had planned to stay for 7 nights, decided on the last night would like to stay for another 3 nights, initally we were going to have to move rooms but the reception staff despite the hotel being full, managed to work some magic & enable us to stay in our room. It is in a great location, with a 2min walk to the subway (and 5 stops to Times Square), 10 min walk to Natural History Museum & Central Park. It has many restaurants & cafes nearby, highly recommend the greek rest. Niko's on the corner of 76th & Broadway, fantastic gyro's & Europan Deli/Cafe on Brodway/78th for great hot choclates, cakes & sandwiches. We all loved our stay here, and think it is defintely value for money and cannot wait to return. This is a hidden gem!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Uptmost Quality, Service, Location, Decor, for the price. I dare anyone to find a better hotel for the same price!”
Reviews.Author: Epic87
Reviews.Content: I had a 4 night 5 day stay at The Hotel Belleclaire and it was everything that my strict and high expectations could ask for. The Hotel was extremely clean. The staff is extremely polite and always wants to help you. The room is very quaint in size but superbly designed. I stayed in the deluxe queen room, and everything from the bed to the bathroom was brand new, dark wood tones, and very inviting. Service was beyond comprehension. I had a question about the safe in the room so i asked on the way to my room if someone can tell me how to use it. The staff member said "I'll send one up to assist you sir". My room is on the 2nd floor. The staff member that was sent up beat me there. It was incredible(now i believe in precognition). Overall it is the best hotel for the money, no complaints at all except they do have the worst irons known to man( put water for steam, ends up all over the place). That is the only thing i can come up with. The location is excellent... right in the city and little to no city noise. There are very convenient stores located all around. Blocks from central park, and right across the street is The Manhattan Diner... It is rated by Trip Advisor as the best diner in the city and let me tell you it could possibly be the best diner on the planet... Everything from the service to the plethora of food choices( my favorites are curly fries, rice pudding, shakes, cheese cake, waffles.... who am I kidding everything is delicious) is so timely, inexpensive, and just a joy to be there. Trust me... You'll fall in love with it... you will want to write a review just like this. It is that good.

Reviews.Title: “Probably very nice for those who are NOT in any way disabled...”
Reviews.Author: Desespoir
Reviews.Content: I decided to book this hotel based on reviews I read here along with the price and availability. Before booking I called to make sure that it was going to be good for a handicapped person. I was travelling with my mother who had a knee replacement in October and is still healing. I made it very clear on the phone that we could not share a bed and there would need to be a bit of room to maneuver in the room. I was assured that even if I booked via Hotwire it would be fine, as the person on the phone took down my name (unfortunately I did not catch theirs). We get to our room, very excited as it would be my mum's first time staying over in NYC and we're in this gorgeous hotel that I've shown her the website/photos for. We open our door to find one twin/full bed, a desk, and a TV. There wasn't even enough room for 2 people to SIT on that bed, let alone sleep. The bathroom was small but very nice, and there was a large closet...space that could have been better utilized in my opinion. On top of this, the room stunk of what I thought was men's cologne - however it's one of the products the cleaning staff uses. I could tell instantly that my mother was extremely disappointed, as I had ASSURED her that everything would be fine and now it wasn't. We ended up completing all of our plans in NYC except for staying over and eating a traditional breakfast the next morning (which we were both quite excited for, I used to live in the city and sometimes miss it quite a bit). On the survey you get upon checkin, I explained to them exactly why we left early and why I was disappointed. I left my phone number and email address and honestly expected to at least hear from customer service. Not a peep. I'm actually going to be forwarding them this review as well, because that is *NOT* how you handle a situation. If your hotel isn't going to be suitable for someone, tell them when they call in and ask. Don't lie to them to make the sale and then screw them over when they get there. It's a shame because the hotel itself is lovely, despite ongoing renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: cyberi
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at this hotel for one night so keep that in mind as you read this. Check in was fine, quick and as one would expect. The front desk and lobby are very small. But the staff was good. There is a small (euro) like elevator that gives most travelers the first clue as to the hotel and its style. This is an old world New York City building that you might easily find in an old 30's movie. But the feel of the hotel is modern, comfortable and accomodatingly simple. They even have rooms with shared bathrooms which should give you yet another clue. My room was fine, wood floor, very clean bathroom, large and comfortable queen bed, radiator for heat in a room that was very warm for February. Two shades overlooking 77th street that I did not open. LCD TV. The only drawback was a very leaky air conditioner in one window that provided a draft - but only if you were in inches of the window that was across the room. The location is interesting as it is not the usual tourist neighborhood. I was heading uptown in New York so the location was perfect. There are a few supermarkets in the area that are worth exploring. Overall this is a hotel I would stay at again if heading to New York and had meetings above 50th street. The price was great so value was high.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: traveling_girl59
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Allowed to check-in early and was upgraded to a suite for no extra charge. The room appeared as it did on the website. Clean, roomy (even the bathroom), and quite for the most part. There was some noise from the radiator (not sure if I was working it right) but nothing that earplugs couldn't block-out. Nice location; lots of shopping and eating options. Subway two blocks away (79th & Brdwy). Overall great value for this part of town. I have stayed at other hotels in the area for $100 or more a night. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, all good”
Reviews.Author: madpan
Reviews.Content: The room was small but clean, quiet and dark, which is nice for an old hotel in NYC. Goo cotton linens on the bed, small but adequate bathroom with good water pressure and the drains work warm staff that remembers your name. Great value for money in a great neighborhood where you are safe to walk at anytime. Westside market opendownstairs 24 hours and it is great for all food items.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: pinklarger36
Reviews.Content: Well on arrival at the airport JFK found that the taxi fare (yell cab) was $44 to hotel but driver expected a tip - so you need at least $50. The outside of the hotel did not look as glam as the website will have you to believe. It is located on a back road along the broadway. The Bathroom I went for the shared bathroom...I was on the 8th floor. The bathroom was clean but it had a awful damp smell as though a rat had died. This smell did not go away - even when reported. It was awkward to leave the window open in the room as you faced another building and they could see right in! The Bedroom As stated by others was very comfy and had a nice flat screen - no complaints, bed were changed daily. The location Excellently placed to metro station and bus - so ideal for those on a short trip. Overall - not as nice our budget "Travel Lodge" hotels in the UK. I am not sure if I would stay there again. I think it is GOOD VALUE for those on a budget and is in a superb location for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: TexasMD2
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, great location, friendly and helpful front desk staff (especially compared to so-called 4 star hotel across the street with very rude and unhelpful staff). Very close to metro station. Only complaint would be the heating system could be quite noisy at night. Bed and bedding were very comfortable. Elevator is tiny and slow (use the service elevator down the hall, it's much faster and larger). Also for inexpensive eats, check out Big Nick's around the corner for great pizza. Their draft beer was terrible though, need to change out the lines.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel just blocks away from the Subway, very affordable & clean!!!”
Reviews.Author: niceone003
Reviews.Content: My sisters & fiancee stayed at the hotel for six days, just arrived home today. We loved it! It was VERY clean and cozy. Even though New York this past week was really cold and even snowing, our room was really warm & just felt right. I personally am very picky when it comes to rooms and hotels and this one made me really happy. The staff is nice & friendly & very polite. Check in and check out was really quick and easy. Even though we weren't right outside of Times Square or anything as tourists we felt happy with the location. You can either walk about 4 blocks to the subway on 72 st. or two block to 79 st. Depends what way you wanna go, there is also this small cafe called Europan or something like that and it had great pastries :) I really recommend this place. It's affordable & very clean. The only downside to this hotel is the elevator, only one was working at the time and it was very small. We stayed in the 8th floor and it was ok to go downstairs but those few trips I made upstairs took my breathe away like literally...but it was ok. I recommend this place for sure, enjoy the comfy beds :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for comfort seekers on a budget basis”
Reviews.Author: esbanjador
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through hotels.com only 1 hour before arrival. The reception already had all set for the check-in, which took nearly 1 minute. I stayed there with a friend for 5 days/4nights on a shared bath two beds room. The room itself was large enough for the two of us and the big cases. The amenities in the room included large plasma TV, fridge, iron, hair dryer, wireless internet, AC fan and central heating. The room also had a lavatory for basic cleans. Champoo, soap and body gel moisturizer provided free daily. It was a very good option to book the shared bath room, since it serves only 3 rooms. All furniture and bath utilities were in very good condition and housekeeping was good. Excellent location on 77th St. close to subway 72nd St. and 79th St. There were only 2 slightly annoying points: 1- the 10 floor hotel had only 2 elevators and one of them was out of order during our 5 day stay, making the ups and downs too slow. 2- we had a room with Broadway view, so we could ear the traffic passing by, because the windows are not so well isolated from the outside sounds. Apart this I definitly would stay again at Belleclaire and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Belleclaire - Great”
Reviews.Author: FreddyTX
Reviews.Content: Great 3 star hotel. Great location on the Upper West Side, within walking distance to many things, including the 72nd Street station for the subway. Great food markets nearby on Broadway and other cool little shops and such. The hotel is clean and well-maintained, and I have to say, well designed (great interior design). Up to date furnishings in the room, flat panel television, and updated super clean bathroom, albeit small. But that's OK. I would rather have a super clean small bathroom than something dingy and beige. This hotel is great for travelers, and those looking for a somewhat stylish, inexpensive (for New York) hotel. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Elevators are a little on the small side, and still, only one elevator was working. But the stairs are large, clean and marble! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoelH3
Reviews.Content: Pretty good hotel for a really great price. Near a 24 hour diner.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again”
Reviews.Author: crewdad
Reviews.Content: For a long-weekend getaway in NYC, this hotel was ideal. The shared bath was a non-issue-never encountered anyone from the other two rooms that shared our bath (note-facility is not"down the hall." -there were 3 rooms sharing a bath and small vestibule/hall--bath is 2-3 steps (at most) from each room. Neighborhood is much easier to negotiate than midtown/ Times Square areas --quieter, less crowded--two short blocks to the subway, plenty of food options, including three good markets w/in 4 blocks on Broadway. Elevator is small and slow--big deal-we took the stairs. The (non-working) fireplace gave our room a certain charm. Room tended to be a little too warm at night but overall a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, and a great bargain!”
Reviews.Author: clanwilson
Reviews.Content: For my first solo trip to New York, I needed a clean, well-located hotel that wouldn't break the bank, and the Belleclaire certainly met all my needs. On my previous trips, I've stayed in midtown west, so the upper west side was new territory for me. The Belleclaire is perfectly situated for easy walks to restaurants, stores, various museums, and Central Park. You can also catch the #1 subway very easily and get to Times Square in about ten minutes. For my three night stay, I booked a queen/shared bath room. The bathroom was regularly cleaned throughout the day and was shared with two other rooms. There was a sink in my hotel room with a high faucet. (You can easily wash your hair without needing the services of a chiropractor the next day.) The room also had a fridge, very handy, and the closet had plenty of hangers and a chest of drawers inside it. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable, so i slept like a dream. From the two doormen to the desk clerks, I encountered only friendly, efficient, and helpful staff. In fact, when I couldn't figure out how to set the fancy alarm clock, someone immediately came up to help. Just to be on the safe side, I relied on daily wake up calls. :-) I certainly can recommend the Belleclaire very highly, and I plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ernie81684
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all my expectations and more. The hotel has a unique charm in terms of the decor and layout of the building. The staff was very friendly and accomodating, the hotel and my room were clean and well-kempt, and the location can not beat (subway station 2 blocks away). There are an abundance of places to eat in the immediate vicinity with easy access to cabs and the subway. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay :)”
Reviews.Author: rocknic1985
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Clean, nice room with big flat screen tv. Shared bathroom facilities a good and cheap option. Good location and close to lots of good restaurants/coffee shops. Close to subway too. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice comfortable hotel, poor desk staff”
Reviews.Author: MK_Cal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Belleclaire for 4 nights. We met friends from the UK who were traveling with 2 young children who also stayed at the Belleclaire . They had a two bed double and we had a king size deluxe room. We, and our friends both found the hotel rooms comfortable with full baths and a closet. Location was very good. The upper west side is a kid-friendly, easy access, quieter neighborhood, and riverside park is just two blocks away. The room had a small refrig, AC, heat, comfortable bed, clean bath, and we slept well . We really liked the hotel but the desk staff detracted from our stay. The cleaning service was very good and the rooms kept clean (i could walk barefoot on the floors without dirt). The doormen helped with questions, opening the door for guests and very friendly to everyone. It bothers me to make the following distinction but the friendly factor varied widely between the men and the women who staffed the hotel. As a working woman who tries to keep male female distinctions out of the work place, this was such an exceptional difference I feel I have to mention it. Our friends and us found the male staff at the door and at the desk very friendly and helpful. The women behind the counter were much less knowledgable or did not want to offer service, and at times gave the classic NY negative attitude. Two examples, a basic question about restaurants for breakfast and a repetivie problem with our room keys. On morning #4 we wanted to eat at a different location but was once again referred to Manhattan cafe for breakfast or to the European Bakery which we had been to on more than one occassion. I said that we had tried those already and inquired nicely if was there a third option, she looked at me and walked away to help another customer! With a classic NY attitude, because I pressed a second time, I recieved one other reference but it took a 5 min conversation to get the information, and required me to not be willing to go away easily. My husband was very frustrated when every day we had to get new room keys made. He was suprised when he was consistently chastised/ blamed by the women behind the desk because he was not taking proper care of the keys! The first day he was told that the metro card was demagentizing the room key. Sorry not possible! Day 2 he was told it was due to cell phones but we left our cell phones at home 3000 miles away so to be undistirbed by work phone calls! After a third example on Day 3 he complained later to another desk clerk (male) was told the real story. The desk clerk explained that those making the keys for us were not following the process correctly so they would only work until the next morning. Had the women only fixed the key and not blamed the traveler with such gusto we likely would not have found the experience so unpleasant. I recommend this hotel but hope the management puts their female desk staff thru some basic courtesy training.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a week-long trip”
Reviews.Author: chris0180
Reviews.Content: I booked a budget room with shared bath for 9 nights in late November into early December. After catching an earlier flight than expected, I arrived at the hotel at 10am and was pleased to find that my room was ready and I was given the key straight away. As you would expect for a budget room, facilities were basic but more than adequate. Flat-screen TV, desk, radio alarm clock with iPod dock, refrigerator, closet, and a night stand on either side of the (very comfortable) double bed. When I checked in, I was told that nobody else would be using the shared bathroom so I had it all to myself - it seems the other rooms along my part of the corridor had all been refurbished with their own facilities. I can confirm a couple of things from other reviews - yes there are some very noisy pipes in the hotel, and even though I enquired about changing rooms I was told that it wouldn't really make a lot of difference due to the age of the building. Also, one of their elevators is still out of order and the the one that works really is very slow! Noise was a bit of an issue for me in other areas - street noise all through the night (not helped by the laundry van which spent about half an hour outside every single night at around midnight), and the noise situation inside the hotel could have been better. The doors to the rooms are very heavy and will slam easily (and loudly!), and hanging the "please do not disturb" sign on the door seemed to be read as "dear housekeeping, please vacuum this corridor as soon as possible" which caused a bit of annoyance. It's true that these issues can be overcome eaily enough with the help of a decent set of earplugs, but it would be preferable for these issues to not exist in the first place. At least the ones inside the hotel - I understand there's not much anybody can do about street noise! Despite this, the hotel's location is excellent - just a minute's walk to 79th St subway station, and plenty of convenience stores and restaurants nearby. Central Park and the Museum of Natural History are just a couple of blocks east, which makes for an easy day's sightseeing. Would I stay there again? If I was on a similar budget, yes I would consider it, but I might also be tempted to save up a little extra money and try somewhere else. It was a great base to plan all of my activites from though, and I can't complain about the service I received from the desk staff on the few occasions I needed to ask for their assistance - if it wasn't for the pipes and seemingly inconsiderate housekeeping, it might have got that extra mark from me!

Reviews.Title: “Good for cheap”
Reviews.Author: dollyv
Reviews.Content: I'm not a finnicky high maintenance type, and am in my forties, so I understand the concept of getting what you pay for, and that's exactly the deal at the Belleclaire. I found the staff to be friendly (because I made the effort to converse with them--try it), the cleaning service to be dependable, and the room to be as expected in a New York hotel for 116 dollars a night (!!!): basic. Don't expect the Waldorf Astoria, see, cause you aren't paying for that! Sharing a bathroom? I traveled in Europe in my youth and stayed at hostels, so l was sort of accustomed to it. Just bring flip flops. I even left my laptop charger (hidden in a very strategic place that I forgot to check before I left) and they sent it back to me! Yes, the rooms look little like the pictures, but in case you just fell off the turnip truck, photographs of hotels are intended to make you go "ooh." And the room NEVER looks like the picture you saw online. This is a great metaphor for life. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A well located nice hotel I'd stay in again”
Reviews.Author: mouser882
Reviews.Content: I'm aware this review is 2 years late. I stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend about two years ago. We wanted to take a NYC trip in the off season, and got some awesome rates on everything. Including this hotel, which was running a discount where staying 3+ nights would get you the 3rd free. We stayed in a double room with shared bath. It came out to about 50$ a night so it would have taken a lot to make us unhappy with the hotel. My dad who grew up in Queens recognized the name of this place and remembered it as being nice. Location: really good. Nice neighborhood. Just down the street from a subway station, across the street from an awesome diner, and there were little groceries (and a duane reade) along the street between the subway and the hotel. I mention the groceries/convenience store because we were lucky enough to get really bad colds during our stay and we were able to get the loads of cold medicine we needed without going out of our way. Room: we had a double with shared bath. We had no trouble using the bathroom/shower. I think I heard other people so I'm pretty sure one of the other sharing rooms was occupied, but we didn't see 'em. The room was adequately sized, but it's just a place to sleep and relax after running around all day. It was larger than the bed, which is more than I can say for more expensive rooms in other large cities. Radiator heat which made the room plenty warm when we turned it up. Enough that we needed to open the window and cool it down during the night. Staff: didn't see much of them, but they seemed friendly and they did their jobs. I recall the maid coming to our room multiple times while we slept in/got ready in the morning - she really wanted to tidy our room I guess. That was a pain, as we sort of wanted privacy to get dressed and all and she kept opening the door. Otherwise, we had no trouble. The front desk people helped us with directions and advice. They held our bags for free when we arrived before check-in. The lobby is really nice, too. Looking now I see the rates have gone up a lot and the deals for this January aren't nearly as good, so we might not be staying there in this years planned trip during the same time, but I don't know if I want to take the chance of getting a crappy hotel for not much less.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: sjh9Edmonton
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I both loved this hotel. We booked online through Expedia for a weekedn trip to New York and after reading reviews and looking at pictures we were not disappointed. It is 77st and Broadway so its a perfect loacation and easy to get anywhere. check in was quick although we arrived at 11 am and our room was not ready yet, however they did have a locked room that the luggage could be kept in so we could sight see. Rooms are quite small, however it is Manhattan and space is limited. It was more than enough room to relax in at the end of the night for the two of us though. The bed was by far the most comfortable hotel bed i have ever slept in. the sheets were amazing and if i could have I think i may have tried to smuggle them out lol. There is no restaurant in the hotel however they do have room service thats provided by a restaurant across the street..the food is alright and good for when your tired and your feet are too sore from walking to go anywhere. My only complaint is the tiny elevators that are somewhat slow. honestly, next time we go to New York we will be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Good stay - but avoid Rm 912”
Reviews.Author: Bermiegirl01
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Bellclaire with our 3 year son as we were looking for a hotel on the upper west side close to Central Park and the Natural History Museum. Overall, it’s a very nice hotel, with clean, good size rooms with great hardwood floors. The beds are also very comfortable. Staff were friendly as well and the neighbourhood was appropriate for travelling with our 3 year old – more residential and less hectic than the mid-town area. We recommend the Bellclaire, but please stay away from room 912. On check-in we were given this room, which at first seemed fine until the night when there was this horrible hissing and clanking noise coming from this peculiar vent (pipe) in the bathroom. There was noise also from the street however that did not bother me since this is New York City after all. My husband went down to the front desk to enquire about a room change and was told that because the Bellclaire is an older hotel, all of the rooms had this problem and they could not guarantee that if we changed rooms the noise would be any better. I decided it was worth the risk to stay in another room and we moved to room 511 the next day where I immediate check the bathroom to see if it had another one of those peculiar pipes. No pipe – no noise, and I had two very comfortable nights of sleep. So, stay at the Bellclaire if you are looking for a reasonable place in the upper west side, but avoid room 912 at all cost! Other tips – the hotel is also close to the subway (the 1 Train (local) on 79 street and the 1,2,&3 trains (express) on 72 street. There were also good choices for eating. We enjoyed Big Nicks Burger Joint just around the corner and had a lovely Italian meal at a bistro two blocks up on 79th between Broadway and Amsterdam – sorry can’t remember the name, but the fresh pasta special was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: SushieG
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean, not huge, but not too tiny. This was my first "shared bathroom" experience, but we found most NYC hotels with own bathrooms were either to pricey or looked terrible for their high prices! The bathroom never seemed to be occupied anyway and was consistently clean. We had air con, fridge, hair dryer, iron, etc provided. All staff were polite and most were extremely helpful and friendly. Great location on Upper West side - close to a couple of subway stations and Central Park a lovely short walk away. Markets, food, coffee all a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC location, excellent for young people/those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: LAPBrisbane
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were only going to be there for four nights. This was the cheapest hotel that still offered a location close to all the action. We could walk just a few blocks to Central Park, the subway station was one small block away and only a few stops to Times Square and there was everything we needed in the way of conveniences right on our corner! Highly recommend the Manhattan Diner for a cheap, big breakfast and Nick's Pizza is a MUST! The economy room was very small but housekeeping was excellent. Considering you're in New York and hardly any time should be spent in your room the size really isn't an issue at all. The shared bathroom was not a big deal, it was kept very clean and we never clashed with the people we shared with. All in all an excellent choice in a city that is known for ridiculously expensive hotels! great locationa and great service!

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler0reg0n
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very stylish and comfortable. We have stayed here twice, one time the bathtub was clogged, and the other our room was net yet ready when we arrived at 9 PM. Both issues were resolved to our satisfaction, and along with the broken and slow elevator kind of added to the charm of the place. We had deluxe rooms, and they look much as pictured on the website, beds were comfortabel and bathrooms were large and well stocked. They have a very helpful and friendly bellboy (don't know if that is the correct title) named Sare, who made our long wait for a taxi very pleasant. Hotel is in a great location, near Central Park, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Natural History Museum, Guggenheim. We also enjoyed being in a residential area, we saw people going to work and taking their kids to school. Can't imagine staying anywhere else in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre but clean; beware of noises in the room!”
Reviews.Author: xdruliex
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and on the small side. It was clean and mediocre; if you're here just needing a place to sleep, this will be fine. The subway is 2 blocks away and that made it convenient for getting around. The one part that was not okay was the noise I experienced the first night there. I was put in a room that faced Broadway on the 2nd floor. At night you could hear all the street noise, sirens, and dump trucks. It made it impossible to sleep. On top of that, the hotel has a boiler system that runs heat through the pipes. This causes loud clinking sounds that can drive you mad. It sounds like someone is intentionally banging pipes to keep you up. After the first night, I went downstairs to request a room change and it seemed that the desk person already knew what I was going to complain about. I was moved to the 8th floor in the back of the hotel and found more peace that way.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: temilson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and LOVED it! The upper west side is a charming neighborhood with tons of restaurants and shops. The subway way only two block away, Riverside Park and the Hudson River was only a couple blocks, and Central Parks was about 4 blocks. The front desk and housekeeping staff were all very friendly and helpful. I can't say enough about the staff. The hotel itself is in a very charming historic building and the rooms are more like urban apt's than hotel rooms. Wi-Fi reception was spotty but the Cosi restaurant across the street has free Wi-Fi. I thought the price we paid with the Autumn Special rates was an excellent value for this location. The Manhattan Diner across the street had an excellent and reasonably priced breakfast and was open 24 hours. Patsy's Pizzeria on 74th streret was also an excellent place to eat nearby. Zabar's and H&H Bagels are also close by. Filene's Basement is very close. Yes, there is only one elevator right now and it is a bit slow but it's workable and there is a service elevator down the hall that you can also use as well as a beautiful open marble staircase so you can walk to your room. I live in the middle of cornfields in IN so I come to the city for the noice and bustle. However, if you don't like the street noise, you may want to ask for a room facing one of the quieter streets and not right on Broadway. We were on the 7th floor facing Broadway avenue with two huge sets of windows with excellent views. You did hear lots of strett noise but I loved it and we did not even notice it when we were sleeping after the first night. ! I would definitely recommend this place to others!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we expected”
Reviews.Author: LosLimones
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at The Belleclaire hotel; no dissapointments or great surprises from what we were expecting: a reasonable priced 3 star hotel in New York city. The location is convenient and the staff were very friendly. The room we were given the first night was on the third floor (319) and the only view we had was a brick wall, but upon request we were immediately transferred to the 7th floor (719): this one had a reasonable view and was far more quiet. The rooms are a very decent size for New York and were clean and in good condition. We had free wireless internet as advertised but it was a bit slow, so just went to a coffee place just opposite (Cosi) which had free wifi available. Yes, the elevators were slow and one of them was out of other, as we had read in previous comments but that was not such a big problem at all. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a private trip to the big city.

Reviews.Title: “IN LOVE WITH THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: AvenueJ
Reviews.Content: Everytime we have friends come to the city, we put them up in the BelleClaire. Sometimes we even stay there too! The staff are like family, the location on the Upper West Side means that this Brooklyn native gets to see a new part of the city. The 24 hour diner over the street is amazing and Anderson Cooper eats there! The rooms are clean and classy, modern and sleek. Love this place!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: He-Bro
Reviews.Content: What I'd have to say is pretty much in the title. Just a few points. First, the hotel is in a great Upper West Side neighborhood. Great affordable places to eat (the Manhattan Diner across the street was my favorite), Central Park a few blocks east, the Hudson River walk a few blocks west. Filene's basement just a few blocks north for great discount shopping. A CVS drugstore not far away ... we even saw a movie ... the theater was also just a few blocks north. Subway stop very close by. The hotel staff were accomodating. Talk to Sare, the young door/bellman. I think he's a real up and comer in the hospitality field. Very helpful, always smiling ... remembers things ... a good kid. The room was small but adequate, pretty much as advertised. Sharing a washroom was not as bad as I thought it would be ... it's New York after all and no one lounges around the hotel much. One quibble ... I would have expected the shower curtain to be have been magnetized so it didn't ride in on you when you were taking a shower. And just one more thing: there's a small but funky gift shop in the lobby ... it even had three internet stations. This was important, because my wife's laptop wouldn't work in New York due to a company firewall. I must have spent an average of $15 dollars a day on the gift shop internet but I didn't mind due to the convenience. I thought that area of Manhattan would be crawling with Internet Cafes but it wasn't, most locals just go wireless wherever they are. The trouble is, I understand the gift shop will be shutting down in March when the lease is up and the hotel will use the space for something else. If any Belleclaire people are reading this I would urge them to think about setting up their own internet stations in or just off the lobby. Seems like a money maker to me, as they were always busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in NYC's Upper West side. Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: bjohnsonBoston
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in a 2 bedroom "suite" with a bath shared by both rooms. It was advertised as a suite but is really one big room with a 3/4 length wall dividing it in two. Not for a romantic getaway but is great for friends traveling together or a family.

Reviews.Title: “NOT POSH BUT VERY GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: BigFredHead
Reviews.Content: Generally speaking I was very pleased with this hotel and would definitely use it again. The room was basic but contained everything I needed, especially a fridge which was extremely useful. It did smell of smoke when I arrived but this cleared quite quickly. The room did not resemble the photographs on the website in any way which is a bit sneaky but no big problem. The bed was extremely fresh and comfortable. Everything was very clean and the room was serviced every day. However, the hotel looks a bit 'tired' and is in need of a good lick of paint. The shared bathroom, although kept clean needed retiling. I found the service to be very good and the staff helpful. The hotel is situated approx 2 miles out of the centre but the metro is very close and safe and its easily walkable into town. Excellent supermarket and two excellent American diners 2 mintutes walk. For the money - brilliant!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: mia2828
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It is on the Upper West Side, only two blocks from the subway. As a New Yorker (and former Upper West Sider), I was so pleased to find a quiet hotel away from the main tourist areas. My initial room (319) was small and dark and had construction noise. I called the desk and within a few minutes was given room 706, which was larger, had a view, and was very comfortable. The staff is very courteous and helpful. The rooms are modern with the usual conveniences, including a small fridge, and none of the unnecessary extras that add unnecessary cost. The floors are wooden, but we didn't hear any noise from adjacent rooms. Overall, a great value. If you are not from NY and are worried about the location, don't. It is very convenient (near the park, museums, subway, water), very safe, and, in my opinion, infinitely preferable to any typical tourist options

Reviews.Title: “Clean but Out of the Way”
Reviews.Author: LBKMaine
Reviews.Content: Adult sons and I had a two bedroom suite facing an air shaft. True to description, no real room to lounge except the beds which were consistent with the photos. Windows were not. Staff reasonably friendly and helpful. Nearby diner ok and will deliver. Next time, I would stay closer to Battery Park or Mid-Town. This location is a bit out of the way although it is calmer than Times Square for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A shared bath that is not adjacent to your room-in all my travels I have never experienced this.”
Reviews.Author: yiayiaM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the midst of remodeling and our 'view' was of the debris piled on the roof. Upon realizing the shared bath was 'down the hall' and shared by 3 rooms, I produced my handicap placard and explained there was no way I could negotiate down the hall in the middle of the night. It was after 11pm and we were in no condition to find another hotel. With much insistence from my husband and myself, we were given a 'handicap' accesible room and told there was an addition 50$ + fee-per night for the private bathroom. This has got to be a violation of the laws relating to disabled persons. Perhaps I didn't investigate enough, but in 20+ years of travel this is something I had never encountered, even in the most 'economy' grade hotels. The room was nice and newly remodeled and the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, perfect location, great price”
Reviews.Author: DenverNYCtravelers
Reviews.Content: We just loved the Hotel BelleClaire! We were worried about sharing a bathroom, but we found that was no problem, the bathroom was very clean. We had a small room, but the bed was very comfy with the all white bedding, and was very clean. The staff was very nice and the location is awesome!!! Great places to eat from Shake shack for burgers and fries, to gourmet italian dinners.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - rooms, location & service”
Reviews.Author: janelw171
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Belleclaire for 4 nights and throughly enjoyed ourselves. It was a very reasonable price too. The hotel is having renovation work but we were not disturbed at all. The room was spacious with a private bathroom (we paid a bit more for that). Brilliant location, right near Central Park - we explored the whole city and liked the part (Upper Westside) that the hotel was in the best. Only downside is that the air conditioning fan was very loud but luckily we didn't need to use it! Maybe in the height of summer this would have put me off but I loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Will stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: goodthistimeofyear
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room was a 'queen with shared bathroom' and was bigger than we expected. Facing 77th street (NE) there was a nice street view, and sunshine in the morning. Very comfortable bed, good sized tv, chair and suit case horse and wardrobe but no draws. We were missing the information guide but no big deal. The shared bathroom was fine, much less of a drama than we thought, three rooms are though a hall door with a bathroom which is not accessable to other people. The bathroom already had a lot of other peoples toiletries in it, which was no bother, and we therefore left our bathroom bag in there but found it in the hall the next morning (unsure whether this was other guests or the cleaner). Tips: 20min walk to Time Square, 5mins to central park, 2 short blocks to Subway (79th St), 1hr train from JFK, PC with internet in gift shop but no interenet cafes close to hotel, Hair Straightnener may not work because of low USA power voltage, Columbus street has good shopping and restaurants. Check out Big Nicks Pizza, big and fat but the best pizza!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - tolerable for the price.”
Reviews.Author: JusWannaSleep
Reviews.Content: We stayed her with our teenage daughter to do some sightseeing. It is an old hotel with small rooms. We changed rooms initially because the first room was too dirty. The staff was very accommodating.The rooms are not quiet. You do have to choose your room carefully. Our room was on an ally side and we listened to cats howl much of the night. The hotel is close to the Natural History Museum. We were able to walk to Lincoln Center and enjoy an outdoor concert.; tour Central park; find the Dakota and the "Imagine" mosaic. It is very residential in this area so there are many places to eat and drink plus there's a neighborhood grocery nearby. We chose this hotel because of the price and location and for the fact that my wife(native New Yorker) loves the older hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - but avoid rooms at back of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_SG
Reviews.Content: We checked in Aug 22 around noon and were told that our room was not ready yet but that there was another room we could check into. We were tired from the commute to the hotel so we just accepted the room they provided. I asked if it was a similar room to what we had booked and told yes, at the back of the hotel. Long story short- we were right outside the air vents and did not get a good nights sleep while we were there - there was a constant vibrating noise in the room. We were only there 3 nights and spent all day out so I didn't complain until we checked out. If I had known the room would be so noisy I would have just stored the luggage waited til our room was ready - lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base for exploring NYC”
Reviews.Author: lizhoov
Reviews.Content: The biggest assets of the Hotel Bellclaire are its excellent location at 77th and Broadway (2 blocks from the Red Line train) and its very friendly and helpful staff. We were lucky enough to stay in a King size room on the top floor, one of the "turrets", and the view up and down Broadway was amazing! Rooms are small in general but not for NYC standards. Bedding is extremely comfortable, everything was very clean and the bathroom amenities were really upscale. It's always a bit of a wait for the very small elevator but not really that big of a deal. Free WiFi is a nice added touch. We will definitely return here on our next trip to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “looks good online, but doesn't deliver in person.”
Reviews.Author: goodlyeric
Reviews.Content: We looked for hours for a less expensive place to stay on our honeymoon in New York City. Online, this hotel looked amazing! The rooms looked clean and all we could find by way of complaint was that the elevator was small and there were outside noises. My husband and I thought we could handle both. Little did I know that when you sign up for a shared bathroom (which neither of us minded, you never see the other hotel guests) that you sign up for a room barely larger than the queen bed. Also, the tv looked like it had been from the 1960s, the heating was either way to much or not enough and when we went down to complain that they had ripped us off on the room...they refused to help us but said that they couldn't do anything for us, but if we wanted they could move us to a larger room for a more expensive price the next day. I was very upset by how beautiful the rooms appeared be online and how trashy the room turned out to be. We also had made a request before arriving that there be no goose down or feathers in the room...they didn't do anything about it until an hour after we had already been in the room.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok - especially for the price. I'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: cynmari
Reviews.Content: I wasn't overly blown away by the hotel but it was a great value for the price and neighborhood. Pros: comfortable beds, clean, eclectic/european design,calm neighborhood, close to Central Park, friendly staff, hardwood floors, good size room for NYC, refrigerator, free wifi Cons: the main heat/cooling system seemed very close to our room and made a constant humming noise, we had a view of a brick wall outside the window Overall, it was ok. If you have a higher budget you can always stay somewhere nicer but for the money it was pretty decent. I don't think you can find much better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for NYC travel, will be back”
Reviews.Author: iannibo
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in the 6-people suite for 3 nights at the beginning and again at the end of August. I must confess I did book a second, more expensive, hotel for the 2 nights at the end of the month, in case the hotel was disappointing. I quickly canceled that booking after our first stay at Belleclaire: the hotel is very good, our room was big (for NYC standards), clean and had everything you may need plus 2 LCD tv sets and an iPod sound system. Negative points were the lift (only one is working, so be prepared to waiting if you are on a high floor) and the taxi booking for our trip to JFK turned out to be for a 4-seater (we're 6). Other than that, we are very happy with the Belleclaire and will keep it in our address book for further trips to New York. Final tip: the area is very nice and full of eating places, but our personal choice goes to la Bettola, an Italian restaurant on Amtserdam avenue, just around the corner from the hotel: try the "farrotto with mushrooms", you will be delighted.

Reviews.Title: “A Great, Inexpensive Choice”
Reviews.Author: ekeat
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of my room at such an inexpensive price!!! I booked a queen bed room with shared bath. The hotel is in a perfect location (Upper West Side, 2 blocks from the subway) and is impeccably clean and very comfortable. The room was very large for a city hotel. I was a little nervous about having a shared bathroom but the bathroom was extremely clean and shared among 3 rooms only. My room key opened a door to a mini-corridor which provided access to 3 separate rooms and the shared bathroom. It made me feel very comfortable (as a solo, female traveler) that the bathroom was only accessible for the 3 rooms sharing it. The room was spacious, with a very comfortable bed and nice linens. The staff was friendly and courteous. My room was on the 8th floor, near the back of the building, and was very quiet. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Has a European feel”
Reviews.Author: LVFuzz
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Belleclaire is seriously a hidden gem. I am not someone that requirea alot of frills when I stay at a hotel...I merely expect a comfortable bed, clean room/sheets when I request them, & helpful/courteous staff if I were to need something. The Hotel Belleclaire has all of these! One thing to simply remember when reserving a room at the Hotel Belleclaire is get a room with its own bathroom. Some rooms share bathrooms, which is not something I want to do when on vacation. Without boring you, I will break this down with the Pro's & Cons... Pros... Great Location-with a block of 2 different subway stops & straight up Broadway if you were to take a taxi. Very Comfortable Bed-if you are familiar with Crowne Plaza beds, then you will appreciate & enjoy the beds here. Staff is awesome. Cons... Small Bathrooms-no necessarily a con, but unless you've traveled to Europe & experienced there bathrooms, then these bathrooms will be small to you. Obviously an old building-its NY & I'd expect this, but the rooms have hard wood floors, so things can make more noise. When the Intercontinental in Time Square is pushing over $400 a night, the Hotel Belleclaire at half the price is well worth it & is only a few subway stops away.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid competitively priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: andre2410
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Belleclaire for one week with five friends. We didn't expect much, since the price was very low for a Manhattan hotel. But the hotel surprised us in a very positive way! We were a group of young people, who are used to staying in expensive hotels with our parents, and we all agreed that this hotel offered an amazing quality for an exceptionally reasonable price. The rooms are very clean, the cleaning lady comes every day and towels and sheet are also changed daily. The beds could maybe be a bit larger, but since noone of us is 2 meters tall this was no problem. The hotel also pays a lot of attention to details. The room was equipped with an ipod docking station, which we enjoyed a lot. The TVs are nice flat-screens and the red back part of the bed looks lovely. We had free wireless internet, although the speed was subprime, to say the least, at peak times. The staff was very friendly and fulfilled all of our wishes, like looking for restaurant numbers. The other guests were nice as well, for some reason a lot of flight attendends reside in the Belleclaire. There is a bus station just 1 minute from the hotel and the subway lines 1,2 and 3 are 2 minutes away. There is no question, the Belleclaire Hotel offers the most bang for the buck in NYC! I can highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and the surroundings”
Reviews.Author: johanneditlevsen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this gorgeous hotel for 8 nights in august 2008, and we just loved everything about it. We had the most wonderful huge room with a view of Broadway. We had some noise, but that is to be expected with that location. The location on upper west side is fantastic and you have everything just outside the door. We have since stayed on upper east side, but I prefer the west side. The diner in the same building is great for sandwiches and cakes.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Tasteful at a Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: amomaxia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a large business group of about 40 from school on an excursion to New York City, so stayed in a suite with 4 other girls. I was a little apprehensive at first since the hotel seemed to be going extensive renovations when we arrived, so that you could not even see the front exterior of the hotel. Also, it took a little more time than desired to check in. However, once we were able to put away our luggage and sit down in our rooms for a moment, I was pleased with the modern but not over the top decor of the suite. Everything was clean and well organized, and after a long day of business meetings I had no trouble falling asleep in bed. The location seemed very safe, an important factor to consider when you're a young woman staying in a big city, as it is located in the Upper West Side and right next to the prestigious Collegiate School. Also, it was close enough to a few clubs and bars that the cost of a taxi didn't inhibit us from going out. I would definitely recommend the Hotel Belleclaire if you are not planning on spending much time in your hotel room while you are in the city, but still want a pleasant place to relax while you catch your breath, at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel great staff”
Reviews.Author: deadlyfox
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i spent 7 nights at the belleclaire. We were delighted when we arrived to a friendly staff and a very helpful bell boy. we were fortunate enough to be upgraded to a superior suite cause the room was not ready when we arrived. The decor is wonderful, beds were very comfy and having a fridge was a plus. The cleaning staff was great and very trustworthy, the diner across the street is great. The shake shack is two blocks away and has the most amazing burgers around. i would gladly stay again and hope to go back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: markinRB
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the UWS on two consecutive weekends because we had some functions to attend there. The Belleclaire was in the perfect location for us. As a bonus, we were walking distance from the Hudson promenade with a great view of the July 4th fireworks. The staff was always helpful, and eager to be more helpful. They did their best to satisfy requests for room locations, and all the rooms (3) we stayed in were quiet, regardless of orientation. The first room had some cleaning lapses in the bathroom, but after that the rooms were clean. Tip: Only one passenger elevator has been in service for the past five months. Use the freight elevator, or stay on a low floor and use the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jtmiracle
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior King room for 6 nights that was very small with no drawers, no storage space. Tiny bathroom. Okay king bed. Awful rubber pillows. Great view of Hudson River. We left after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of not getting what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: rsearcey
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2 night stay here through expedia for a room with a queen bed and a shared bath. As I was spending little time in the room I didn't feel the shared bath would be an issue. When I arrived to check in the first person I spoke to was unable to find my reservation. After consulting with another employee they were finally able to locate my reservation. When I attempted to enter my room neither of the key cards worked and I was forced to return to the front desk and obtain new keys. Once I was finally I'm the room I was apalled at the tiny bed.
